The Life and Times column from the February issue of the Socialist Standard Is veganism weird That s the question the organisation behind Veganuary asked recently on their website as they urged people to go vegan for January and then if possible to carry on with it forever Of course their answer was no it isn t weird In fact they said it s part of something huge And they had various celebrities on their site backing them eg Joaquin Phoenix Billy Eilish Chris Packham Sarah Pascoe Their statement of intent was Our vision is simple we want a vegan world A world without animal farms and slaughterhouses A world where food production does not decimate forest pollute rivers and oceans exacerbate climate change and drive wild animal populations to extinctions Animal welfareThis took me back many years to when I was a student and anything but a vegan or even vegetarian I remembered being openly and immaturely contemptuous of a fellow student who was vegetarian Little did I know that many years later I myself would decide to go vegetarian and then a long time after that fairly recently in fact vegan How did that happen Well I became a vegetarian when I found the idea of eating the flesh of another sentient being too difficult Later much later when a vegan friend suggested I attend an online talk by a leading advocate of plant based eating the suffering dairy farming brought to animals was also brought home to me and I saw no alternative but to go the whole hog and move to veganism The speaker Dr Klaper described as an internationally recognized clinician teacher and speaker on diet and health told us he had himself grown up on a dairy farm in the USA and that seemed to make his talk on The Most Powerful Strategy for Healing People and the Planet all the more authentic I also found it impressive in that he avoided being openly proselytising simply sticking to simple facts in three key areas animal cruelty human health and the environment While the animal cruelty area was the one of most immediate interest to me I also appreciated the case he put forward in the other two even if I could think of some counter arguments from opponents Veganism effective But what about Veganuary It s certainly possible that if it does result in more people going vegan or vegetarian on a permanent basis or at least eating less meat or fish it might lead to a reduction in the cruelty suffered by animals But would it do much to lessen the hold of animal agriculture over the world s food supply and reduce the raising and slaughtering of vast number of animals almost everywhere An argument often heard that says it wouldn t because the relative monopoly over food production held by a small number of big producers means that even if they respond to a market need to produce vegan alternatives as some of them are in fact doing the effect of this will just be to increase their profits and investment power so allowing them to produce meat and milk products more cheaply and more enticingly than before and thereby potentially increase animal suffering and exploitation And would an increase in veganism do much to solve the climate and environmental problems that the current system s unbridled quest for growth and profit has brought about Some of the effects of what is happening were outlined in a recent article for the Earth Food Life project by Vicky Bond animal welfare scientist and president of the US based Humane League She wrote Factory farming touches every aspect of our planet from emitting massive amounts of greenhouse gases into the atmosphere to contaminating the groundwater rivers lakes and streams we rely on for fresh water Factory farms house animals in crowded and often filthy conditions subjecting millions of cows chickens and pigs to the worst forms of abuse for the entirety of their short lives Driven by the demand for cheap eggs meat and dairy the animal agriculture industry has disastrous consequences for the planet She went on to reveal that in animal agriculture accounted for almost a third of fresh water used globally and that every day in the US it withdrew billion gallons of water from freshwater resources One of the reasons she gave for this was the large quantities of water used by slaughterhouses both in electrified stun baths and in scalding tanks for feathering chickens She went on Because this method of slaughter is so terrifying for chickens they also use vast amounts of water to clean feces and vomit from the chickens bodies afterwards tinyurl com yz crxf Feeding the beastYet it is clear that even if there were a significant reduction in meat eating and so in animal agriculture as Bond would like the environment would continue to be polluted and the climate would keep on warming owing to the demands of the economic system we live under that untameable beast of production for profit Faced with the system s need to feed the beast our food choices would do little to contribute to stopping or reversing ecological deterioration or global warming It is decades too late now for me to apologise to that fellow student for ridiculing his choice of vegetarianism Of course I would if I could since I feel that in a sense that we are on the same side But having said that nothing in the Socialist Party s case for a moneyless marketless society of free access and voluntary cooperation demands adherence to any particular kind of diet That is and will always be a matter of personal choice But the fact is that choice of diet apart the Earth has sufficient resources to feed and house and clothe all its inhabitants to a highly comfortable level a number of times over once we the human species decide to put our natural capacity for cooperation and collaboration to full use and apply those resources to make sure that all whether they choose to be vegan vegetarian or anything else have enough healthy food to eat and the certainty of a decent secure life Failing this under the existing worldwide system of production for profit and buying and selling those who do not have money to buy will go hungry very many more will lead insecure and highly stressed existences human health will not be well safeguarded and the ecosystem will continue to be in imminent danger of collapse Howard Moss

The United States of America often called a melting pot of cultures boasts a diverse culinary landscape that reflects its history of immigration and regional influences From coast to coast the foods Americans eat vary widely but certain dishes and eating habits have become synonymous with American cuisine This article explores the typical foods meals and dining customs that shape the American dietary experience Breakfast The Most Important Meal of the Day Americans often start their day with a hearty breakfast Common breakfast foods include Eggs Scrambled fried or in omelets often served with bacon or sausage Pancakes or waffles Topped with butter and maple syrup Cereal A wide variety of cold cereals served with milk Toast or bagels Often spread with butter cream cheese or peanut butter Oatmeal A warm hearty option especially in colder months Fresh fruits Alone or as a side to other breakfast items For those on the go breakfast might consist of a quick coffee and a pastry from a local caf or a fast food breakfast sandwich Lunch Midday Fuel Lunch in America is typically a lighter meal compared to dinner Common lunch options include Sandwiches From classic peanut butter and jelly to deli meat and cheese Salads Often featuring mixed greens vegetables and protein like chicken or tuna Soups Especially popular in colder weather Leftovers from previous dinners Reheated and enjoyed the next day Fast food Burgers fries and other quick options for busy days Many Americans eat lunch at work or school often bringing packed lunches from home or purchasing food from nearby restaurants or cafeterias Dinner The Main Event Dinner is typically the largest and most significant meal of the day for Americans It s often a time for families to gather and share their day Popular dinner options include Meat dishes Such as grilled chicken steak or pork chops Pasta Spaghetti with meatballs lasagna or mac and cheese Casseroles One dish meals combining proteins vegetables and starches Pizza Both homemade and delivery are common dinner choices Tacos or burritos Reflecting the influence of Mexican cuisine Stir fries Quick vegetable rich meals often served over rice Seafood Fish or shellfish dishes especially in coastal areas Dinners are usually accompanied by side dishes such as steamed or roasted vegetables salads or starches like potatoes or rice Regional Specialties The vast expanse of the United States has led to the development of distinct regional cuisines Southern cuisine Known for fried chicken biscuits and gravy grits and barbecue New England Famous for clam chowder lobster rolls and baked beans Midwest Home to hearty dishes like casseroles and pot roasts Southwest Influenced by Mexican flavors with dishes like chili con carne and fajitas Pacific Northwest Known for fresh seafood and farm to table cuisine Hawaii A unique blend of Polynesian Asian and American flavors Fast Food and Convenience The fast paced American lifestyle has contributed to the popularity of fast food and convenient meal options Fast food chains like McDonald s Burger King and Wendy s are ubiquitous across the country These restaurants typically serve burgers fries chicken sandwiches and other quick portable meals In recent years there s been a growing trend towards healthier fast food options with chains offering salads wraps and plant based alternatives to traditional fast food fare Snacks and Beverages Snacking is a common practice in American culture Popular snacks include Potato chips and other salty snacks Popcorn Nuts and trail mix Fresh fruits and vegetables Cookies and crackers Granola bars As for beverages Americans consume a wide variety of drinks Water Both tap and bottled Soft drinks Carbonated beverages like cola are very popular Coffee A staple for many Americans consumed throughout the day Tea Both hot and iced varieties Fruit juices Beer wine and spirits For adults often consumed with meals or socially Eating Out and Restaurant Culture Dining out is a common practice in America with a wide range of restaurants catering to every taste and budget From casual diners and family restaurants to upscale fine dining establishments Americans have countless options when eating out Ethnic restaurants are also prevalent offering cuisines from around the world Chinese Italian Mexican and Indian restaurants are particularly common reflecting the diverse cultural influences on American eating habits Health and Dietary Trends In recent years there has been a growing awareness of health and nutrition in America leading to several dietary trends Organic and locally sourced foods Plant based diets including vegetarianism and veganism Gluten free and dairy free options Low carb and ketogenic diets Intermittent fasting Superfoods and functional foods Many Americans are now more conscious of their food choices reading nutrition labels and seeking out healthier alternatives to traditional favorites Holiday and Celebratory Foods Certain foods are closely associated with American holidays and celebrations Thanksgiving Turkey stuffing cranberry sauce and pumpkin pie Fourth of July Barbecued meats corn on the cob and watermelon Christmas Ham or roast beef mashed potatoes and cookies Super Bowl Sunday Wings chips and dip and pizza These foods play a significant role in American culture bringing people together and creating shared experiences around meals Conclusion The American diet is as diverse as its population reflecting a rich tapestry of cultural influences regional specialties and evolving health trends From hearty breakfasts to family dinners fast food to fine dining the foods Americans eat tell a story of innovation convenience and tradition While certain dishes and eating habits may be considered typically American the country s cuisine continues to evolve embracing new flavors and adapting to changing lifestyles and health consciousness Understanding what people eat in America provides insight not just into their diets but into the cultural social and economic factors that shape American society as a whole

acti veg For anyone wanting to live a healthy more ethical and sustainable life in I would recommend that you consider veganism I made the switch in January years ago and can honestly say it is one of the most unequivocally positive decisions I have ever made It could be for you too Going vegan and advocating for the rights of animals is an act of protest against a corporate system that treats sentient beings as mere objects commodities to be bought and sold as property Animal agriculture industries breed animals into unhealthy bodies exploit them for profit then slaughter them at a tiny fraction of their life expectancy Most animals are killed when they re little more than infants Adopting a plant based diet is the single biggest dietary change you can make to reduce your carbon footprint by up to Eating plant based requires less land less water fewer crops and can be up to cheaper There is a broad scientific consensus that plant based diets can be perfectly healthy with organisations like the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics and the NHS in agreement Those who still think that vegans cannot be healthy in are denying decades of nutritional research and must find it hard to explain how committed vegan athletes are competing at the highest levels of sport There are significant barriers that prevent some people from adopting a plant based diet whether that is because of health issues a difficult living situation or limited food availability But veganism is about avoiding animal exploitation as far as is possible and practicable It s about doing your best whatever that looks like Just honestly ask yourself if you can be healthy while living a more humane more sustainable lifestyle why not give it a try

In today s fast paced world making healthy choices can sometimes be a challenge That s where professional advice from a Nutritionist Dietitian in Dubai can help Whether you are struggling with a specific health condition aiming to improve your overall well being or simply want guidance on maintaining a balanced diet a nutritionist or dietitian can provide personalized support and actionable insights But who exactly can benefit from their expertise Let s explore the diverse groups of people who can significantly improve their health with professional nutritional guidance Individuals with Chronic Health Conditions People who are living with chronic health conditions such as diabetes hypertension or heart disease can greatly benefit from tailored dietary plans Nutritionists and dietitians have the knowledge to recommend specific foods that can manage or even improve these conditions For instance someone with diabetes can receive guidance on how to balance carbohydrates and control blood sugar levels through food choices while someone with high blood pressure can learn which foods help reduce sodium intake and support cardiovascular health Athletes and Fitness Enthusiasts For athletes fitness enthusiasts and anyone pursuing an active lifestyle the right diet is just as important as training Nutritionists and dietitians can provide customized meal plans that help optimize performance enhance recovery and prevent injury They can guide athletes in fueling their bodies with the proper nutrients before and after workouts ensuring maximum energy levels muscle growth and overall stamina Those Looking to Lose or Gain Weight Weight management is a common concern for many people whether it s shedding a few pounds or gaining muscle A nutritionist or dietitian can create a plan tailored to your individual goals ensuring you receive the right balance of nutrients while avoiding fad diets that may not be sustainable With their professional advice you can safely navigate your weight loss or weight gain journey without compromising your health Pregnant Women and New Mothers Pregnancy and breastfeeding require special attention to nutrition as both the mother and baby need adequate nutrients for health and development A nutritionist or dietitian can help ensure that pregnant women are meeting their increased nutritional needs and provide advice on which foods can support a healthy pregnancy After childbirth new mothers can also benefit from advice on maintaining energy levels and balancing nutrients while managing the demands of caring for a newborn Children and Teenagers Proper nutrition is vital during the growing years For children and teenagers balanced meals support growth development and academic performance A nutritionist or dietitian can help parents navigate the sometimes picky eating habits of children and provide practical tips for ensuring their kids get the right nutrition Whether it s guiding through childhood obesity or helping teenagers build healthy habits that last a lifetime professional advice can make a huge difference Individuals with Digestive Issues Those suffering from digestive problems like irritable bowel syndrome IBS gluten sensitivity or food intolerances can greatly benefit from a nutritionist s or dietitian s expertise These professionals can help identify problematic foods and recommend alternatives to ensure that individuals are still getting a balanced and nutritious diet They can also help with meal planning to reduce symptoms and improve overall gut health Elderly Adults As we age our nutritional needs change and maintaining proper nutrition becomes even more critical For seniors a dietitian can assist in addressing concerns like weight loss bone health and managing age related conditions like osteoporosis or arthritis They can also provide advice on maintaining a balanced diet that supports cognitive function and enhances energy levels for a higher quality of life Individuals Seeking Preventative Health Even if you don t currently have a specific health condition seeking nutritionist and dietitian advice can be a proactive approach to better health Many people turn to nutritionists and dietitians to learn how to reduce their risk of developing chronic diseases in the future By adopting healthier eating habits early on you can improve your immune system reduce inflammation and prevent conditions such as obesity heart disease and even some cancers People Interested in Sustainable Eating Habits In today s world many people are becoming more conscious of the environmental impact of their food choices A nutritionist or dietitian can help individuals who are transitioning to plant based diets veganism or other sustainable eating habits They can ensure that individuals are still receiving the necessary nutrients like protein iron and calcium while following eco friendly or ethical dietary practices Individuals with Eating Disorders For those struggling with eating disorders like anorexia bulimia or binge eating disorder a nutritionist or dietitian can offer crucial support These professionals can work alongside therapists and medical practitioners to create a nutritional rehabilitation plan that supports mental and physical health They provide the tools to build a healthier relationship with food and develop balanced eating habits Conclusion Nutritionists and Dietitian Dubai offer invaluable support for anyone looking to improve their health regardless of their stage in life or lifestyle choices Whether you re dealing with a health issue embarking on a fitness journey or simply aiming for a more balanced life seeking advice from a Nutritionist Dietitian in Dubai could be a transformative step Their tailored plans and expert guidance can help you make informed sustainable food choices that benefit your long term well being So why not take charge of your health today and explore how a nutritionist or dietitian can help you live your best life

Billie Eilish made the decision to cut all animal products out of her diet when she was and has encouraged fans to choose plant based options But what does following a plant based diet mean and how is it different from vegetarianism or veganism

In the quest for longevity and health Blue Zones areas where people live significantly longer lives have captured global attention Exercise social interaction and a focus on plant forward eating are common traits of the five global Blue Zones namely Sardinia Italy Okinawa Japan the Nicoya Peninsula in Costa Rica Ikaria Greece and Loma Linda CA in the US Could new Blue Zones emerge in the US Insights from Forbes Health and HappyCow are pointing to three US cities where the Blue Zones habits echo those of locales where people tend to live the longest The cities with emerging Blue Zones and where plant based fare is king are Los Angeles CA Portland OR and New York City according to the insights Common traits of Blue Zones The methodologies of Forbes Health and HappyCow while distinct in their focus share a common theme in evaluating factors that contribute to healthier and more sustainable living environments Forbes Health s approach is centered on identifying potential Blue Zones within the US by examining a range of lifestyle factors including the availability of plant based foods levels of physical activity community engagement sleep patterns life expectancy and the presence of centenarians Bruna Bronco Pexels HappyCow on the other hand specifically targets the vegan friendly nature of cities by assessing the density and variety of vegan businesses including restaurants shops and bakeries within a kilometer mile radius of city centers The growth of vegan businesses and qualitative factors such as the ease of finding vegan options and the city s overall engagement with veganism are also crucial components of HappyCow s evaluation The overlap in these methodologies suggests a significant link between the rise of vegan friendly cities and the characteristics of Blue Zones Both approaches recognize the importance of plant based diets in promoting health and longevity Whether you re already embracing a vegan lifestyle or just beginning to explore it we strongly advocate for supporting local vegan enterprises HappyCow founder Eric Brent said in a statement These top cities boast a remarkable array of delicious compassionate and healthy cuisine Los Angeles a vegan haven in California In Los Angeles the vegan scene despite a percent decline in the number of vegan businesses since HappyCow s last report in continues to be vibrant and diverse The city boasts fully vegan restaurants alongside a total of vegan businesses Ubuntu Upscale dining options such as Shojin and Crossroads Kitchen offer luxurious plant based cuisine while affordable options like Cena Vegan and Baba s Vegan Cafe cater to budget conscious consumers Unique spots such as Justine s Wine Bar Besties Vegan Paradise and vegan ghost kitchens such as Lucky Catsu exemplify the city s rich and varied vegan offerings Despite the geographic spread of these options Los Angeles maintains its reputation as a vegan haven Moreover celebrity backed concepts such as TikTok favorite Mr Charlie s continue to bring a celebrity flare to LA s plant based food scene Los Angeles has a vibrant vegan community hosting regular events like Vegan Exchange and more all friendly places for vegans to connect HappyCow s Emma Cebuliak tells VegNews Despite California s ranking as the tenth place in Forbes Health s list largely due to its lower walkability score and higher percentage of inactive adults Los Angeles shines in its number of vegan and vegetarian restaurants The state s commitment to plant based eating Forbes Health found is evident in its robust number of vegan and or vegetarian establishments signaling a shift towards the dietary patterns celebrated in Blue Zones Portland OR a pioneer in the sustainable vegan lifestyle Portland showcases a high density of vegan establishments relative to its population The city features all vegan restaurants vegan businesses and a total of listings on HappyCow Chubby Bunny PDX Chubby Bunny cocktail resto bar June and Mirisata which serves Sri Lankan cuisine are just a few of the city s more casual vegan spots Feral offers an upscale dining experience with a focus on foraged and wild food Unique destinations such as El Salto PDX serving Venezuelan comfort foods Baby Ketten Klub a vegan karaoke bar and Ice Queen a frozen dessert bar highlight Portland s diverse and thriving vegan culture Portland stands out globally for its high density of vegan businesses including bakeries shops and other vegan venues having one for every people Cebuliak says In line with the Blue Zone criteria the state of Oregon where Portland is the largest city ranked seventh in Forbes Health s analysis primarily due to its high number of vegetarian vegan restaurants which comes to approximately per million residents Additionally the state s emphasis on adequate sleep with percent of adults getting seven hours of sleep per night plays a crucial role in overall health and longevity New York City a melting pot of vegan diversity In New York City didn t make HappyCow s top but is different This year the Big Apple comes in at number nine Ras Plant Based Often hailed as the international food capital NYC still offers an astonishing variety of plant based options Eateries such as Chloe Ras Plant Based Aunt Et Uncles and May Kaidee highlight the diversity serving everything from artisanal plates to the finest Thai cuisine The city s commitment to veganism doesn t stop at restaurants Vegan bakeries including Rawsome Treats are becoming staple destinations for those seeking plant based indulgence NYC is where to get your vegan fast food fix too with options such as Jerrell s Betr Brgr Slutty Vegan and PLNT Burger all available to residents throughout the city Forbes Health s analysis found that approximately percent of New Yorkers meet their daily fruit intake and percent meet their vegetable requirements surpassing national averages The city s high walk score indicative of pedestrian friendly environments aligns with the Blue Zone characteristic of natural movement promoting daily physical activity in urban life One added health bonus here is that the city has implemented several initiatives in schools and hospitals to make plant based eating more accessible and appealing to New Yorkers Future Blue Zones In New York Los Angeles and Portland the growth of the vegan lifestyle mirrors the traits first identified in by National Geographic fellow Dan Buettner that Blue Zones have in common such as diets heavy in plant based foods natural physical activity strong community ties and stress reduction techniques KBO Bike Unsplash As such the availability and accessibility of plant based foods in these cities reflect a deeper understanding of health and the environment The emphasis on natural movement aligns with the Blue Zone principle of incorporating physical activity into daily life Moreover the sense of community particularly evident in the strong vegan scenes of these cities echoes the social connectedness observed in Blue Zones Blue Zones exhibit a holistic approach to living at the intersection of diet and lifestyle Cebuliak says In this regard Portland and Los Angeles could be considered leaders in North America for their plant based food accessibility and supportive vegan communities In addition to New York California and Oregon Forbes Health also points to Vermont Massachusetts Connecticut Rhode Island New Hampshire Hawaii and Maine as states with the highest Blue Zone traits Palm Springs wasn t named in the research but the Californian city also recently launched its own Blue Zones Project in a bid to improve the health and wellbeing of its residents More than people live in Palm Springs and the new million community focused initiative which is backed by local healthcare organizations aims to help identify key areas where their quality of life can be improved This will include making the city more walkable for example increasing the accessibility of healthy food The ultimate goal is to see a much healthier and happier community said Geoff Kors a former Palm Springs City Council member and mayor in a statement There are a lot of people who are isolated If we can see ourselves increase the positives while decreasing the negative health impacts that is the goal New international Blue Zones Outside of the US HappyCow has named Mexico City Lisbon Amsterdam Ho Chi Minh City Barcelona Berlin and its top city London as leaders in plant based food options It s encouraging to observe a growing mainstream trend towards vegan options in urban areas building momentum as more people relate their health the environment and animal welfare to their plate Cebuliak says We believe this has the potential to catalyze significant lifestyle shifts with plant based eating becoming a default choice for many Cebuliak says This could lead to a collective improvement in health outcomes and a greater public consciousness regarding sustainable living

What is the Flexitarian Diet The flexitarian diet is a semi vegetarian approach that primarily emphasizes plant based foods while allowing occasional consumption of meat and animal products Unlike strict veganism or vegetarianism this flexible plant based lifestyle makes it easier for individuals to embrace healthier eating habits without feeling restricted Why is Flexitarianism Growing in Health BenefitsStudies show that reducing meat intake can lower the risk of heart disease diabetes and obesity while improving digestion and longevity Sustainability MattersWith climate change concerns escalating many are choosing plant based diets to reduce their carbon footprint and minimize environmental impact Budget Friendly EatingMeat and dairy can be expensive A flexitarian diet encourages the consumption of affordable nutrient dense plant based proteins like lentils beans and tofu No Strict RulesThe biggest advantage of flexitarianism is that it s realistic and adaptable You don t have to give up meat entirely just eat less of it How to Transition to a Flexitarian Diet Start with Small ChangesTry Meatless Mondays or substitute one meal a day with a plant based alternative Experiment with Plant Based ProteinsIncorporate chickpeas tempeh mushrooms quinoa and nuts to ensure you re getting enough protein Reimagine Your PlateFill half of your plate with vegetables a quarter with whole grains and a quarter with lean protein plant based whenever possible Try Meat SubstitutesOpt for jackfruit pulled pork lentil based burgers or cauliflower steaks instead of traditional meat dishes Plan Your MealsHaving a meal plan makes it easier to stick to your flexitarian goals while ensuring balanced nutrition Listen to Your BodyIf you feel like having meat occasionally that s okay The goal is progress not perfection The Future of FlexitarianismIn the flexitarian lifestyle is more than just a trend it s a sustainable way of eating that supports both personal health and planetary well being Whether you re transitioning for health environmental or ethical reasons this balanced approach to plant based eating makes it easier to stick with long term Ready to Go Flexitarian Are you considering the flexitarian diet this year Share your thoughts or favorite plant based recipes in the comments

Something I often see on social media is farmers objecting to vegan advocacy on the grounds that vegans know nothing about animal husbandry Because vegans aren t engaged in the business the story goes they don t understand just how well farmers really do look after their livestock Unfortunately this criticism rather misses the point I think Continue reading Farmers Defending Animal Welfare Miss the Point

In the latest episode of Lives Well Lived the podcast I co host with Kasia de Lazari Radek we talk to musician activist and author Moby about his journey his unexpected rise to stardom in the electronic dance music scene the lows of alcohol and drug abuse the sense that he was a has been dispelled by the success of his album Play which brought him even greater fame but led to a period of deep depression He tells us also about what matters to him now living simply appreciating nature and animal rights Moby has spent decades using his platform to champion veganism environmental sustainability and ethical living His music has shaped generations but beyond the beats his activism has driven important conversations about factory farming corporate influence and the moral obligations we have toward animals From his early punk rock days to his deep philosophical reflections on ethics suffering and meaning Moby s perspective is as thought provoking as it is passionate In our conversation we explore the paradox of loving animals while eating them the influence of Animal Liberation on his life and the role of music in activism Moby also opens up about his changing religious beliefs the dangers of nostalgia and how he finds meaning in nature creativity and service to others Below are some highlights from our conversation lightly edited for clarity You can listen to the full episode on Apple Podcasts Spotify or your preferred platform Bold Reasoning with Peter Singer is a reader supported publication To receive new posts and support my work consider becoming a free or paid subscriber On What He Values Most in Life KASIA If you were to introduce yourself not by what you do but by what you value most in life how would you describe yourself MOBY Oh boy What a great question I m trying to think of a succinct way of addressing that From my perspective the single most important thing in my life is working on behalf of animal rights There are many other things in life that I love that I value that I enjoy but everything from my perspective pales in comparison to the issue of animal rights for all the reasons that should go without saying but always bear repeating nonetheless The fact that we re killing one trillion animals a year and in the process destroying the only home we have and each one of those animals dies miserable and suffering incapable of living their own life according to their will And the result of that is also pandemics obesity cancer heart disease climate change biodiversity loss etc It s all the stuff that we know So I apologize for preaching to the choir as it were But my succinct answer would be that the most important thing in my life is working on behalf of animal rights and trying to figure out the most effective way of doing so On How He Became Vegan KASIA So tell us how did you get to that point to realize that MOBY Well I grew up and spoiler alert it involves per cent of the people I m talking to I grew up like almost everyone else I was a poor white trash kid in the suburbs and I was surrounded by rescued animals We had dogs and cats and lab rats and mice and even iguanas And I loved our rescued animals unconditionally But I also paradoxically loved Burger King and pepperoni pizza and salami sandwiches And because that is or was and continues to be the dominant paradigm I never questioned it Because that was how everyone I knew everyone I knew loved their companion animals and they loved eating hamburgers And when I was years old I took a step back and realized that our companion animals are the same as the animals we re eating And that was when I discovered there wasn t much in the world of animal rights literature but luckily in my local library there was a book by an author you might ve heard his name is Peter Singer and it was called Animal Liberation Then I discovered Diet for a New America and I realized it s just impossible to wrap our heads around it once we become aware of it the paradox of loving animals while torturing killing and eating them Thanks for reading Bold Reasoning with Peter Singer This post is public so feel free to share it Share On the Cultural Influence of Punk Rock PETER But I m curious whether the punk rock scene made a difference to you because I know you played in some punk rock underground bands when you were young right And of course then you made this movie a punk rock music video about vegans in the punk rock movement Was that an influence too MOBY Yeah I mean the journey that led me to becoming an animal rights activist was on one hand academic Through your book through other literature I could find and I ve been a philosophy major as well so reading Jeremy Bentham and even reading Kant and recognizing oh it s the intersection of logic and ethics you know and epistemology as well Like animals suffer That s observable What s the rational response to a suffering being To try and end their suffering or limit their suffering and not be involved in causing it So it was the academic side but then the cultural aspect is the most confusing because I do think most of us grow up with the idea that if it s legal if it s acceptable if it s a dominant part of our cultural paradigm it must be okay The powers that be wouldn t let institutions survive if they were profoundly unethical And you could even point to the arc of the moral universe you know you could say well at one point women couldn t vote then they were given the vote And at one point we owned slaves and clearly we recognized that was bad so we stopped doing it On Whether Music Can Inspire Change KASIA Do you think that music can be a good motivator for people to change their lives MOBY It s a great question because there s precedent for that I mean obviously the last hundred and some odd years there s a lot of precedent for activist musicians and activist music And I guess from my perspective the two ways of looking at it is on one hand there are you know songs and lyrics that are very explicit in dealing with an issue I think of Billie Holiday s Strange Fruit or Neil Young Ohio or Public Enemy songs Clash songs Kendrick Lamar songs that are very issue oriented But then the other aspect of it I hope I m not an apologist for my approach but the other aspect is the people like me who aren t very good at writing issue oriented lyrics So my music tends to not be very issue oriented but it gives me the platform I have The only value it has is addressing the issues that I think are important Leave a comment On What Brings Him Joy KASIA So where are your pleasures now MOBY First and foremost nature You know that is forgive me if this sounds too esoteric anything that points to a sort of non human complexity hiking up a mountain being surrounded by nature that has nothing to do with humans going to the desert and looking at environments that are million years old listening to music and working on music not for the commerce of it but for the sublime aspects of it And so it s even eating my friends are embarrassed of me because if we re out eating I ll sometimes talk about how from my perspective a single black bean has more theological weight than everything that humans have ever written At that point they just are like okay why did we invite you out for dinner Like just stay home and talk to the trees Bold Frank Medrano is a renowned fitness icon in the world of calisthenics captivating millions with his incredible physique gravity defying moves and inspiring journey This article delves deep into the life and career of Frank Medrano uncovering little known facts and interesting stories that have shaped his path to success Early Life and Fitness Journey While specific details about his family background and education remain relatively private Frank Medrano was born on May However there is some conflicting information online with some sources suggesting he may be older His fitness journey began in his late s when after a period of unhealthy choices that led to weight gain and diminished self confidence he decided to reclaim his health Medrano initially turned to traditional weight training in a gym where he began to see positive results However he soon felt limited by the constraints of gym workouts and sought a more comprehensive and fulfilling approach to fitness This desire led him to the world of calisthenics a form of exercise that utilizes bodyweight and gravity to build strength and endurance Inspired by other calisthenics professionals like Devin Sosa Medrano embarked on his calisthenics journey He started with demanding exercises like typewriter pull ups gradually mastering them and developing his unique aesthetic calisthenics style In July Medrano married his love Antoinette Pacheco Rise to Fame Medrano s rise to fame can be attributed to his unwavering dedication perseverance and innovative approach to calisthenics He filmed his first video showcasing his impressive skills and shared it online where it amassed over million views This marked the beginning of his journey as a fitness icon His social media presence played a pivotal role in his ascent to stardom He actively engaged with his followers sharing workout routines motivational quotes and insights into his vegan lifestyle His authenticity and approachability resonated with people worldwide inspiring them to embrace calisthenics and a healthier lifestyle In June Medrano collaborated with Prime Video for a promo of their show The Terminal List further expanding his reach and influence Training Methods Frank Medrano s training methods are deeply rooted in the principles of calisthenics emphasizing bodyweight exercises and functional strength He is a firm believer in mastering the basics and gradually progressing to more challenging moves He trains six days a week often for up to two hours a day Medrano primarily trains outdoors viewing the world as his fitness park He encourages people to use everyday objects for training turning stairs into platforms for push ups and tree branches into makeshift pull up bars This unconventional approach emphasizes the accessibility and adaptability of calisthenics making it possible for anyone to train anywhere Training Philosophy Medrano s training philosophy revolves around consistency perseverance and self belief He encourages people to find what they enjoy and modify exercises to make them fun and engaging He emphasizes the importance of listening to your body avoiding overtraining and prioritizing rest and recovery He also advocates for studying your pain viewing it as a compass for potential He believes that pushing through discomfort during training is essential for building strength and achieving progress However he also stresses the importance of modifying exercises that are not enjoyable to prevent burnout and maintain motivation Medrano s philosophy extends beyond physical fitness He sees calisthenics as a school of life teaching valuable lessons in discipline resilience and self improvement He believes that calisthenics empowers individuals to take control of their minds and bodies ultimately leading to a more fulfilling life While he focuses on natural body strength Medrano acknowledges the role of supplements in supporting overall training goals He has explored different approaches to optimize energy and stamina including supplements like Fildena which some athletes use to improve blood flow and boost endurance Superhuman Bodyweight Domination Program Frank Medrano is the creator of the superhuman bodyweight domination program a comprehensive training system designed to help individuals achieve peak physical fitness using calisthenics The program emphasizes mastering fundamental bodyweight exercises and progressing to more advanced moves ultimately leading to a strong functional and aesthetically pleasing physique The program caters to individuals of all fitness levels from beginners to experienced athletes It provides personalized workout plans customized meal plans and ongoing support to help participants achieve their fitness goals Diet Frank Medrano is a dedicated vegan advocating for the benefits of a plant based diet for both physical and mental well being He adopted veganism after learning about its positive impact on energy levels and recovery times from his friends Dan Attanasio and Noel Polanco Nutrition His diet consists primarily of whole foods with a focus on vegetables fruits legumes and whole grains He emphasizes the importance of consuming nutrient rich foods to fuel workouts and support recovery His favorite food is lentils a staple in his plant based diet Medrano s vegan lifestyle challenges the misconception that meat consumption is necessary for building muscle and strength He is a living testament to the power of plant based nutrition in achieving optimal fitness He has achieved his impressive physique while adhering to a strict vegan diet challenging conventional bodybuilding norms He has also partnered with TRU to sell an anti inflammatory smoothie further promoting the benefits of plant based nutrition Awards and Recognition While specific details about awards and competitions won remain unclear Frank Medrano s impact and recognition as a calisthenics icon are undeniable He has amassed a large following on social media and inspired countless individuals to embrace calisthenics His dedication to fitness and his motivational message have earned him widespread recognition in the fitness community Interesting Stories and Little Known Facts Overcoming Adversity Medrano faced a significant setback when he suffered a toe infection that led to dizziness depression and a temporary halt in his training This period was particularly challenging for Medrano as he is a highly physical individual who thrives on activity and pushing his limits However he used this time to re evaluate his priorities and focus on his recovery He eventually overcame the infection and returned to training with renewed vigor using the experience as motivation to inspire others to persevere through challenges Mindset Training Medrano emphasizes the importance of mindset training in achieving fitness goals He believes that a strong mindset is crucial for overcoming self doubt and pushing physical limitations He often shares motivational quotes and messages on his social media platforms encouraging his followers to cultivate a positive mindset and believe in their abilities Almost Quitting In a candid post on his YouTube community page Medrano revealed that he almost quit calisthenics after a handstand accident that landed him in the emergency room with stitches and injured shins He described feeling discouraged and questioning whether the pursuit of calisthenics was worth the risk However he ultimately decided to persevere driven by his passion for fitness and his desire to inspire others This experience highlights his resilience and determination in the face of adversity Unique Training Approach Medrano s training routine includes a combination of calisthenics weight training and HIIT workouts He believes in incorporating variety to challenge different muscle groups and prevent plateaus This approach demonstrates his adaptability and willingness to explore different training modalities to achieve optimal fitness The Human Flag Medrano is widely recognized for his mastery of the human flag a challenging calisthenics move that requires exceptional core strength and body control This move has become synonymous with his name and is a testament to his dedication and skill in calisthenics Admiration for Nathane Jackson Medrano looks up to vegan fitness competitor and model Nathane Jackson for inspiration This admiration highlights his respect for fellow athletes who embody the principles of veganism and fitness Inspirational Quotes Frank Medrano is known for his motivational messages and inspiring quotes that encourage people to pursue their fitness goals and live a healthier life Here are a few examples Your reaction to failure is a test of your passion it helps you find out if you really want to reach your target Most people underestimate how strong and creative they are In calisthenics you start with a single rep After that you decide where the journey will take you Give your body some fresh impetus Have you noticed how you always take the same route to work Try a different route today The same applies to your training Stay Humble Be Positive Support Anyone Who Decides To Put In Their Effort To Better Themselves Current Projects and Future Goals Frank Medrano continues to inspire and motivate people through his online programs workshops and social media presence He offers personalized workout plans customized meal plans and ongoing support to help individuals achieve their fitness goals He has also developed a fitness app that provides access to his training plans and programs making it easier for people to follow his guidance and achieve results Medrano is also involved in the development of outdoor training equipment through his company Physical Factory This venture aims to provide people with the tools and resources to engage in calisthenics and embrace a healthier lifestyle Medrano s future goals include expanding his reach and impact in the fitness world He aims to create a global movement around calisthenics empowering individuals to unlock their full potential and transform their lives Conclusion Frank Medrano s journey is a testament to the transformative power of calisthenics and a plant based lifestyle He has overcome challenges defied limitations and inspired millions with his dedication and passion His story exemplifies the importance of perseverance self belief and a commitment to health in achieving fitness goals and living a more fulfilling life Medrano s unique approach to training his emphasis on mindset and his unwavering dedication to veganism challenge conventional fitness norms and inspire people to embrace a holistic approach to well being He encourages everyone to view their bodies as powerful tools capable of achieving incredible feats of strength and athleticism To learn more about Frank Medrano and his training programs visit his website or follow him on social media Take the first step towards unlocking your full potential and embark on your own calisthenics journey today Works cited Frank Is the Veganuary campaign really driving changes in British eating habits Published January pm CETAuthorChris BryantHonorary Research Associate Department of Psychology University of Bath Disclosure statementChris Bryant is the Director of Bryant Research which works with alternative protein companies and animal protection non profits to advance the protein transition Partners University of Bath provides funding as a member of The Conversation UK View all partners We believe in the free flow of informationRepublish our articles for free online or in print under Creative Commons licence Republish this article Since launching in Veganuary has boasted increasing sign ups year on year But what s the evidence that the campaign that encourages people to adopt a vegan diet during January is really taking a bite out of the meat market More than people signed up in and it s likely that these figures which only account for people who officially signed up on the Veganuary website represent just a fraction of all those who took part without signing up Veganuary is a campaign which encourages people to try veganism in January The Veganuary charity a UK based non profit behind the campaign counts Deborah Meaden Joaquin Phoenix and Chris Packham among its ambassadors Official Veganuary signups have increased every year since it began in In a paper we published last year we highlighted Veganuary as the most well known and participated in meat free challenge More than three quarters of British people have heard of Veganuary One in ten have considered taking part and claim to have taken part That equates to around four million people significantly more than the official participation numbers Three out of four British people have heard of Veganuary and one in six have at least thought about taking part So why has Veganuary succeeded where so many other efforts to curb our problematic meat consumption have failed There are two reasons as outlined in our recent study A weekly email with evidence based analysis from Europe s best scholarsGet our newsletterFirst Veganuary invites people to try a vegan diet at a time of year when people are often open to trying healthy new habits Capitalising on an annual time of change can help to overcome any inertia that normally prevents people trying vegan diets Second Veganuary is a social experience People can connect with others attempting the same challenge The sense of camaraderie and community is something that Veganuary participants frequently comment on having enjoyed Encouragingly Veganuary s survey of participants indicates that would recommend the experience to a friend Moreover of participants intended to cut their previous animal product consumption at least in half beyond the end of January and said they intend to stay vegan So Veganuary makes sense in terms of social psychology Lots of people have taken part and plenty say they ll cut down on meat in the longer term But what evidence is there that Veganuary has made a real impact on dietary habits Veganuary s rapid rise has been concurrent with a broader trend towards veganism and meat reduction in the UK Total per capita meat consumption fell from to at the same time as sales of vegetarian food increased significantly The recent increase in the number of people embracing meat free diets in the UK is shown in the graph below in particular the number of vegans has increased in the past five years The rate of veganism in the UK has increased by since So Veganuary came to exist and grew rapidly during a time of increasing UK interest in veganism Could that have been a simple coincidence Researchers at the London School of Economics looked at more than million meals sold in workplace cafeterias between and Crucially the workplaces began their Veganuary campaigns halfway through this period in The researchers estimated that Veganuary increased sales of vegan products by in the the campaigns and had a lasting impact on sales of vegan products Sales data from UK supermarkets indicate that during Veganuary sales increased for plant based foods which were on promotion but not for those which were not on promotion according to a University of Oxford study Veganuary has also increased sales of plant based products at UK grocery stores A team at the University of Surrey studied sales of plant based and animal products at UK grocery stores from November until March and found that Veganuary increased sales of plant based products by a huge during January Sales also remained higher after Veganuary compared to before the month long campaign That said there was no significant change in meat consumption observed during the same period Curious about Veganuary s far reaching impact I searched Google News to estimate the number of published news stories about veganism during January compared to the rest of the year In January there was an average increase in the number of media articles about veganism compared to other months between and evidence that Veganuary increases public attention on veganism related issues Media stories mentioning veganism were higher in January between and Next I used Google Trends to investigate seasonal trends in the number of people actively seeking out information on veganism The data in the graph shows some of the clearest evidence yet for the Veganuary effect with clear spikes in search activity every January Moreover interest appears to begin rising right around the time that Veganuary began in UK Google searches about veganism peak every January and started increasing around when Veganuary began Finally I tracked down the dataset from an unpublished survey of vegans conducted in because I knew it contained data on a very specific question The survey which the researcher kindly shared with me asked more than vegans when they changed their diet to the nearest three month period Using this data I created this graph which shows clear spikes with more people turning vegan in the first quarter of the year and an increase starting around or slightly before Veganuary began in Self reported dates of when UK vegans changed their diets shows clear peaks in January One piece of data stands out most of all When Veganuary asked participants about their number one motivation for taking part said the environment and said their health but said animal welfare Animals were the most frequent main motivation for Veganuary participants Indeed the data indicates that the messages inspiring the most dietary change are not about carbon emissions but about animal cruelty Almost nobody in the UK views common animal farming practices as acceptable yet while cow burps are within the range of acceptable dinner party conversation knives in throats typically are not Meat consumption largely remains a social norm but that may well be about to shift The social tipping point whereby enough people adopt a new norm for it to catch on is estimated to be around In the UK the number of people consuming meat free diets is now up to Veganuary could soon nudge us towards a vital cultural tipping point Hear from more scholars in EuropeThere are millions of people who are working to find solutions to our biggest problems In our weekly email which I help curate you will get a balanced news diet that doesn t leave you exhausted but energised and hopeful about European matters Laura HoodPolitics Editor Assistant Editor The Conversation UK https theconversation com

you think about a vegan diet A A vegan diet is plant based and forgoes all animal products Many people choose to eat this way out of concern for animals the environment or their health or for The trend of vegetarianism is unstoppable Whether for health environmental protection or economic reasons more and more people are reducing their meat intake Vegetarianism has quietly become a significant trend affecting the global food market In the face of a volatile global economy and escalating food prices a vegetarian diet emerges as a savvy and cost effective choice Photo via Pixabay com LOS ANGELES CA Merxwire As global economic pressures rise increasing food prices have led many to reconsider their dietary choices Research suggests that a vegetarian diet benefits health and significantly reduces food expenses Meat prices fluctuate more than plant based foods such as legumes vegetables and grains which are generally more affordable and stable The growing number of flexitarians has also expanded the market for plant based food options allowing consumers to save money while maintaining a balanced diet With economic uncertainty and soaring food prices worldwide many households are searching for more cost effective dietary solutions According to the International Food Policy Research Institute IFPRI meat prices have increased much more than plant based foods over the past few years As a result many people are reducing meat consumption and opting for more affordable and stable alternatives like legumes grains and vegetables further driving the popularity of flexitarianism In addition to economic considerations health factors are also why many people choose vegetarianism According to previous studies vegetarians are less likely to be hospitalized for cardiovascular disease and less likely to suffer from fatal heart disease Reducing the intake of red and processed meat can also reduce the risk of colorectal cancer and type diabetes As more research confirms the health benefits of a plant based diet many people are beginning to incorporate a vegetarian diet into their daily eating habits The proportion of vegetarians worldwide is steadily increasing with flexitarianism growing at an especially notable rate Flexitarianism is a semi vegetarian diet that is primarily plant based but allows for occasional meat consumption According to a report by market research firm Euromonitor International in of the global population identified as flexitarians Among them of Generation Z born after have reduced their consumption of meat and animal products compared to of the Baby Boomer generation born in the s Based on the latest statistics the five countries with the highest percentage of vegetarians are India Israel Taiwan Italy and the United Kingdom India has the largest vegetarian population with an estimated of its citizens following a plant based diet primarily due to religious and cultural influences In Israel vegetarianism has gained popularity due to health and environmental awareness with approximately of the population identifying as vegetarians Taiwan boasts a well developed vegetarian market with over vegetarian restaurants making it one of the most vegetarian friendly countries in Asia Italy has a long history of vegetarianism with many traditional dishes naturally centred around plant based ingredients Meanwhile in the UK the rise of veganism has led to nearly of the population adopting a vegetarian diet with a rapidly growing market for plant based products encouraging more people to change their eating habits It s okay not to eat animal based protein and tofu can be considered a good source of protein in a vegetarian diet Photo via Pixabay com As global awareness of health and environmental issues rises vegetarianism is no longer a niche choice It has evolved into a worldwide dietary trend connecting millions of individuals making conscious food choices daily This trend underscores the power of collective action and the potential for positive change on a global scale

From timesnownews com Authored by Sakshi Arora Thinking about going vegan or introducing a vegetarian diet can bring about great health benefits not only to the body but to the environment as well For someone juggling between adopting a fulfilling lifestyle Agastya Kashyap decided to make it work for him after delving deep into the research process about this healthy approach Here s all you need to know about Agastya s food journey read to know more Here s how you can follow a vegan diet just like Agastya Agastya Kashyap had grown up in a well to do Indian family where his loved ones family members enjoyed trying different foods and cuisines every day Their diet consisted of all types of foods including meat vegetarian food dairy and other assorted ingredients A few months ago Agastya came across a person sharing their vegan journey on social media which piqued his interest as he was always keen to follow an environment friendly approach At first he had a million questions How will I follow a vegan diet as an Indian Will this vegan diet keep me full for longer Will my energy levels and stamina fluctuate and so much more but as we are all well versed that almost every other Indian dish sees heavy usage of dairy products like milk paneer heavy cream and more Upon researching and delving a bit more about veganism in India he realised a lot of his daily meals are actually vegan ranging from roti dal to sambar dosa that he always loved eating but never noticed was actually vegan This proved to be a great start for him and he focused on adding more vegan dishes into his diet chart without compromising on special Indian food dishes A lot of people believe that a vegan diet consists of ingredients like vegan milk almond milk avocado toast and other cream substitutes that can prove to be expensive for all individuals living on a tight budget As Indians we may not have labelled them as vegan foods but they truly fit the bill no meat and dairy as well as environmentally friendly As great as the start was Agastya soon hit a snag he started feeling more tired than usual less energetic and lethargic in general which also made him realise that his roti and dal diet lacked something important Agastya realised the classic drop that his body experienced after cutting off protein filled dishes from his diet made him realise that he needed to go back to his usual diet or make some changes in the new one Protein is known to keep you full for longer so given the schedule upping the protein intake can result in a fit body Upon doing some research and making quick visits to his dietician he realised that he didn t have to go back to his non vegetarian diet to fulfil the lacking needs of the body he just had to add protein rich plant ingredients to make up for it Agastya started incorporating some of the protein loaded dishes like cauliflower and lentil curry butter chickpeas vegan butter chicken vegan dal with spinach vegan Indian biryani meatballs and spaghetti Greek yoghurt and much more While it may seem like a daunting step veganism is not that far With a little thought planning being mindful of the protein content can not only improve your health but also help you achieve a greener and brighter future https www timesnownews com lifestyle food news is the body getting enough protein heres a confession of a vegan who follows a strict plant based or vegetarian diet article

Now in its th year Chicago Black Restaurant Week kicked off Sunday and runs until Feb with more than Black owned eateries offering special meals during Black History Month This year three vegan restaurants are participating The Black Vegan in Little Village Your Organic Inner G in Ashburn and Native Foods in the Loop But there are many more Black owned vegan and vegan friendly eateries in the Chicago area Last year Chicago food blogger Tamika Price listed restaurants on her blog Plant based Tamika that s about double the number since she started tracking in she said Appetite for vegan and vegetarian food is expanding among Black communities as health awareness grows and food options become more diverse and appealing When Lauran Smith founded Chicago Black Restaurant Week in there were no vegan restaurants on the list Now more and more people look to change their diets completely and would still like to experience amazing flavor while they make their transition to vegan and vegetarian options Smith said There are also holistic and ethical reasons for the shift toward plant based eating in Chicago and across the U S For example RZA a founder of hip hop group Wu Tang Clan has been vegan since and is a prominent advocate of veganism and animal welfare and is vocal about the philosophical reasons for not consuming animal products Sparkle Le Star founder of the Black Vegan became a bigger fan of RZA after learning that he was vegan It was confirmation that I wasn t crazy or alone in this beautiful journey she said The Black VeganLe Star opened the Black Vegan in at S Kedzie Ave She was born and raised on the West Side and never naturally gravitated toward vegetables But in she decided to try plant based eating for days She was surprised when she felt a dramatic physical mental and emotional shift within a month Sparkle Le Star founder of The Black Vegan Pat Nabong Sun Times My stress anxiety and depression eased My body felt lighter stronger But the biggest change My heart Le Star said I began to care more not just for my own well being but for others for animals for the world around me I went from living in my own bubble to volunteering at animal shelters gently escorting bugs out of my home instead of killing them Le Star said the vegan movement is only growing especially among youth It s like each new generation is getting wiser and more in tune with what their bodies need She added One minute people are totally against it and the next they re diving headfirst into the plant based life When designing the Black Vegan s menu the key was fun and familiarity she said with offerings such as wings ribs Italian beef burgers and shrimp made from ingredients like oyster and lion s mane mushrooms tofu and banana blossom She sought to veganize culturally Black dishes the real nostalgic straight from childhood favorites that every Black omnivore grew up on such as mac and cheese and greens The restaurant also has holiday specials like plant based chitterlings As much as I hated them growing up I can t deny their place in Black food history she said And guess what People were thrilled to get that nostalgic taste without the smell or the pork Customer favorites include portobello wings made of crispy sauced up mushrooms banana blossom catfish and the Burger made with plant based Italian beef priced at It s named for Interstate that runs through the West Side The Black Vegan s Burger Pat Nabong Sun Times Le Star s goal isn t just to sell food but to help people to guide them toward health and healing in a way that felt exciting not restrictive Her customers are diverse ranging from someone with baggy clothes looking like the type society has unfairly been taught to fear And next thing you know they re breaking down the benefits of holistic healing herbal remedies and plant based living Le Star said On the flip side we ve got elders in walkers making the switch and embracing a whole new way of eating Your Organic Inner GRena Parks opened Your Organic Inner G a plant based salad and juice bar in February Parks was previously an executive chef with food services company Sodexo She struggled with inexplicable reactions to foods like cheese butter and soy Doctors prescribed inhalers for symptoms such as her throat closing up but her health problems persisted Then she began eliminating certain foods from her diet and her health improved Parks realized her body had been reacting badly to specific ingredients That fueled the launch of Your Organic Inner G where people with dietary restrictions or those simply seeking healthier options can enjoy flavorful nourishing meals without worry Parks said Organic Inner G chef and owner Rena Parks Anthony Vazquez Sun Times She said many African Americans face high rates of diabetes heart disease high blood pressure and other health conditions often related to diet Parks wanted to change that through plant based meals that heal the body and uplift the spirit Interest in veganism grew during the pandemic We realized that much of our food was heavily processed tainted with bio engineered ingredients and lacking real nourishment That awakening led more people to start paying closer attention to their health and the quality of their food Parks said Your Organic Inner G at S Kedzie Ave doesn t use processed foods Everything is made from scratch except for the bread for now Parks said One customer favorite is jerk grilled cheese for made with lion s mane mushrooms and house made cheese For Black History Month the Soul Bowl features cornbread saut ed greens sweet potatoes black eyed peas and bourbon barbecue trumpet mushrooms topped with a wedge of fried green tomato Your Organic Inner G s The Philly made with lion s mane mushrooms bell peppers onions lettuce tomatoes and spicy ranch cashew dressing Anthony Vazquez Sun Times Native FoodsNative Foods launched in in Palm Springs California and grew to a nationwide chain But due to the pandemic Native Foods closed all of its locations except in Chicago Palm Springs and Glendale Colorado where employees were offered ownership In Dame Dia became an owner of Native Foods last Midwest restaurant Dia originally from Dakar Senegal had started working at Native Foods in Native Foods owner Dame Dia Pat Nabong Sun Times Native Foods S Clark St offers items such as bean chili and shrimp rolls made of konjac a root vegetable But its Taste of Senegal sampler for has been especially popular It features vegan mafe peanut butter tomato stew with plant based beef as well as carrots Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes Yassa Chick n plant based chick n with caramelized onions lime and bell peppers and jollof rice West African seasoned jasmine rice with saut ed cabbage sweet bell peppers carrots and sweet potatoes The demand for plant based options in the Black community has grown significantly in recent years said OnJaLee LaShay director of marketing More people are learning about the health benefits of a plant based diet especially in combating conditions like hypertension and diabetes that disproportionately affect us LaShay who is married to Dia said many Black customers are excited about plant based meals that reflect their tastes and culture We can help break the stigma around plant based eating and inspire more people to explore healthier food choices LaShay said We want to show that eating well doesn t mean giving up the flavors and traditions we love it means reimagining them in a way that nourishes our bodies and honors our culture A sampling of Native Foods dishes including shrimp rolls Yassa Chick n Senegalese jollof rice and beef mafe Pat Nabong Sun Times

In today s video I m sharing my personal journey of living on a raw vegan diet for years Over the decades I ve learned a lot about what it takes to stay healthy successful and thriving on this lifestyle long term I ll be discussing the keys to maintaining balance staying energized and making this diet work for you over the years Whether you re new to raw veganism or have been on the journey for a while I hope these insights will help you create a sustainable and healthy path that works for you just as it has for me

In today s video we re putting raw food vegan nutrition to the test with a challenge that combines strength endurance and determination Can a year old who follows a raw food vegan lifestyle complete pull ups and push ups in under minutes Watch as we explore the connection between raw food veganism and fitness while pushing the limits of what s possible at any age Let s see if age diet and dedication can make this impressive feat a reality

From Picky Eaters to Plant Powered Pros How I Raised Happy Vegan Kids Tips Tools That Worked Our Vegan Parenting Journey Chaos Compassion and Raising Healthy Little Humans When I first decided to raise my four kids vegan I braced for meltdowns both theirs and mine Fast forward to today and my teens happily meal prep tofu scrambles my youngest begs for cheezy kale chips and all of them proudly share their vegan values with friends But let s be real this journey wasn t Instagram perfect From navigating birthday party pizza temptations to soothing skeptical grandparents we ve learned and laughed through it all In this post I m sharing our family s wins mistakes and Amazon affiliate linked lifesavers that made raising vegan kids not just possible but joyful Why We Chose Vegan Parenting A Family s Story As parents we wanted to nurture kindness for animals the planet and their own bodies But transitioning four kids ages to at the time to a plant based diet felt daunting The turning point My oldest daughter then tearfully asked Why do we eat animals if we love them That s when we committed to veganism not just as a diet but as a values driven lifestyle Key Lesson Involve kids in the why We watched documentaries like Paying to kill Safari Hunting Tourism together and visited animal sanctuaries When they understood the impact their choices became proud not forced Nutrition Wins
