particularly when they report relative risks Jacqui explained how a increase in risk can sound alarming but in many cases it doesn t reflect the real picture The key issue here is the difference between relative risk and absolute risk Relative risk refers to the increased risk of a particular outcome in one group compared to another While this sounds important it can be misleading without context For example a small increase in relative risk might not translate to a significant increase in your actual chance of experiencing that outcome Absolute risk on the other hand tells us the actual probability of an event happening Jacqui stressed the importance of recognizing this distinction when reading nutrition headlines A increase in relative risk might sound alarming but when we examine the absolute risk the actual impact could be much less significant Understanding this distinction helps consumers interpret research with greater accuracy preventing them from falling for misleading headlines Swipe through examples here Review Jacqui post here to learn more The Problem with Statistically Significant Results The term statistically significant often sounds impressive but Jacqui warned that it s not always a reliable indicator of a meaningful finding In nutritional research a statistically significant result means that the data supports a specific conclusion beyond what could be expected by chance However Jacqui compared this to winning a small lottery just because the result is statistically significant doesn t necessarily mean it s practically important In many cases results that are statistically significant may not have a meaningful or clinically significant impact on real world outcomes For example a study might show a statistically significant difference in health markers between two groups but the actual difference might be so small that it doesn t matter in terms of improving health When encountering results labeled as statistically significant Jacqui advised readers to take a step back and ask Is this result meaningful in the real world or is it just a statistical fluke Why Nutritional Research Seems Contradictory Another fascinating part of our conversation focused on the reasons why nutritional research can often feel contradictory Jacqui pointed out that factors like small sample sizes observational study designs and various biases can skew the outcomes of studies These variables contribute to conflicting opinions and conclusions in the field of nutrition Moreover biases whether financial or ideological can shape the results of studies and the way findings are interpreted For instance when a study is funded by a food company the results might be more favorable toward the products of that company consciously or unconsciously Jacqui encouraged listeners to develop a critical eye when reading nutrition studies Instead of accepting conclusions at face value she suggested asking questions like What s the sample size Who funded the study What biases could influence the results How to Approach Nutrition Research as an Informed Consumer So how should we navigate the sea of nutrition research to make informed decisions about our food Jacqui s advice is simple yet powerful approach nutrition research with a critical mindset Here s how to do it Look beyond the headlines Understand the difference between relative and absolute risk and question whether the findings are clinically significant Question study design Be wary of studies with small sample sizes or those that rely on self reported data like FFQs Also consider the biases that may influence results Seek balanced perspectives Look for research that examines multiple viewpoints and is not influenced by financial or ideological pressures Jacqui s passion for empowering women through nutrition particularly prenatal research shines through in her work By shedding light on the limitations and complexities of nutrition research she offers us a much needed roadmap to make informed decisions about our health Whether you re navigating the confusion of wellness trends or simply trying to understand what s truly healthy Jacqui s insights can help us all approach nutrition with more clarity and skepticism Want more insights from Jacqui Follow her on Instagram where she shares practical advice and challenges the latest trends in wellness Learn more about Jacqui Work with Jacqui https www wellnesswithjacqui co za contact The lazy cookbook https www wellnesswithjacqui co za product page the lazy cookbook Women s health course https cominghometoyourself thinkific com courses coming home to yourself Stay curious embrace skepticism and keep tuning in

The online grocery e grocery market is poised for major growth over the next several years driven largely by consumer demand for convenience home delivery and digital shopping experiences However in the increasingly competitive landscape e grocery retailers need more than just a good DTC model and efficient delivery options to stand out they need to connect with customers on a deeper more personalized level How can brands stand out in a rapidly inflating B market We think you already know our answer a carefully crafted highly targeted creator marketing strategy Let s dive in Tl dr The Power Of The Niche Rather than focusing only on mega influencers or broad campaigns partnering with smaller specialized creators can drive higher engagement and build stronger brand loyalty especially when targeting consumers with specific dietary needs like gluten free keto vegan or organic These online communities are tightly knit passionately engaged and hungry for brands that understand their unique lifestyle requirements In this article we ll explore How specialized diets are shaping consumer choices in the online food retail market Why smaller influencers and their tight knit communities can be a game changer for e grocery expansion How to identify the right influencers in the specialized diet space The importance of storytelling to build authentic connections and loyalty The Rise Of Specialized Diets First let s set the table with some rationale The food industry has undergone a significant transformation over the past decade A combination of increased health awareness environmental concerns and access to online delivery options has driven many consumers to adopt specialized diets These diets range from medically necessary restrictions such as gluten free for celiac disease to ethically motivated ones like veganism and even preference based choices like organic or keto just to name a couple The Opportunity For E Grocery Brands This begs the question who stands to gain the most from this disruption and hyper specification in the food industry You guessed it e grocery food brands particularly those that can meet consumers exactly where they are For e grocers the specialized diet trend means there s an ever expanding audience searching for convenient ways to purchase high quality diet aligned products Consumers want streamlined shopping experiences that cater to their dietary restrictions or preferences as well as the know how to meet their needs and questions That s where influencers come back into the discussion By collaborating with niche influencers in these spaces e grocery brands can position themselves not just as marketplaces but as trusted partners in these dietary journeys Key Specialized Diet Segments Gluten free Estimated to reach nearly billion globally by driven by consumers with gluten intolerance celiac disease or a desire to reduce gluten for overall wellness The gluten free label often signals a perception of higher quality or healthier ingredients Keto low carb high fat diets Popular among those seeking weight management or specific performance goals Enthusiasts frequently share recipes success stories and before and after results on social media creating strong community bonds Vegan plant based Fueled by ethical environmental and health related reasons Increasingly mainstream with major food manufacturers launching plant based alternatives for dairy meat and other staples Organic products Gaining ground due to concerns about pesticide use GMOs and sustainability Often aligns with consumers looking for ethically sourced or environmentally friendly products Why Micro And Nano Influencers Matter For E Grocery When people think of influencers they often picture high profile celebrities or Instagram stars with millions of followers Yet micro and even nano influencers can be particularly impactful in reaching niche audiences First let s get a little terminology out of the way Micro influencers are considered content creators with an audience typically ranging between to followers These influencers have a strong connection with their audience and are seen as experts or enthusiasts in specific niches making their endorsements highly credible and influential Likewise nano influencers refer to creators with audiences from around down to just followers This tier can be especially valuable for reaching hyper specific groups and generating content that can be repurposed for brands Now let s explore why these tiers are best suited for engaging dietary communities High engagement and trust Micro influencers typically cultivate strong loyal communities that trust their opinions and recommendations Because their audiences are smaller these influencers often maintain a higher level of engagement meaning more likes comments shares and direct conversations with followers In specialized diet communities this trust is paramount People with specific dietary restrictions or goals rely heavily on authentic endorsements before trying new products Targeted communities Many micro and nano influencers focus on niche topics like gluten free baking vegan meal prep or keto friendly snack ideas By specializing they build credibility as experts in these areas Their followers are thus high intent customers who are already in the mindset to discover new products or services related to their niche Cost effectiveness Partnering with a celebrity influencer can drain budgets quickly Micro and nano influencers on the other hand typically offer more affordable collaboration rates allowing brands to scale their influencer marketing efforts without overspending Some nano influencers might even be open to product exchanges or affiliate partnerships lowering upfront marketing costs although this type of compensation is waning in popularity Content development While organic reach may be limited when partnering with nano influencers their value lies not only in community reach but also in content creation itself Assuming the proper usage rights are included in the contracts brands can leverage nano influencers to scale content development that feels more authentic to be repurposed across brand channels Long term relationships Because micro influencers often engage more personally with brands and followers they re typically more open to long term ambassadorships This can lead to a steady stream of authentic regular content that continuously drives new customers and fosters brand loyalty among existing ones Identifying The Right Niche Influencers In Specialized Diets Finding the best fit influencers can be the difference between a successful campaign and wasted marketing spend no matter the industry That s why investing in due diligence when researching and vetting potential partners is imperative shameless plug here but at AdParlor we manage the research and selection process from end to end with our proprietary methodology Okay back to the good stuff Social listening and hashtags A simple yet effective way to discover niche influencers is by monitoring relevant hashtags like GlutenFreeLife KetoRecipes VeganMeals or OrganicLiving across platforms like Instagram TikTok and YouTube Look for consistent high quality posts with consistent engagement While follower counts matter engagement rate and audience quality can be more telling metrics for influencer suitability Influencer discovery tools Platforms like Upfluence or CreatorIQ have filtering options that allow you to refine searches by audience demographics geographic location and areas of interest These insights can help you zero in on influencers whose followers best match your ideal customer profile Content quality and authenticity Don t just focus on numbers dive into an influencer s content quality tone and style Look for elements like Well researched tips or recipes that show an in depth understanding of the diet Clear visually appealing posts or videos even if shot on a phone they should be cohesive and engaging Genuine follower interactions check comments to see how the influencer responds and whether their audience expresses satisfaction or doubts Brand alignment Consider whether the influencer s core values align with your brand s mission Audiences can sense when a partnership is forced or purely transactional so brand synergy is crucial for authenticity The Power Of Personal Storytelling One of the most impactful ways micro and nano influencers in specialized dietary niches connect with their audiences is through personal storytelling Many of these creators adopt or champion a particular diet due to their own health needs ethical considerations or lifestyle transformations When they share personal experiences be it overcoming food allergies improving well being or supporting the environment followers see tangible relatable evidence of the diet s benefits Some thought starters of story driven campaigns Gluten free success stories An influencer shares how eliminating gluten helped reduce bloating or migraines documenting their day to day meals using a brand s gluten free product range YouTube videos or blog posts highlight new gluten free product discoveries daily meal prep or family friendly recipes Keto meal preps and before and after transformations An influencer discusses their journey from feeling lethargic to feeling energetic after switching to keto all while featuring a range of low carb snacks and meal essentials from their favorite e grocery retailer Weekly Instagram Reels updates recipe demos and grocery hauls to illustrate the ease of staying keto Vegan lifestyle features An influencer talks about transitioning to a vegan diet showcasing everyday staples like plant based milk meat alternatives and cruelty free snacks sourced from an online food retailer s site Short Instagram Stories or TikTok videos showing easy vegan swaps encourage their audience to try out a brand s vegan friendly shopping lists Organic living for families A mom influencer focuses on feeding her family exclusively organic meals to reduce pesticide exposure highlighting your brand s variety of organic fruits veggies and pantry staples let s steer clear of Instagram trad wife territory though m kay Testimonials on how shopping organic has improved overall health help build trust among health conscious parents Authentic storytelling does more than just sell products it portrays a lifestyle shift and offers real world solutions Followers become invested in the influencer s journey which drives curiosity and eventually product trial Nurturing A Community Of Advocates As the online food retail industry continues to evolve simply offering convenience and fast shipping is no longer enough to gain a competitive edge Modern consumers crave personalized experiences that speak to their unique needs and values By partnering with niche influencers who have built credibility around specialized diets e grocery brands can form deep connections with dedicated consumer segments Key Takeaways Niche Focus Specialized diets command tight knit online communities Harness the influence of micro and nano creators within these niches to drive targeted engagement and high conversion rates Authenticity Over Celebrities Smaller influencers often bring stronger trust and real relationships with followers ideal for forging a loyal customer base Long Term Partnerships Repeated consistent endorsements by the same influencer nurture deeper brand recognition and customer lifetime value Personal Storytelling Relatable journeys and genuine enthusiasm resonate far more than scripted ads driving sustained interest and repeat purchases In the age of information overload and mass communication authenticity is currency Influencers who embody the lifestyles your customers aspire to are your best allies in building meaningful relationships that not only generate sales but foster a thriving community of brand advocates If you re interested in further exploring influencer marketing or want to optimize your brand to reach niche audiences in an authentic manner that drives results reach out to our team of experts to see how we can work together The post Niche Influencers Big Impact How E Grocers Can Win Over Specialized Dietary Communities appeared first on AdParlor

I m gonna try to get three months of roundups done in two days an ambitious goal if I do say so myself To start let s catch up on November and December of last year Patreon Rewards At the end of November I sent rewards featuring my recently completed Cozy Christmas Coodlers illustration And in December I sent the next entry in my Maginaturalist s Sketchbook series Ea the Mesopotamian sea god Patreon is the best way to support my artmaking providing both funds and emotional support Click here to sign up for digital rewards postcards prints or all three deviantART On November th I was honored with my second ever Daily Deviation My Summer Gryphon piece was nominated by LindArtz and featured by Malintra Shadowmoon View fave and comment on deviantART Later that month I uploaded my Cozy Christmas Coodlers greeting card illustration which was my final full color illustration of the year View fave and comment on deviantART deviantART is another place you can support my artmaking You can commission me for a chibi caricature here or sign up and become my first monthly subscriber here Livestreaming For November s featured Twitch stream I m choosing the final round of work on my Cozy Christmas Coodlers Cozy Christmas Coodlers Part For December I am featuring the final stream of which was the first round of work on a chibi caricature of Steve the Otter Chibi Friday Steve the Otter Part I livestream art nearly every week on Twitch and it s another place you can support me by subscribing Lurkers are always welcome but I love to chat too See you on my next stream Charity Fundraising November s Charity of the Month was Farm Sanctuary and we had unique Twitch viewers that month My donation formula is USD per unique viewer minumum donation of and maximum of That meant a donation On top of that my awesome viewers bickman k and ExieTheArtist both donated so we raised a total of for Farm Sanctuary in December s Charity of the Month was The Protego Foundation We had unique viewers that month so I donated Thank you to everyone who joins my streams and donates to the Studio Mikarts fundraisers on Twitch Knowing that together we re making a difference for animals while having fun gives every minute of live time so much more meaning Gryphia Progress The editing of my first illustrated novel made big strides in these months Working diligently each week since July in December I finally finished the first round of edits spanning pages Moving onto the next step I started my second draft The first was written on my Freewrite smart typewriter which purposefully disallows editing so you can just get on with the storytelling but now I am in the editing stages so I am using Scrivener on my desktop PC Every step I take in this project is literally the most I ve ever worked on a novel so every bit of progress is exciting I can t wait to see how far I get in Other News Winter Vegan Market I was chosen to be a vendor for the Winter Vegan Market here in Boise Idaho It was so exciting to meet so many people especially when they braved the cold to come out we were very lucky that the rain didn t start until exactly the market s scheduled end to share my artwork with new customers and clients and to help show that veganism isn t a diet but a complete lifestyle of non harm Here are some photos from the event the second of its kind in my area I got more modular display grids this time Coloring pages greeting cards and chibi commissions More greeting cards stickers pin back buttons and magnets The wind kept trying to blow my postcards away Postcards and prints Set up and ready to sell I bought these cookies from our neighbors immediately Selfie with my new friend Angie Selfie with one of my best friends Leigha and her two pups One unexpected perk of vending this time was getting SO MANY treats from the food vendors We purchased a lot last time they sold out super quick so my husband and I swooped in early but we also received many gifts at closing time as well I love being a part of the vegan community I hope I can vend at the upcoming Spring Vegan Market as well but even if not I ll definitely attend as a shopper That s all for this roundup Thank you so much for reading til the end I ll be back VERY soon with my roundup for January Until then please stay happy healthy and safe

In a world increasingly attuned to the rhythms of conscious living championing veganism and animal rights is more than a movement it s a dynamic call to action Whether you re a seasoned activist or just beginning to explore this compassionate lifestyle understanding effective strategies can amplify your impact In this enlightening listicle we unveil Dynamic Strategies to Champion Veganism and Animal Rights designed to empower and inspire you on this noble journey From innovative advocacy techniques to collaborative community efforts these strategies hold the keys to fostering empathy sparking conversation and driving tangible change Embark on this exploration and discover actionable insights that will propel your advocacy efforts forward creating a ripple effect of kindness and awareness for all living beings Embrace the Art of Storytelling Weave compelling narratives that spotlight the lives and experiences of animals pulling at the heartstrings and opening the minds of those who might not yet understand the importance of veganism and animal rights Crafting powerful stories can be a transformative way to engage others with the cause of veganism and animal rights When you share narratives that delve into the lives of animals you reach into the realm of empathy allowing people to see the world through the eyes of beings often overlooked Delve into their daily experiences from the joy of a saved farm animal to the sorrow of a creature bound in captivity Highlight milestones like the journey of a once neglected pet to its rejuvenated life in a loving home engaging the audience s emotions and intellect Consider sharing these narratives through various mediums Blogging Regularly publish stories on your blog to reach a dedicated audience Social Media Use platforms like Instagram and Facebook for visual storytelling Podcasts Delve deep into animal rights issues through interviews and monologues To substantiate your stories pair them with factual insights Here s a simple illustration of how factual data can enhance storytelling Animal Life Impact Key Fact Battery Hen Transition from cage to sanctuary of hens are caged in cramped conditions Dairy Cow From factory farm to pasture Typical lifespan on a farm is five years Leverage Social Media for Activism Utilize platforms like Instagram TikTok and Facebook to share powerful imagery educational content and success stories reaching a global audience with engaging and shareable content In today s interconnected digital age social media is a formidable tool for driving activism especially for causes like veganism and animal rights By crafting compelling narratives through vivid imagery and thoughtful storytelling activists can engage vast audiences on platforms such as Instagram TikTok and Facebook Share photos and videos that highlight the beauty and innocence of animals the reality of factory farming or the deliciousness of plant based meals to evoke emotion and inspire action Engaging content can spark discussions reshape perceptions and encourage viewers to explore veganism out of curiosity or concern Impactful Imagery Use original high quality photos that tell a story and convey the emotions of the animals or the vibrancy of vegan dishes Stories of Change Highlight success stories of people and communities embracing plant based lifestyles showcasing tangible benefits and real world shifts Educational Content Create infographics and posts that educate followers about cruelty free alternatives the environmental impact of veganism and tips for transitioning to a vegan lifestyle Platform Best Use Instagram Share stunning photos and carousel posts TikTok Create engaging short videos Facebook Start conversations with detailed posts Foster Community and Collaboration Join or create groups that support veganism and animal rights organizing events discussions and collaborative projects to amplify your collective impact and support one another in your advocacy efforts Engaging in community and collaborative efforts is crucial for making a meaningful impact in the realm of veganism and animal rights By becoming a part of existing groups or initiating your own you can create a supportive network that fosters knowledge sharing and cohesive action Consider joining local or online forums where you can connect with like minded individuals This not only enhances your understanding but also encourages the exchange of ideas that can inspire innovative activism Organize or participate in events and discussions aimed at raising awareness about veganism and animal rights These gatherings can range from educational workshops and film screenings to protests or community cook offs featuring plant based cuisines By working together you amplify your voices and strengthen your advocacy s reach Moreover this communal sharing of passion and goals can lead to fruitful partnerships and collaborative projects such as community gardens educational blogs or art exhibits focusing on animal welfare Here are a few ideas to get started with creating or finding groups Seek out local activist meet ups in your area Initiate a club at schools universities or workplaces Utilize social media to connect digitally with global supporters Collaborate with local businesses for events or sponsorships Future Outlook As we close the chapter on these five dynamic strategies to champion veganism and animal rights it becomes clear that every action no matter how small contributes to a broader movement poised to shape a more compassionate world Whether it s through delectable plant based dishes that delight the senses or the powerful pulse of a social media campaign each strategy weaves its own unique narrative into the tapestry of change As advocates of humanity s shared future with all living beings we hold the power to inspire curiosity ignite passion and foster understanding Perhaps this exploration has kindled a spark or stoked a burgeoning flame within you consider it an open invitation to step forth and weave your own threads into this vibrant evolving tapestry After all the most profound change often begins with a single mindful step

Bodybuilding has long been associated with high protein diets often centered around animal products such as chicken eggs and whey protein However with the rise of veganism and plant based diets many athletes are questioning whether vegan protein is enough to fuel muscle growth and support recovery In this article we will break down the role of vegan protein in bodybuilding examining its sources effectiveness and tips for optimizing performance Understanding Protein Requirements for Bodybuilders Protein is essential for muscle repair and growth especially for bodybuilders who subject their muscles to intense resistance training The recommended daily protein intake for bodybuilders typically ranges between to grams of protein per kilogram of body weight This protein intake supports muscle protein synthesis a process where the body repairs and builds new muscle fibers One of the concerns about vegan protein sources is whether they provide the full range of essential amino acids needed for muscle growth Unlike animal proteins many plant based proteins are considered incomplete meaning they may lack one or more essential amino acids However with proper planning bodybuilders can still meet their protein needs on a vegan diet Complete vs Incomplete Proteins Essential amino acids are those that the body cannot produce on its own making it necessary to obtain them from food Animal proteins such as meat eggs and dairy are complete proteins containing all nine essential amino acids in sufficient amounts In contrast many plant based proteins are incomplete but this does not mean they are inadequate By combining different plant based protein sources such as beans and rice or tofu and quinoa bodybuilders can achieve a complete amino acid profile Additionally certain plant based proteins like soy quinoa and hemp are naturally complete proteins making them excellent options for vegan athletes Top Vegan Protein Sources for Bodybuilders Legumes Lentils chickpeas black beans Rich in protein and fiber legumes are a staple in many plant based diets Tofu and Tempeh Made from soybeans these foods are high in protein and contain all essential amino acids Seitan Also known as wheat gluten seitan is a high protein low fat option that mimics the texture of meat Plant Based Protein Powders Options such as pea protein rice protein and blends of multiple plant proteins are convenient for meeting protein needs Nuts and Seeds Almonds chia seeds flaxseeds These provide protein along with healthy fats and micronutrients Quinoa A versatile grain that is a complete protein making it ideal for salads bowls and side dishes How Much Protein Can the Body Absorb A common misconception is that the body can only absorb a limited amount of protein in one meal Research suggests that muscle protein synthesis is maximized with about grams of protein per meal depending on the individual s size and activity level For vegan bodybuilders it is important to distribute protein intake evenly across meals to optimize muscle recovery and growth One effective way to achieve this is by incorporating the best vegan protein powders into your diet ensuring adequate protein without compromising on plant based principles Are Plant Proteins Less Effective While plant proteins may have a lower biological value BV than animal proteins this does not mean they are ineffective Biological value measures how efficiently the body can utilize a protein Animal proteins often have a higher BV but plant proteins can still support muscle growth when consumed in adequate amounts Recent studies have shown that plant based protein powders particularly those made from soy and pea can promote muscle protein synthesis similarly to whey protein Combining different plant protein sources can further enhance their effectiveness by ensuring a complete amino acid profile Benefits of Vegan Protein for Bodybuilders Reduced Inflammation Plant based diets are rich in antioxidants and anti inflammatory compounds which may aid in recovery and reduce muscle soreness Improved Digestion Vegan protein sources especially those high in fiber can promote better digestion and gut health Heart Health Many plant based foods are low in saturated fat and cholesterol reducing the risk of heart disease Sustainability Vegan diets have a lower environmental impact aligning with ethical and ecological values Overcoming Challenges on a Vegan Diet While a vegan diet offers many benefits bodybuilders may face certain challenges including meeting calorie and protein requirements Here are some strategies to overcome these hurdles Increase Meal Frequency Eating smaller meals throughout the day can help ensure adequate calorie and protein intake Use Protein Supplements Vegan protein powders are a convenient way to boost protein intake without adding excessive calories Focus on Nutrient Density Include a variety of whole foods rich in protein vitamins and minerals to support overall health Monitor Key Nutrients Nutrients such as vitamin B iron zinc and omega fatty acids may require supplementation or careful food selection Meal Plan Example for Vegan Bodybuilders Breakfast Tofu scramble with spinach mushrooms and nutritional yeast Whole grain toast Smoothie with almond milk banana and pea protein powder Snack Handful of almonds and a protein bar Lunch Quinoa salad with black beans avocado and mixed vegetables Baked sweet potato Post Workout Shake Plant based protein powder blended with water frozen berries and chia seeds Dinner Tempeh stir fry with broccoli bell peppers and brown rice Snack Overnight oats with almond butter and flaxseeds Final Thoughts Vegan protein can absolutely be enough for bodybuilders provided they plan their diets strategically By incorporating a variety of protein rich plant foods and ensuring a complete amino acid profile vegan athletes can build muscle recover efficiently and perform at a high level The key is consistency balance and paying attention to individual needs Whether for ethical reasons health benefits or sustainability more bodybuilders are proving that you can achieve impressive results on a plant based diet The post Is Vegan Protein Enough for Bodybuilders A Sports Nutrition Breakdown appeared first on Daily Emerald

Throughout the United States Black Americans are introducing innovative vegan recipes to their communities Many started their plant based journeys to address health problems that especially affect Black Americans Others recognized similarities between systems of oppression the violence inflicted on farmed animals and the violence against people of color in this country But we must remember that veganism is not a uniform movement and includes diverse voices and experiences These cookbooks showcase cherished recipes passed down from generations and rich diverse flavors welcoming a healthier and kinder future You won t want to miss these vegan cookbooks written by Black authors Cooking from the Spirit by Tabitha Brown Tabitha Brown Emmy Award winning actress New York Times bestselling author and three time winner of the NAACP Image Award presents her own vegan recipes that are flexible creative and encouraging Whether you re an experienced cook or new to cooking Cooking from the Spirit offers a lot of freedom to make the dishes your own Soul Food Recipe Guide by Brooke Brimm Brook Brimm emphasizes the importance of nourishing the mind body and spirit with food Soul Food Recipe Guide reflects this emphasis and promotes vegan soul food as the healthiest option According to Brook a plant based soul food diet helps keep the mind clear the body light and free and the spirit delighted By Any Greens Necessary by Trayce Lynn McQuirter By Any Greens Necessary guides women in maintaining a healthy and happy lifestyle by including fresh fruits and vegetables whole grains and legumes in their diets Trayce highlights the importance of an active lifestyle and calls on all women to prioritize their health Vegetable Kingdom by Bryant Terry Vegetable Kingdom teaches us how to prepare tasty meals using vegetables grains and legumes Bryant spotlights the role of fresh ingredients vibrant spices and clever techniques in building flavor and texture Organized by ingredient the book makes it easy to create simple meals based on what s available at the market Sweet Potato Soul by Jenn Claiborne Jenn revives the age old art of using fresh and locally sourced ingredients in Sweet Potato Soul The cookbook features vegan recipes that put a unique spin on Southern cuisine such as Peach Date BBQ Jackfruit Sliders and Sweet Potato Tahini Cookies Beautifully illustrated with full color photographs this book will leave you drooling Makini s Vegan Kitchen by Makini Howell In this anniversary edition of the original Plum cookbook Makini Howell a nationally renowned chef and entrepreneur shares her visionary plant based recipes These delicious recipes are inspired by one of the highest ranked vegan fine dining restaurants in the country Unbelievably Vegan by Charity Morgan Charity Morgan a private chef to elite athletes and rock stars helps you discover flavorful vegan dishes Unbelievably Vegan offers recipes inspired by Charity s heritage and provides a plan for eating less meat whether you want to go completely vegan or reduce your meat intake Afro Vegan by Bryant Terry Afro Vegan is a unique cookbook featuring over delicious contemporary dishes inspired by Bryant s personal experiences and the history of African cuisine Bryant also shares his thoughts on food as a means of bringing people together and includes music and book recommendations to complement the recipes Caribbean Vegan by Taymer Mason Chef Taymer Mason who hails from Barbados shares new recipes in the second edition of Caribbean Vegan Taymer also provides useful tips and tricks for various cooking activities such as cutting breadfruit making cassava flour and selecting a ripe coconut Plentiful by Denai Moore Denai Moore s Plentiful is a unique tribute to Jamaican cuisine combining traditional flavors with a modern twist Her collection of recipes ranges from the convenient Rice Peas Arancini to the comforting Oxtail Gravy Roasted Garlic Spring Onion Mash The recipes are approachable engaging and simply delicious Vegan Nigerian Kitchen by Tomi Makanjuola Vegan Nigerian Kitchen is an essential cookbook for those who want to embark on an exciting and delicious culinary journey It features a variety of regional dishes from across Nigeria along with insights into traditional ingredients and cooking methods Eat Plants B tch by Pinky Cole Eat Plants B tch celebrates Cole s belief that cooking and enjoying irresistible vegan comfort food can be fun and accessible The cookbook features mouthwatering photographs and easy to follow instructions so you can recreate savory dishes like Oyster Mushroom Parmesan Black Girl Baking by Jerrelle Guy Immerse yourself in the scents sounds sights textures and tastes of Black Girl Baking Jerrelle takes you on a joyous baking adventure that delights all five senses She revisits and reimagines her dishes using ingredients that give her a sense of power and of connection with her identity and the world These vegan cookbooks expand our culinary horizons and by sharing them we can support Black chefs authors and food enthusiasts while inspiring others to join the plant based movement Together we can create a more inclusive and vibrant vegan community The post Innovative Vegan Cookbooks Written by Black Authors appeared first on Mercy For Animals

Your body is heavily dependent on protein to perform critical processes that contribute to your survival and optimal health Protein plays a key role in cellular function as well as proper immune responses hormone production growth and development and more Protein is a primary component of muscle tissue accounting for of muscle mass It is essential for building and maintaining muscle which is why you need to consume protein rich diet Your requirements for protein are even higher if you want to build and preserve muscle mass Many people assume that vegan protein powders are not enough to supply muscles with protein and that it s difficult for vegans to build muscle mass This is farther from the truth as you can absolutely gain more muscle strength and mass with plant based foods and products such as vegan protein powders In this article we ll talk about what you need to know about eating vegan protein especially in the form of vegan protein powders for muscle gain We ll also discuss why protein is crucial for building muscles as well as some tips and strategies on how to boost your protein intake for muscle building Key TakeawaysVegan protein powders are an excellent choice in supplying muscles with protein to build muscle mass The body uses protein for muscle protein synthesis and muscle hypertrophy which is the way it creates and repairs new muscles Plant proteins are just as effective as animal based proteins in helping individuals meet their dietary protein requirements Paying attention to pre and post work nutrition is essential for optimal muscle gains better performance and recovery Tracking your muscle gains and strength training progress is as important as nutrition How Does the Body Build Muscle Before we dive into how the body builds muscle let s first take a look at the entire concept of muscle building and the bodily processes that goes on in the background Muscle protein production or protein synthesis is an important process that occurs during muscle building For this to happen the body needs a steady supply of amino acids the building blocks of protein which essentially comes from your diet The body is continuously recycling and renewing amino acids in your muscles Testosterone and growth hormones are involved in muscle growth by encouraging protein synthesis They also stimulate satellite cell activation satellite cells are specialized cells that get to work on repairing damaged muscle fibers The body loses muscle mass if the body disposes of more protein than it deposits during protein synthesis Muscle size will not increase if protein deposition the process which build up in tissues and protein degradation when proteins are naturally destroyed or break down in cells are even The key to growing muscles is to boost the protein deposition rate while ensuring that the muscle protein breakdown rate is lower Now the body builds muscle through a process called muscle hypertrophy During resistance training microscopic tears are created in muscle fibers Muscle hypertrophy occurs when the body is then activated to repair these microscopic tears or injuries New muscle fibers and proteins are added to the damaged muscle tissue which leads to an increase in muscle strength and size This is the primary goal of resistance exercise training which explains the importance of incorporating resistance exercises to your gym regimen The right amount of resistance training activates your body s hormonal response to build muscles Experts say that performing moderate to heavy resistance training combined with a high protein diet is a proven method to increasing muscle size and mass An important thing to note however is that consuming more protein is not always better You can t teach your body how to use protein Moreover eating more protein doesn t necessarily translate to increased muscles Your body will not build muscle without appropriate resistance or strength building exercises Common Misconceptions about Plant Protein vs Animal ProteinMore often than not building muscle is associated with eating copious amounts of animal foods such as chicken eggs and whey protein However because of the emergence of plant based diets more people are choosing vegan protein sources to meet their goals of building muscle Contrary to popular belief plant based proteins are not inferior to protein from animal products and there are many studies and real life examples supporting this fact You can definitely building muscle on a vegan diet with proper nutritional planning While it is true that more animal based foods are complete protein sources meaning they have all the amino acids needed for muscle building plant based protein sources such as soy and pea protein are complete proteins too There are many more complete plant based protein sources which we ve talked about in a previous article Animal protein is also said to be more bioavailable than plant based protein sources which means they are easily broken down by the body and absorbed However the difference is small and relative and should not be a major concern Certain forms of plant proteins such as those in isolated vegan protein powder or plant based protein blends are comparable to animal protein in terms of digestibility and absorption rates How to Get Enough Protein While VeganThe recommended dietary allowance RDA for protein vary depending on your age and life stage How much protein you need also depends on your body weight for adults the RDA is grams per kilogram of body weight This means that an adult who is pounds needs grams of protein per day The heavier the weight the higher the protein requirement is Research also suggests that elderly people and those suffering from severe medical conditions may require more protein on average Athletes bodybuilders and runners can also benefit from increasing their protein intake ranging from to grams per kilogram of body weight A common question people ask is how they can meet their protein needs as a vegan The good news is that getting enough protein as a vegan is completely possible by observing a varied diet containing the right plant based protein sources You shouldn t be worried about meeting your protein requirements as there is an extremely wide variety of natural and vegan protein rich foods to incorporate into your diet Among the best vegan protein sources are whole grains legumes nuts seeds leafy greens and fortified plant foods If you feel that consuming plant foods is not enough you can always consider protein supplementation Taking vegan protein powders is an excellent way to supplement your protein intake and ensure that you are not deficient in the nutrient Vegan protein powders also offer numerous health benefits and are a well known secret to building muscles Why Vegan Protein Powder Is Effective for Building Muscle Mass and StrengthAs we ve mentioned earlier protein supplementation can only become effective if you incorporate resistance training Older adults can benefit from slightly increasing their protein intake regardless of their exercise regimen For individuals looking to improve muscle growth with exercise consuming to grams of protein at a time is beneficial However consuming large quantities has no value it can add more calories than needed and diminish protein s capacity for muscle building Vegan protein powder typically contains less protein but they shouldn t be ignored as an option For instance rice and pea protein have proven to be successful in stimulating muscle growth just like whey a milk based protein Vegan protein powders are made by extracting protein from plant based sources such as peas rice and soy During processing carbohydrates fats and fiber are removed while nutrients and sweeteners are added If increasing protein intake the conventional way is not an option taking supplementing with vegan protein powders can be both effective and convenient Let s take a look at the reasons why vegan protein powders are helpful for muscle building High in Essential Amino AcidsA common myth about vegan proteins is that they are incomplete or do not contain all the amino acids that are required for muscle protein synthesis However this is simply not true While not all plant based protein sources contain all essential amino acids there are several that do including soy quinoa and hemp protein Many vegan protein powder brands combine different plant based proteins in their formulation creating a complete amino acid profile In case vegan protein blends are not available to you you can combine different plant based proteins like rice and pea protein to ensure that you are getting all nine essential amino acids your body need to build muscle Good Digestibility and BioavailabilityPlant proteins generally are easy to digest and have good bioavailability However these properties can vary depending on the type of protein the way it s processed and the compounds in it Differences in protein structures as well as the presence of anti nutrient compounds such as phytates have an influence on the nutritive value of some foods They can in fact prevent nutrient absorption and reduce the amount of protein the body s digestive system absorbs from food Certain vegan protein protein powders such as soy and pea protein have a high bioavailability and digestibility rate between to which is close to that of animal based proteins This means that your body can easily digest and use them effectively Vegan protein powder isolates and blends usually have an improved digestibility because they receive heat treatment which in turn inactivates of anti nutrient compounds and make the protein as bioavailable as casein milk protein High in Nutrients and AntioxidantsVegan protein powders come with a myriad of added health benefits For example pea protein contains choline a key mineral for brain health and calcium which promotes bone strength and reduces our risk of osteoporosis as we age Hemp seed protein meanwhile contains omega fatty acids which help with muscle inflammation and promote recovery during work outs Omega fatty acids are also heart healthy and reduces one s risk of cardiovascular disease Plant proteins in general are rich in a variety of vitamins and minerals including vitamin C and iron as well as fiber which helps with blood sugar stability and keeps you feeling fuller longer Many of the health benefits of plant proteins support your muscle building goals and overall wellness Lower in Saturated Fat and CholesterolVegan protein powders do not contain saturated fats and cholesterol since they are plant derived This is especially beneficial for heart health and those who practice an active lifestyle If you want to experience the full benefits of plant protein consider replacing animal proteins completely in your diet Studies have shown that replacing animal based protein with plant protein is associated with a lower LDL lower density lipoprotein cholesterol or the bad cholesterol Supplementing with vegan protein powders is one way to replace animal based protein in your diet if you are not vegan Best Practices for Pre and Post Workout NutritionGood nutrition is important for physical performance and results whether you re a casual gym goer bodybuilder or a professional athlete Ensuring that you are following the right nutrition plan will help you maximize each training session and enable you to reach your fitness goals Although workout nutrition can change depending on your workout and goals the principles behind it is the same Timing your food intake and being mindful of certain macronutrients can improve your performance enhance muscle protein synthesis hasten recovery and boost your mood In case you don t know what to eat before and after a workout like most people we ve created the succeeding simple guide for you to follow Pre WorkoutThe best time to take your pre workout meal is one to three ours before exercising This will allow you to fully digest your food before beginning your workout and provide you enough calories for energy Consume a big meal within two to three hours pre workout followed by a smaller snack Your food should contain both protein and carbs Carbs serve as fuel while protein works to re build and repair muscles The amount and type of food to eat depends in your workout goals Your nutritional needs are different depending on the degree of physician endurance required for a chosen activity If your goal is to gain muscle mass consume a bigger portion of carbs and proteins But if your goal is to lose weight your pre workout meal should contain less carbs and more protein in a smaller portion As for carbohydrates the basics is to consume to of your total daily carb intake during your pre workout meal You can get your carbs from whole grains sweet potatoes rice beans bananas and starchy vegetables When it comes to protein include to grams of protein in your meal before your training session for optimal muscle protein synthesis On a vegan diet it is important to ensure that your protein contains adequate levels of leucine a type of amino acid that stimulates muscle growth Soy based foods are rich in leucine Hydration is equally important in pre workout nutrition You should drink at least two cups of water two to three hours before working out Drink another cup minutes before your workout Some good pre workout snacks include Greek yoghurtBananaA piece of toast and boiled eggApple with peanut butterNuts seeds and raisinsPasta with a tomato sauce base Post WorkoutFollowing a rigorous workout you need to refuel your body by refilling your depleted glycogen stores The focus of post workout nutrition is to replenish your energy storage and to have enough protein to prevent muscle protein breakdown and encourage muscle synthesis Whatever your goals are post workout meals are a must You should ideally consume your post workout meal within to minutes after training Make sure to consume a balanced meal that contains high quality protein healthy fats and some carbs If you prefer to consume a workout meal in liquid form go for a vegan protein powder shake In terms of quantity the same goes for protein and carbs You should include to of your daily carb intake in your post workout meal Then for protein consume to grams of protein after your workout Another thing to consider is to include dietary fat in your meals This helps optimize the body s absorption of protein and carbs Aim for to of your total dietary intake which translates to to grams of fat per meal Again hydration is a necessity before after a workout Drink one to two cups of water following a workout For post workout snacks and meal ideas try these Spinach and egg omeletteChocolate milkHummus and pita breadOatmeal with vegan protein powder banana and almondsYoghurt and berriesHard boiled eggs on toastBanana with peanut butter on whole grain toastAvocado and olive oilGreen tea WalnutsLeafy greensVegan protein powder shakeTracking Your Progress and Muscle GainsBuilding muscles and seeing progress is an exciting and rewarding aspect of your fitness journey You ve dedicated the hours and consistency to your fitness regimen so the next step is to effectively monitor your progress Tracking your gains is important in evaluating the effectiveness of your workout and nutrition routine as well as to ensure the best results Here are some things to keep in mind Plan your resistance training routine Periodization is an essential part of strength training which involves planning or tracking your routine over a certain time frame while switching goals and techniques This involves incorporating de load periods after resistance training phases wherein you reduce the intensity or volume of exercises De loading prevents overtraining improves performance and promotes recovery Varying up your routine through periodization allows your muscles to fully repair in between muscle hypertrophy and endurance phases Keep a training log Record the resistance training exercises you ve performed weight lifted number of reps and sets Also track how many sessions of certain exercises you ve performed your range of motions as well as your rest periods Moreover keep a journal of the circumstances that had an impact on your results such as sleep diet stress or motivation By doing so you will be able to observe how much or how little your muscle has grown Take body measurements Getting your body measurements prior to training provides you a baseline metric to determine whether your resistance training program is working Changes in weight muscle size and body fat percentage will allow you to measure your results You can also take a picture of yourself to regularly to see changes in your body Perform a body composition analysis Body composition analysis is an advanced of method of measuring muscle gains Essentially it measures your body fat percentage muscle mass and strength bone mass and hydration levels There are several types of devices including smart body weighing scales skinfold calipers and apps that allow you to assess body fat percentage Body fat percentage is determined based on muscle gains relative to fat loss Another common way to perform body composition analysis is through a DEXA scan which uses X ray to measure bone density Be consistent Track your progress regularly ideally every two to four weeks Consistently monitoring your progress enables you to review your approach since starting your muscle building regimen FINAL THOUGHTSProtein is an essential component of muscle tissue which aids in building and preserving muscle mass Many people assume that you cannot get enough high quality protein from vegan proteins but this is simply not true Supplementing your protein intake with vegan protein powders is an effective way to meet your requirements Ensuring that you are getting enough protein by consuming vegan protein powders as well as a combination of plant based proteins can effectively support your regimen for muscle building Apart from taking vegan protein powders it is important to focus on your pre and post workout nutrition for optimal performance and results You need to consume a varied diet with a healthy balance of carbs proteins and fats to replenish your energy stores and to prevent muscle breakdown Make sure to log and track your progress consistently to ensure your approach to muscle building is working Frequently Asked Questions Why do you need protein to build muscle Protein are the building blocks of muscles they are a key component of muscle tissue making up of our body s muscle mass It plays a role not just in building but also repairing muscles In order to maintain healthy muscles and promote muscle growth you should consume a protein rich diet Research has shown that upping your daily protein intake more than the recommended daily value can help you build muscles and preserve it as you lose weight Can you build muscle being vegan There is no reason why you can t There are plenty of famous athletes Olympians and body builders who practice veganism who are proof that you can get ripped while being on a vegan diet A lot of misconceptions exist as to whether or not you can build muscle as a vegan while avoiding animal based protein sources Many people still believe that it is not possible to build muscle while being vegan and this is simply not the case Studies have found that plant based protein is just as effective as protein from animal meat for muscle building With careful planning and with the right combination of whole foods exercise and supplementation it is completely possible to build muscles on a plant based diet How do vegan bodybuilders get big Vegan bodybuilders gain muscle by following a plant based dietary pattern that is high in protein and calories Vegans looking to increase muscle mass should eat high quality protein and healthy fats at every meal as well as consuming a variety of plant based foods such as whole grains fruits vegetables and nuts and seeds Moreover in order to build muscle you need to gain more body weight by putting your body in a caloric surplus What is the best vegan protein for building muscle As we ve mentioned you need to be on a high protein diet if you re aiming to build muscle The best vegan protein from plant sources are pea protein soy protein hemp seed protein and brown rice protein This is because these types of protein are complete protein sources that contain adequate amounts of essential amino acids and a diverse number of nutrients which you need to stay healthy and gain muscles Is taking vegan protein powder good for you Consuming vegan protein powder is an excellent way to meet your dietary protein intake requirements as a vegan or vegetarian Vegan protein powders are rich in protein which can aid with muscle growth and repair Besides vegan protein powders are dairy free and free from gluten and allergens so they are perfect for people with food sensitivities They are also easily digestible so you don t have to worry about bloating or indigestion Is plant protein better than whey for muscle gain Whey protein and plant based protein are both effective for muscle growth so one of them is no better than the other Whey protein is a complete protein that is rich in branched chain amino acids BCAAs which are essential amino acids that the body needs for energy recovery and muscle building However certain plant based protein sources such as quinoa and soy are also complete proteins that are rich in essential amino acids Consuming whey protein is advantageous if you want a type of protein that is easily absorbable by the body and have a high protein content of about to grams per serving However whey protein may not be that great for people with lactose intolerance and sensitivities This is where plant based proteins shine as most plant based proteins are perfect for people with dietary restrictions

Monday February How to maintain a sustainable vegan lifestyle and thrive beyond Veganuary So you dipped your toes into veganism this January and you enjoyed it And like of people who took part in Veganuary you intend to continue staying vegan But how do you sustain it We ve put together tips to help you navigate challenges and thrive as a full time vegan after Veganuary covering both diet and lifestyle Look for the Vegan Trademark It s a quick and easy way to spot vegan products that gives you peace of mind knowing a dedicated team at The Vegan Society has put in the time and expertise required for checking the product is vegan every step of the way A product certified by the Vegan Trademark does not contain any animal based ingredients and has not been tested on animals by the company or on its behalf So whether you re shopping for food cosmetics or household cleaning products if it s carrying our trademark it has been thoroughly checked against the strictest standards and by the oldest and most trusted vegan labelling scheme Recreate Your Favourite Recipes Whether it s recipes from your childhood or a regular feature in your weekly meal plans nail down the vegan version of your favourite recipes They offer you that familiar comfort and ease with continuing your vegan journey When you re in a time pinch or you want something you know you re going to love having these go to recipes will help you thrive It can also be fun to experiment with adapting old favourites with a new vegan twist you might even discover you love the updated version even more We often share vegan swaps for popular recipes over on Vegan Trademark s and The Vegan Society s Instagram as well as TikTok so make sure you re following for delicious vegan recipes ideas Dining out Dining out was the biggest challenge during Veganuary according to Veganuary participants If this is something you found challenging this year here are some things to remember when dining out with both vegan and non vegan companions Look for the Vegan Trademark on menus at places like Wagamama and coffee shops like Caff Nero and Costa Coffee Most restaurants will have a vegan option but make sure to peruse the starters and sides you can often make a good meal out of these Take on the role of organiser you get to pick restaurants with a good variety of vegan options Don t sleep on your local restaurants and cafes Often they are ahead of the curve trying interesting new things and more able to adapt dishes and respond to your feedback when curating future menus Follow vegan lifestyle and food influencers local to you for restaurant and menu item suggestions Remember why you re doing this whether it s for the animals the planet your health or all three and make sure to dine out with vegan and vegan curious friends more often Stock up on frozen food and kitchen cupboard staples Stocking up on frozen foods kitchen cupboard staples and your favourite seasonings and sauces means you ll always have a vegan meal to hand whether it s something low effort that involves a baking tray and an oven or something hearty with wholefoods like chickpeas and black beans Some Vegan Trademark certified items you might want to stock up on One Planet Pizza frozen pizzas Clive s Pies Moving Mountains Meatballs Burgers Hotdogs Fishless Fingers and more Quorn Vegan Pieces great to throw into curries stir fries and pies Strong Roots Fries Burgers Bites and more We Love Cake Lemon Tarts and Chocolate Salted Caramel tarts Mr Organic Baked Beans Puy Lentils Chopped Tomatoes Chickpeas and Soups Clearspring Young Jackfruit Chunks a great alternative for fish or pulled meats and Instant Miso Soup Find vegan swaps for your everyday non food essentials With ambiguous terms like plant based cruelty free and vegan friendly often used to label cosmetics and household products it can be confusing knowing what s authentically vegan Take stock of your everyday essentials such as skincare toiletries and cleaning products and once they re used up start transitioning to Vegan Trademark certified alternatives Remember products carrying our trademark do not contain any animal based ingredients have not been tested on by animals by the company or on its behalf Check out our blogs for more information about and vegan swaps for Body care Skincare Curly haircare Makeup and perfume Period care Pregnancy postpartum and baby care Household cleaning products Explore the world of vegan snacks and treats Everyone needs a stash of snacks and sweet treats and these are plentiful in the vegan market with some pretty great alternatives which are often as good as if not better than their non vegan counterparts There s so much fun to be had exploring them particularly on occasions like Easter Halloween and Christmas We ve listed a few suggestions below but keep an eye on our Instagram for all the latest LoveRaw Wafer Bars Galaxy Vegan Bars including their new Hazelnut Praline bar Moo Free chocolates and Easter eggs Mummy Meegz Billie Bar Chuckie Egg and Choccy Balls Skittles Original Sours and more Booja Booja chocolate truffles and ice cream ASDA Ridge Cut Jerk Chicken Flavour Crisps ASDA Free From Nacho Cheese Flavour Tortilla Chips Native Original and Sweet Chilli vegan prawn crackers PROPER Prawn Cocktail Barbecue Sour Cream Chive lentil chips and more Keep up to date with our blogs for guides and tips We regularly upload blogs featuring guides and tips for vegan food and non food swaps as well as delicious recipes Check out some of these Plant milk guide Vegan cheese guide Vegan Fish Swaps Drinks Vegan home Gardening products Follow us on Instagram too for lots more vegan alternatives tips and guides Try new things Did you know our taste buds regenerate approximately every two weeks With this in mind keep trying new things even ones you thought you didn t like before You ll never know what new treasures you ll discover If you tried more fruits and vegetables as a result of going vegan this January well done incorporate these into more dishes and keep trying new fruits vegetables vegan snacks and alternatives This goes for non food items too there is such a rich variety of vegan products out there to explore Get clued up on your nutritional needs You might be worried about not getting enough nutrients like protein and vitamin B on a vegan diet but contrary to what many assume the British Dietetic Association state that well planned vegan diets can support healthy living in people of all ages Being informed about vegan nutrition will support you in sustaining a vegan diet and help you thrive Plus being clued up helps you navigate awkward conversations with friends and family who might challenge you on this topic Check out this handy guide put together by The Vegan Society s registered Dietitian Andrea Rymer to support you with a healthy and balanced vegan diet Supplements The Vegan Society s very own daily supplement VEG can also support a healthy vegan diet It s designed to complement a varied and balanced vegan diet to give your body all the nutrients it needs without animal products It supports a selective approach to supplementation including vitamin B vitamin D iodine selenium and more Find your vegan community Whether it s through following and interacting with vegan food and lifestyle accounts and influencers online or connecting with new people at vegan events and festivals community is so important in remembering your why as well as for practical help with sticking with a vegan lifestyle You ll find inspiring recipes and tips and have some great conversations whether it s about the best vegan egg or skincare alternative or your shared values and compassion for animals If you had fun creating recipes or exploring products in Veganuary why not start your own blog Instagram or TikTok account sharing your ideas helping other beginners and building your vegan community Follow us Follow the Vegan Trademark and Vegan Society on Instagram and TikTok to join the conversation with other vegans and vegan curious followers as well as product updates recipes tips and information about our campaigns Our DMs and comment sections are always open for any questions you might have Source Veganuary Participant Survey By Vegan Society Marketing Officer Nishat Rahman

has been a great start to another year dedicated to animal advocacy Check out our latest spotlights blogs programs and find out about what s coming up for us at Shamayim New Shamayim Team Members Perhaps one of the most exciting things to happen this past month was the addition of new amazing Shamayim team members Mazel tov and welcome Anneliese Matthew David and Isaac Synagogue Vegan Challenge Spotlight Moishe Pod Denver Social Justice Shabbat This was a wonderful Shabbat experience with a great group of young adults in Denver we first brought in Shabbat with a musical Kabbalat Shabbat service along with discussion about food justice tying it in with themes of racial justice as it was MLK weekend After opening up discussion during the service we re visited a more thorough chevruta style conversation at the dinner table about food and environmental justice while eating a delicious vegan meal Everyone was really engaged and shared that it was meaningful to have these discussions Temple Israel of Hollywood Men s Torah Study Men s Torah Study was back on the calendar and I swapped out their normal bagel breakfast order with some vegan options We had some delicious bagels with some plant based shmear and a veggie platter The teaching was great likened the burning bush moment to our climate crisis How many times did Moses anyone walk past the burning bush before finally noticing How many years have we been talking about the climate crisis before we finally change our habits and do something about it The fellows loved the discussion and were absolutely blown away by the shmear they couldn t believe it was coconut based They were all grateful for the opportunity to engage in this discussion and action Rabbi Calvin LJCC Healthy Aging with Dr Susan Friedman Dr Friedman a board certified geriatrician and lifestyle medicine doctor is the founding director of the lifestyle medicine program at the University of Rochester Dr Friedman spoke thoughtfully and at length about the importance of a whole plant food based diet to longevity and well being as one ages The audience was highly engaged and the Q A session extended for over forty minutes because of the many questions and Dr Friedman s thoughtful answers Afterward we enjoyed a spread of mediterranean fare fresh fruit vegan peanut butter cookies and beverages People continued chatting for another hour after the talk Check out the press release for this SVC event here Campus Fellowship Spotlight Dinner and Learn with Miriam The concept aligned with the event s name we shared a meal while studying Jewish texts The gatherings were entirely vegan and focused on animal advocacy For the content I used our first speaker s materials as a framework starting with some of the texts they provided and supplementing them with additional sources Feedback from attendees was overwhelmingly positive they really enjoyed the experience Miriam Missed our Last Program Watch our latest program with PAN Upcoming Debate Due to rules set by our donor this event cannot be recorded or live streamed Want to bring Rabbi Shmuly to your community for a chance to win Apply to debate Rabbi Shmuly here From the Blog Read here From the Feed Become a Member Today Become a member Cover photo of Moose by Yura Forrat https www pexels com photo a moose in a forest in winter

ARCH ENEMY s ALISSA WHITE GLUZ On touring the world on a vegan diet it is totally possible Arch Enemy s Hertogenbosch oktober Hans Lievaart In an interview with Metal Magnitude at last month s Metal Hall Of Fame in Anaheim California ARCH ENEMY singer Alissa White Gluz who is vegan and straight edge was asked if it s difficult for her to maintain her lifestyle while she is on tour She responded I ve been touring for about years and I ve been vegan for years and vegetarian before that so I ve definitely seen it become way easier I ve done it all across the world with language barriers and cultural barriers and lack of time or money or transportation and I m still able to do it So I have to say it is totally possible Moby obviously is a well spoken animal rights activist as well and he s a friend of mine and so he did this documentary Punk Rock Vegan Movie sort of diving into the connection between the punk mentality and by extension the metal mentality and veganism And I think it s a really cool aspect and an interesting facet of the movement Apart from her musical acclaim Alissa is a passionate advocate for animal rights She has been vegetarian since birth and vegan since the s and her dedication to animal rights is evident in her collaborations with various animal welfare organizations and her outspoken stance on issues related to animal exploitation aligning her musical career with a fervent commitment to creating awareness and promoting compassion for all living beings ARCH ENEMY have previously released the video for the title track of their upcoming album Blood Dynasty last October The LP is slated for release on March via Century Media Records Watch Blood Dynasty below Following the surprise drop of their single Dream Stealer in July and the subsequent release of Liars Thieves in October Blood Dynasty marks the third single offering from the highly anticipated album The track promises to deliver ARCH ENEMY s signature blend of powerful guitar riffs and dynamic vocals showcasing the band s evolution while staying true to their roots Founder and guitarist Michael Amott shares The third single from our upcoming album has arrived and it s the title track Blood Dynasty This one shifts gears from the fast and furious energy of our two recent singles diving deeper into melody and atmosphere Immerse yourself in this dystopian soundscape Amott previously stated about Blood Dynasty This new album pushes the boundaries of what we ve done before it s everything you ve come to expect from this band and then some We can t wait for you to hear it and feel the energy we ve poured into every track Welcome to the Blood Dynasty Pre order Arch Enemy s new album Blood Dynasty AT THIS LOCATION Arch Enemy founder and guitarist Michael Amott shares about the new album This new album pushes the boundaries of what we ve done before it s everything you ve come to expect from this band and then some We can t wait for you to hear it and feel the energy we ve poured into every track Welcome to the Blood Dynasty Tracklist Blood Dynasty Dream StealerIlluminate the PathMarch Of the MiscreantsA Million Suns Don t Look DownPresageBlood DynastyPaper
