jpg resize C ssl w https i wp com madrigal delusions blog wp content uploads mmexport jpg resize C ssl w sizes auto max width px vw px After my flirting and subsequent codfighting I felt like I needed to blow off some steam and moved over to try some archery I was actually shockingly good at this after not putting enough umph into my first shot I was literally every shot hitting the centre ring and occasionally hitting the bullseye Imagine how much better I d have been doing if I had glasses that actually match my prescription I do have a video of me shooting a straight bullseye floating around somewhere but I ll have to hunt it down to present it to y all Sarah Chang Violin Concert After a bit of a rough mental health period and sheltering myself from the world for a couple of weeks I decided that I had to kick myself back into action and take myself out on some nice nights out So I booked some tickets for Sarah Chang a famous violinist and took myself out on a really lovely little night I grabbed dinner at Duli made my way across to Fortunate Vegan for a mango chia dessert I found a hidden bar disguised as a rock wall that you could crawl through and then up a flight of stairs into a cozy little speakeasy I grabbed myself a drink chatted with some people there before making my way out to the concert hall I really love how many hidden gems there are tucked around Shanghai The concert was really amazing they played three beautiful pieces and then because encores are such a big thing in China they came out to play another piece and then because encores are such a big thing in China they came out to play another piece and then I ll save you some time They played five encores That was a lot even for China but I m not complaining Honestly it must be so difficult to play with such emotion for such a long time then to do it again and again day after day is absolutely jaw dropping It s made me want to pick up the violin but I ve had a lot of difficulty finding a teacher Please browse to the page to see this content China art museum Set in an absolutely stunning building and filled with art chosen to celebrate and preserve Chinese art and culture the China Art Museum was absolutely one of the most stunning galleries I ve been to in a long time Trying to capture just the sheer beauty and scale of the building the art is housed in is a challenge that I miserably failed Standing there looking up as the building looms over you the brutalist aesthetic making you feel like this was designed for giants creates a sense of awe that is just impossible for me to capture There was so much art in here that captured my attention and heart but alas we re rushing this post out the door so that we can catch up to the present By the end of the day I was genuinely just mentally exhausted the amount of art in this building was just insurmountable to tackle each piece in a meaningful way I reckon you could spend three days just looking at all the art in the galleries A piece that captured my eye in particular was this one It s depicting the battle of Shanghai where the Japanese aggressor pushed their way into the city during World War II It s quite harrowing to be standing there in front of the painting that shows somewhere where I ve stood in real life watching a scene of desolation play out The only colour in frame being the destructive fire burning through the city I stood in front of this painting for a long time Some other players that I really liked or otherwise caught my attention below Please browse to the page to see this content The Slaughterhouse Located near the Jewish holocaust survivor museum lies the Slaughterhouse a place where gutters were carved out of the concrete floor for rivers of blood to funnel away from the killing floors The walls sit almost a metre thick to shelter the surrounding buildings from any harrowed sounds Along the webbed architecture lies sharp corners for people to hide in if the cattle were to panic and stampede Canals weave up and around leading towards the tower in the centre with a floor made out of grates The Slaughterhouse was retired sometime in the last century and while many flock to it for its unique infrastructure I find it hard to walk along the rugged pathways sharp so that the cattle wouldn t slip and not be reminded that every facet of this building was designed to lead living creatures to the tower in centre with a floor made out of grates It s currently serving as a shopping mall and office building it was an interesting place to visit I hope that one day it s used to remind us of a bygone era Please browse to the page to see this content Shanghai museum of contemporary arts Located in an old shipbuilding facility near the river lies the Shanghai Museum of Contemporary Arts I ve actually been here before when I was looking for some weird and unusual furniture however they had an entire new gallery open and my weird seats were all gone Instead someone parked their plane in the middle of the room I don t think anyone told them that they can t park there Not much of the art really struck a cord with me I felt like a lot of it was very pretty and very visually interesting but I just couldn t personally pin down much significant meaning to them The signature piece for example features a tractor car aeroplane and a rocket piercing up through a cloth sky made of second hand clothing There s a lot of meaning that I could ascribe to it in regards to how we progress technology but then leave behind the people on the ground but I m definitely stretching There s a small crack in the wall with a tiny fragment of light peeking through Take a closer look and you can see a small mosquito trapped behind glass trying to get out What is it thinking embalmed in this artwork don t worry it s just a video screen There s several other aesthetic pieces that I ll just share in a big chunk some of them were interesting but I found most just to be aesthetically pleasing Please browse to the page to see this content Hidden at the back of the gallery behind a black curtain lies a golden horn far into the distance The dark room making it impossible to gauge how far back it goes As you approach you hear a chanting sound You feel unwelcome yet drawn closer to the horn When you wake up you re not sure whether the hall was real but the golden horn remains in your memory Painting with Friends I ve been doing some painting with some new friends at Fortunate Vegan Cafe it s a lot of fun just painting and chatting with people I find it also helps to keep me encouraged to paint maybe I m more of a social creature than I thought When I come back to Perth I m looking forwards to setting up my own painting group It s more fun painting with friends especially when you re waiting for watercolours to dry I ve been playing with colours lately just trying new stuff out and trying to make my colours more symbolic than realistic Please browse to the page to see this content Vegan Thanksgiving I attended my first Thanksgiving event wholly vegan of course it was a lot of fun and the people who hosted it also put on like an amateur talent show which I thought was a lot of fun It made me realise that we don t really have a lot of social avenues that allows people to kind of show of their skills but also to show off their skills that they re not very good at with no stakes It was nice that people were singing poorly and doing kind of amateur dancing and there was no sense of shame or embarrassment It was a really welcoming and open environment where people could just get up and do their thing Lots of people danced along and sang along to some songs myself included and all in all it was a lot of fun I think it s important to give people avenues to just have fun in public and to showcase skills even if they re not perfect but just for the sake of showcasing them I really appreciate the homely vibe that the vegan community has in Shanghai I didn t love the food unfortunately it was okay but they did it buffet style which isn t this places specialty Interpretive Dance I went to an interpretive dance performance with my friend and the performer was absolutely incredible The way they contorted their body seemed to break the limits of human form creating a presence that denied the creature any semblance of humanity The show begins with a jagged dagger of light carving its way up the stage slicing through the darkness like a wound From this wound a grotesque hunched figure emerges crawling naked across the stage The creature moves with an unsettling grace its motions disjointed and inhuman as it were tries to experience the world for the first time As the audience watches this primal creature as it comes across as both entirely natural and because of that completely inhuman It is only when the creature dons a dress that it begins to take on a semblance of human form driving home the message that humanity is not inherent but is instead bestowed upon those who conform to societal norms The woman then makes her way around the stage collecting rocks and placing them in the centre as though preparing for some kind of ritual Though we cannot fully understand the cultural or symbolic significance of her actions there is an undeniable sense of rightness as if she is enacting something tribal The pillar she builds constructed from the burdens she has gathered becomes the centre of her celebration She dances around it celebrating this creation until the dawn breaks As the celebration ends she attempts to carry these burdens with her but she soon discovers the crushing weight of what she has gathered No matter how much she conforms she is unable to bear the expectations that society places upon her The delicate balance she struggles to maintain falters over time and inevitably she fails As her life falls apart we are reminded of the impossibility of carrying the full weight of societal demands In the next act the stage transforms and a field of golden wheat is sown across the floor covering the stage The woman now adorned in a dress of shimmering gold that blends seamlessly with the wheat symbolizing her merging with the land and the spirit of nature itself As she moves we see that the wheat flows with her for her dress is the field The next part is hard to get around but I m pretty sure she has the interpretive dance version of sex Afterwards a matriarch comes out to adorn her in glimmering gold Our woman now shimmering in the light erupts across the stage in bursts of violent explosive movements scattering dazzling darts of energy in every direction From this chaotic and glittering shower a child is born In the end the creature having completed its journey crawls back through the wound in the wall from which it first emerged The light ekes away and the stage is enveloped in darkness leaving the audience to wonder at the life that we just witnessed Please browse to the page to see this content So at first I thought that this show was an interpretive way of showing us the burdens that capitalism place on us but as we went further I realised that it was almost certainly talking about the expectations that society places on women and how they crush the people beneath them I got to talk with the dancer afterwards who also created the dance and she more or less confirmed that it s about the expectations society place on women and women s role in society I have to share with you the notes that I took during the show because they re very funny imo Segments Naked wiggle collecting rocks Stack those stones bby dancefrog rocky burdens r us Mommy incoming fabric camel BODY SLAPPIN Glitterprep Glittershimmer Glitterbirth Back into the crack Misc note At start natural presents unnatural to us normality adorned humanity collects things celebrate things become burden burden must be carried things deny humanity Tribal dance tribal dance requires things participate in society you need to carry burdens facilitate humanity Therefore the system demands sacrifice to participate in humanity but strips you of your capacity to be human in doing so Tribal appears weird when one does it possible large group it becomes socially accepted Desert scene possible sex into golden childbirth Woman focus is on burdens and expectations Probably about womanhood hate to just assume that something s about being a woman because it s starring a woman Themes Capitalism seems to indicate that you lose your humanity if you don t participate in the social expectations demanded of us requires carrying burdens sacrificing time harvesting the ground likely Womanhood burdens that society place on women to perform labour ties between fertility and the land note that upon fulfilling societal expectations motherhood she is able to escape the prying eye of the audience Possibly womanhood throughout history Postscript So that s mostly been what I ve been getting up to from about September to November it s pretty wild to think that I ve been away from Australia for months now I haven t been dating since September just been focusing on having a great time in Shanghai and hiking around Zhejiang province I ve talked to my boss about extending my contract so that s up in the pipeline I think once I get confirmation and sign the contract I might get back into dating I m feeling really good about how I m doing even if my apartment is often quite a bit of a mess As I m writing this I m a little ill and I made the mistake of washing my bedsheets you might not immediately understand why this is a mistake but the reason is that my washing machine actually controls the weather in Shanghai and when I turn it on it guarantees that it ll rain so it s currently raining As some of you know I don t do New Years resolutions instead I do seasonal themes which are four month themes that I use to help guide how I want to live in the next four months My seasons align with the New Year and you can blame the world for not aligning the actual seasons to the Gregorian calendar It sometimes takes me a while to figure out what my theme will be this time last year my theme was change and so whenever faced with two options I d choose the one that required me to change I ve had a lot of exciting themes since then but every now and then you need a mellow one So this season my theme is routine I m starting with my sleeping routine and I ve gotten that somewhat under wraps I ve gotten my eating much more consistent and been making good records of my diet for tracking I ve also booked a meeting with a fitness instructor I think a big roadblock to me working out or committing to exercise was trying to figure it all out on my own but actually why would I ever bother doing it on my own I can just pay someone to help me It s expensive to start off with but after I ve got the plan and some guidance on how to follow it I figure I can go it on my own after that Once I ve got my core functions under good routine I m going to be making scheduled times to work on my art my piano and also on catching up with people so hopefully things get a lot more organised It s not something that I plan to keep up forever but for the next months I ll be trying all this out and seeing what works for me and what doesn t Aaaanyway after all that rambling I ll say goodbye Next up I ll be telling you all about my trip to Japan so stay tuned for that

The raw plant based diet which focuses on consuming uncooked and unprocessed plant foods has gained traction for its potential health benefits Proponents argue that raw food diets promote better health increase energy and prevent chronic diseases But what is the science behind these claims and how does a raw plant based diet impact nutrition Understanding the Raw Plant Based Diet A raw plant based diet emphasizes consuming fruits vegetables nuts seeds grains and legumes that are either raw or minimally processed The idea is rooted in the belief that heating food above a specific temperature destroys essential nutrients and enzymes that aid digestion and improve overall health While the concept has existed for centuries it gained popularity in the st century with the rise of health conscious communities and wellness influencers promoting its potential benefits The diet focuses heavily on unprocessed natural foods excluding meat dairy and other animal based products By nature the diet is rich in plant based foods packed with vitamins minerals fiber and antioxidants It s considered a form of veganism but with the additional restriction of avoiding cooking or heating foods Nutritional Advantages of a Raw Plant Based Diet Higher Nutrient Density Raw fruits and vegetables are often rich in vitamins minerals and antioxidants vital for optimal health These nutrients help protect cells from damage support immune function and reduce inflammation For example eating raw leafy greens like spinach and kale provides abundant vitamins A C and K which support vision skin health and bone density Additionally raw foods tend to have a higher water content aiding in hydration Enhanced Digestive Health Many raw plant foods contain enzymes that assist with digestion These enzymes help break down food in the stomach making it easier for the body to absorb nutrients The proponents of the raw plant based diet argue that the enzymes found in raw foods can help digestion reduce bloating and alleviate constipation Additionally raw plant based foods tend to be high in dietary fiber which is beneficial for maintaining a healthy gut and preventing digestive issues Weight Management Because raw plant based diets are typically low in calories and fiber they can support weight management Fiber slows digestion keeping individuals full for extended periods and reducing the tendency to overeat In contrast to many processed foods raw plant based meals are less calorie dense meaning individuals may consume more significant portions without excessive calories This can result in a natural sustainable way to maintain or lose weight over time Chronic Disease Prevention Research suggests that diets rich in fruits vegetables and other plant based foods can help prevent chronic diseases like heart disease diabetes and certain cancers A raw plant based diet is high in antioxidants which protect cells from oxidative stress and free radicals It is known to contribute to aging and the development of chronic illnesses Raw foods particularly vegetables like tomatoes carrots and bell peppers are also rich in flavonoids which have been linked to a lower risk of cardiovascular disease The Myths Surrounding Raw Plant Based Diets Despite the benefits several myths associated with raw plant based diets deserve clarification While raw food diets may work for some they are not necessarily ideal for everyone and understanding these myths is key to making informed dietary decisions All Nutrients Are Better Raw One of the most common misconceptions about raw diets is that cooking destroys all essential nutrients which is not entirely true Some nutrients such as vitamin C and specific B vitamins are sensitive to heat and may degrade during cooking However other nutrients such as lycopene in tomatoes and beta carotene in carrots become more bioavailable when cooked Cooking also helps break down the tough fibers in certain vegetables making them easier to digest The idea that all raw food is superior oversimplifies the complex interactions between cooking and nutrient availability A Raw Plant Based Diet Provides All Necessary Protein Raw plant based diets are often criticized for their potential lack of adequate protein While it is true that many plant based protein sources such as beans lentils nuts and seeds are available on raw diets they may not always be as concentrated in protein as cooked sources Moreover raw diets may lack essential amino acids unless various plant based protein sources are incorporated A well balanced raw plant based diet must include various plant proteins to ensure sufficient intake Raw Plant Based Diets Are Safe and Accessible for Everyone Another myth is that raw plant based diets are suitable for all individuals While raw food can certainly be part of a healthy diet it may not be appropriate for certain groups such as young children pregnant women or those with compromised immune systems These populations may require additional nutrition from cooked or fortified foods In some cases raw foods can also risk foodborne illness due to bacteria and parasites killed by cooking Thus individuals considering a raw plant based diet should consult with a healthcare provider to ensure it meets their specific needs A Raw Plant Based Diet Will Cure Everything Some raw food advocates promote that a raw plant based diet can cure various ailments from cancer to digestive disorders While a healthy diet can support healing and prevent disease it is unlikely that a raw plant based diet alone can cure severe medical conditions Medical treatments lifestyle changes and expert guidance are crucial for managing health conditions effectively The raw plant based diet offers many nutritional benefits including higher nutrient density better digestive health and chronic disease prevention However it is essential to acknowledge the myths surrounding this dietary approach Not all nutrients are better consumed raw and adequate protein intake can be challenging for some individuals A raw plant based diet may not be suitable for everyone and it is essential to maintain balance and variety within the diet to ensure nutritional adequacy Ultimately whether or not to adopt a raw plant based diet should be a personal decision based on individual health needs and preferences For those interested in exploring the raw food lifestyle seeking advice from a registered dietitian or healthcare provider is always recommended to ensure nutritional needs are met

From veganuary com There is a little talked about phenomenon among Veganuary participants While they may have taken part for a health boost or to do their bit to protect the planet the month long vegan pledge can actually help them to discover something much more profound Here six Veganuary alumni talk about their paths to inner peace connecting with their intrinsic values and finding a beautiful sense of freedom Kim Mogg SheffieldKim and her boyfriend reached a compromise He had wanted to bring a pet bird into their home but Kim was worried about how their dog might react and so instead they agreed to adopt some hens Kim contacted a charity that rescues spent hens from farms when they would otherwise go to slaughter We wanted to get two she says but we came home with four Hens who have been used by the egg industry are often in very poor health and Kim dedicated herself to giving them the very best life possible I like to think my girls are enjoying their retirement she says As she got to know them better Kim fell so in love with my feathered girls and began to experience a deep sense of disquiet She realised that she was spending time with them in the garden and then going inside and cooking their sister And that did not sit right with her at all It just got too much for me Kim told us and I decided in January to go vegan She is proud to say that she hasn t looked back Today Kim loves to try out the huge variety of vegan cheeses and cooks with more flavours and colours than ever before She says she feels less sluggish than before doing Veganuary and no longer reaches for ultra processed snacks when hungry Best of all that awful sense of guilt has gone And as for the eggs her rescued girls still lay well the postman is always happy to take six when he drops off a parcel Laura Taylor TrowbridgeLike Kim Laura is a true animal lover She had brought home her first cat an unwanted farm kitten when she was just three years old and as an adult would regularly hold up traffic so she could help an injured or abandoned animal on the roadside Unsurprisingly Laura got a job at an RSPCA cats and dogs centre where she helped animals find a new home While there she saw reports of farmed animals being kept in poor conditions and was deeply saddened by them What may be surprising is that although Laura switched to a vegetarian diet at times including after watching the film Seaspiracy her default food choices included meat I have always struggled with the sense that I m an animal lover that still ate meat she told us That struggle combined with some digestive issues led Laura to take part in Veganuary Laura completely embraced the experience threw herself into label reading tried out lots of recipes and immersed herself in many different films including Cowspiracy Okja had me in bits she says but she now has all the motivation she could need to stay vegan I love that I m no longer a hypocrite and don t have to wrestle with my beliefs she says And I love knowing that I m not eating the animals that I love Ejvor Berg Lidk ping SwedenEjvor grew up an animal lover within a hunting family and within a friendship group where everyone ate and still eats meat She says that she always felt odd an outsider and that feeling only amplified when she decided to take part in Veganuary back in I wanted to help animals she says They are like us they feel think feel fear and pain and they have wise brains They re smarter than humans We destroy the world animals take only what they need to survive and nothing more Today nine years on from her Veganuary experience Ejvor has made peace with being thought odd I m proud to be vegan she says l sign petitions for non human individuals in my country and beyond I support with money when l can Two years ago I found a vegan group which is really amazing Some of her friends still try to argue with her which she says can be hurtful but she knows she has done the right thing I ll not change she says My eyes are open Christopher Dallosso OxfordshireChristopher had known about Veganuary for some time before taking part He had become interested in the philosophy of veganism because of a vague feeling of something being wrong and the more he thought about it the more hypocritical it felt to him to eat animals After all he loved seeing animals out in the wild and would never think of harming them But deep down he did not really want to become vegan so he decided to do lots of research to find the reasons he should not take part For every argument against veganism I could find there seemed to be a stronger counter argument defending it he says As soon as I realised there wasn t some fatal flaw with the philosophy of veganism I started understanding its benefits Treating all animals as individuals rather than commodities felt like the most important aspect to me but a heavily reduced impact on the environment and possible health benefits made the switch seem like a no brainer Christopher took part and the daily emails he received helped him to navigate a vegan world Today he reports that he feels more positive since becoming vegan which he says helped him complete his GCSEs He even did a presentation on veganism for his English speaking assessment which went really well But it is the difference Christopher is making in the world that has brought him so much peace We re so shielded from the atrocities going on in factory farms we don t connect buying animal products in shops with animals being exploited and killed just for our pleasure he told us Being vegan has taken away any feelings of guilt I had about eating certain foods It feels like a much cleaner and healthier diet especially if you eat plenty of naturally vegan products like vegetables and pulses I m glad that I can make a meaningful difference to the lives of so many animals and be part of a growing movement towards a more compassionate world Annalisa Botham BlabyAnnalisa experienced and thankfully survived deep and prolonged trauma as a child In a chaotic volatile and violent world she says it was animals who kept her sane The cats and dogs who found their way into her family home were her loyal loving dependable friends I knew how much the animals in my childhood did for me she says Without them I honestly don t think I would be here The grief and pain Annalisa carried into adulthood translated into some self destructive behaviours but through it all she remembered the animals and at times felt as though they were her looking out for her acting as her guardian angels It was never a spoken thing but it was a given that I would be forever indebted she says Annalisa had been vegetarian for a while but was pressed into eating meat again by a person she felt unable to oppose It took me another years sadly to go back to being a vegetarian and then finally vegan she says But by then she knew what she had to do It was THE only way if I wanted to be true to my promise and my love of animals I ve never looked back because it all aligns now It s not even a chore or anything like that it s just love and respect Now I show animals how thankful I am for their unconditional love Kelly Dibbert BrightonKelly was a nutritionist and had been taught to promote animal products to her clients She believed that we need animal protein and fats to be healthy and bone broth to heal and rebalance I now know that not to be true she says I ve read countless peer reviewed studies and researched the science I have a degree in chemistry so I love to know as much as I can all the details all the delicious facts As many of us have experienced Kelly found that the pro meat messaging was coming at her from all quarters My parents the media friends restaurants society my education had drummed it into me that meat is good she says It was like being stuck in a cycle of suffering She says she d had qualms about it all but she wanted to fit in and not stand out or cause a fuss It took many more years before Kelly transitioned to a vegan diet but she found that the benefits have been enormous I now know that I haven t given anything up I ve gained more self respect a richer more varied and fulfilling diet and a deep compassion for animals I bloody love good food and I ve learned to really enjoy cooking again Kelly says it feels wonderful not to eat animals and their milk I feel lighter emotionally healthier empowered and authentically me I m more connected with animals nature and humanity now that I choose a plant based diet I had disconnected from a huge part of the real me by consuming rotting flesh I am now free I want to thank Veganuary for giving me that extra little push that I needed she says and for making it easy I only wish I d followed my heart sooner Better late than never https veganuary com veganuary helped me be true to myself

A plant based diet is more than just a trend it is a lifestyle choice that offers numerous benefits for health the environment and overall well being If you are considering transitioning to a plant based diet this comprehensive guide will help you understand its benefits and provide practical tips for beginners What is a Plant Based Diet A plant based diet primarily focuses on foods derived from plants including fruits vegetables nuts seeds legumes and whole grains Unlike veganism which excludes all animal products a plant based diet allows for flexibility meaning some individuals may include small amounts of dairy meat or fish while still prioritising plant based foods Health Benefits of a Plant Based Diet Improved Heart Health A plant based diet is rich in fibre antioxidants and healthy fats which contribute to better cardiovascular health Studies have shown that individuals who consume more plant based foods have a lower risk of heart disease high blood pressure and stroke Weight Management Many people find it easier to maintain or lose weight on a plant based diet due to the lower calorie density of plant foods Whole foods such as vegetables fruits and legumes provide essential nutrients while keeping calorie intake in check Lower Risk of Chronic Diseases A diet high in fruits vegetables and whole grains has been linked to a reduced risk of type diabetes certain types of cancer and Alzheimer s disease Plant based foods are rich in phytonutrients which have protective effects against various illnesses Better Digestion and Gut Health Fibre is crucial for a healthy digestive system and plant based foods are abundant in dietary fibre A fibre rich diet promotes gut health reduces constipation and supports a balanced microbiome Enhanced Energy Levels Many individuals who transition to a plant based diet report increased energy levels Whole nutrient dense foods provide steady energy without the crashes associated with processed foods and high sugar consumption Environmental Benefits of a Plant Based Diet Reduced Carbon Footprint Animal agriculture is a major contributor to greenhouse gas emissions By eating more plant based foods individuals can significantly lower their carbon footprint and contribute to a more sustainable planet Conservation of Water Resources Producing plant based foods requires far less water than animal agriculture Choosing a diet rich in fruits vegetables and legumes can help conserve water resources globally Protection of Wildlife and Biodiversity Deforestation for livestock farming threatens biodiversity A shift towards plant based eating helps protect natural habitats and preserve ecosystems How to Transition to a Plant Based Diet Start Gradually If you are new to plant based eating start by incorporating more plant based meals into your diet rather than making an abrupt change Begin with Meatless Mondays and gradually increase plant based meals throughout the week Experiment with Plant Based Proteins Protein is a common concern for those new to a plant based diet Excellent plant based protein sources include lentils chickpeas quinoa tofu tempeh and nuts Experiment with different sources to find what you enjoy most Diversify Your Meals Eating a variety of plant based foods ensures you receive all essential nutrients Try new fruits vegetables and whole grains to keep meals interesting and nutritious Plan Your Meals Meal planning can help prevent reliance on processed plant based options which may not always be the healthiest choice Preparing home cooked meals using fresh whole ingredients ensures optimal nutrition Stay Informed About Nutrient Intake While a plant based diet is nutrient rich it is important to ensure adequate intake of vitamin B iron omega fatty acids and calcium Consider fortified foods or supplements if needed Enjoy Plant Based Alternatives There are plenty of plant based alternatives available including dairy free milk plant based cheeses and meat substitutes While whole foods should be the focus these alternatives can help with the transition Listen to Your Body Every individual s body is different Pay attention to how you feel and make adjustments to your diet accordingly Seek professional guidance if needed to ensure a balanced and sustainable approach Common Myths About a Plant Based Diet Myth Plant Based Diets Lack Protein Reality There are plenty of protein rich plant based foods such as legumes quinoa and nuts A well planned plant based diet can provide all essential amino acids Myth A Plant Based Diet is Expensive Reality A plant based diet can be budget friendly when focusing on whole foods like grains beans and seasonal vegetables Processed plant based foods can be costly but they are not necessary for a healthy diet Myth You Need to Eat Only Salads Reality A plant based diet is diverse and includes hearty meals like stir fries soups grain bowls and plant based pasta dishes Myth A Plant Based Diet is Difficult to Maintain Reality With proper planning and an understanding of nutrient rich foods a plant based diet can be sustainable and enjoyable Delicious Plant Based Meal Ideas Breakfast Oatmeal with almond milk flaxseeds and fresh berries Avocado toast with cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of sesame seeds Lunch Chickpea salad sandwich with whole grain bread Quinoa and roasted vegetable bowl with tahini dressing Dinner Stir fried tofu with brown rice and steamed broccoli Lentil soup with whole grain bread Snacks Hummus with carrot and cucumber sticks Mixed nuts and dried fruits Final Thoughts A plant based diet offers numerous health and environmental benefits making it an excellent choice for anyone looking to improve their overall well being Whether you choose to adopt a fully plant based lifestyle or simply incorporate more plant based meals into your diet small changes can lead to significant improvements in health and sustainability Starting with gradual adjustments experimenting with a variety of foods and ensuring proper nutrition can make the transition enjoyable and long lasting The journey to a plant based lifestyle is personal but the benefits are universal better health a greener planet and a thriving vibrant lifestyle

Singer songwriter Lizzo has always been open about her health journey emphasizing self love and balance Today she s hit her weight loss thanks to a combination of mindful eating realistic expectations and workouts that make her feel strong With the help of weight loss experts we re diving into why her approach works and how you can incorporate similar practices into your routine Lizzo celebrates reaching her weight loss goal The Good As Hell singer recently celebrated a major milestone in her weight loss journey sharing with fans that she officially hit her goal weight On January the singer posted a mirror selfie on Instagram with the message Congratulations You ve met your weight goals View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lizzo lizzobeeating In another photo she zoomed in on her torso edited with a progress update graphic Today when I stepped on my scale I reached my weight release goal she wrote in the caption I haven t seen this number since Let this be a reminder you can do anything you put your mind to Time for new goals She also shared an old video of herself on Instagram stories talking about her intentional weight loss journey In it she reflected Even at the end of my weight loss journey I m not going to be considered thin by any means But I will be happy In an updated clip Lizzo smiled and said And I am happy Addressing rumors about her weight loss Since sharing her journey on social media Lizzo has faced speculation that she used weight loss drugs with comments like How you get skinny so fast In an Instagram post in September she shut down the rumors writing When you finally get Ozempic allegations after months of weight training and calorie deficit Rather than turning to weight loss drugs Lizzo told the New York Times in that she has been methodical losing weight very slowly And that steady manageable approach is key Caloric restriction and weight training are two of the most important components to weight loss and maintenance explains Amy Lee MD Chief Medical Advisor at Lindora As we age we lose muscle mass which affects our metabolism or the ability to burn calories Together a calorie deficit and weight training create a balanced approach because the calorie deficit drives fat loss while weight training enhances strength metabolism and body composition adds Catherine Gervacio RND a registered nutritionist and diet consultant for WOWMD What Lizzo s diet looks like prioritizing protein and energy After transitioning from veganism Lizzo now follows a balanced high protein diet After tests and research she said in a TikTok video I found that animal proteins helped me have more energy lose weight and helped with my mental fog Her daily meals which she often shares online include lean proteins like grilled chicken and egg whites fresh vegetables and homemade tea Animal protein is a complete protein source providing all essential amino acids that the body cannot produce on its own explains Gervacio Animal proteins such as ocean caught fish can have higher levels of omega which is great for brain health while red meat has higher levels of B which is great for metabolism adds Dr Lee This isn t to say that a vegan diet isn t healthy However Gervacio notes that without proper planning it may lack essential nutrients like vitamin B iron omega fatty acids and high quality protein leading to fatigue or deficiencies So how do you incorporate more protein into your diet Have eggs and fruits or high fiber bread for breakfast or have some Greek yogurt with nuts and seeds advises Gervacio Include lean meats like chicken or turkey or fish like salmon and tuna along with salads or cooked vegetables for lunch or dinner Snacks can be protein rich options like cottage cheese with high fiber bread hard boiled eggs with salad greens or beef jerky with fresh fruit Weight Loss Kelly Clarkson Lost Weight Walking Here s How You Can Too After Kelly Clarkson debuted her striking weight loss in most heads turned toward Ozempic While the Grammy Award winning music star has opted to keep private some of the specifics such as which weight loss drug she used she s been relatively open about her health journey overall In fact she offered a glimpse at the Lizzo s favorite workouts Building strength without stress Lizzo s philosophy is about feeling good and healthy not achieving a specific look Her workouts range from intense circuit training and Pilates to jump rope and light treadmill walking sessions She credits Pilates with helping her heal back pain and build core strength Pilates is one of my favorites as it not only can get your heart rate up but it has added resistant training And depending on the regimen pilates on a reformer can help with stretch which can help with prevention of injuries says Dr Lee Additionally it can help with alignment posture and breathing all supporting your back Meanwhile jumping rope can help your heart Jumping rope is a high intensity cardio workout that burns a significant number of calories It improves cardiovascular fitness and strengthens the lower body and core says Gervacio And Dr Lee adds that jumping in general can help increase bone density which improves balance As much as these exercises sound intense Lizzo reminds her followers to never go overboard or stress yourself out When it comes to cardio she enjoys walking outdoors daily I like to walk because any stress any anxiety any tension any anger that I ve had in my body I kind of forget about it by the time I m done walking she said in a February TikTok video Weight Loss Jessica Simpson Lost Lbs by Walking More Copy Her Success Jessica Simpson s weight loss remains arguably one of the most discussed celebrity transformations in the last decade In the actress and singer wowed the world with her transformation when she dropped pounds after giving birth to her third child At the time the burning question was how did she do it Especially because Self love over perfection Lizzo s body positivity message As a body positivity advocate Lizzo doesn t aim for thinness She embraces body fluctuations and views health as holistic The idea of body positivity has evolved into body neutrality she explained Her advice is simple prioritize health and happiness over external validation And if you slip up that s okay too Following a healthy lifestyle is all about having a strong mindset says Gervacio This builds habits and discipline and eventually becomes a part of your lifestyle Focus on non scale victories and celebrate improvements in energy strength mood or how clothes fit rather than just numbers on a scale How to incorporate Lizzo s tips into your routine Lizzo s slow and steady approach to weight loss is one of the healthiest ways to achieve lasting results Here are some key takeaways from her journey Start small Incorporate easy habits like drinking more water or adding a short walk outside to your day Find balance Eat nourishing high protein meals most of the time but don t deprive yourself of your favorite treats Be consistent Choose workouts or fitness activities you enjoy to make movement sustainable Focus on mental health Address stressors and emotions that may affect your relationship with food and exercise Rather than getting discouraged by weight fluctuations understand that they re natural and health is multifaceted as Gervacio emphasizes More celebrity weight loss stories How Mindy Kaling Found Weight Loss Success I Eat What I Like to Eat Nicola Coughlan on Weight Loss Why the Bridgerton Star Wants the Focus on Her Work Not Her Size Chrissy Metz Shares the Key Habits That Helped Her Lose Pounds This content is not a substitute for professional medical advice or diagnosis Always consult your physician before pursuing any treatment plan

Vegans will find Saudi Arabia to be rich in choice regarding meat free eateries Many foods in this category are well known traditional dishes in the country with a rich endowment in plant foods With the right dishes and exploration of the local food veganism is perfectly doable and pleasant Here is how to adopt veganism in Saudi Arabia and taste all that traditional food offers How to Choose Traditional Vegan Dishes in Saudi Arabia In Saudi culture many foods are made with fresh culinary production and the procedure is simple While discovering these dishes especially when travelling on religious tours you can choose dishes that match your Trusted Islamic Travel Agency the most conveniently and comfortably Hummus It is a tasty opportunity to taste hummus a paste made of chickpeas tahini lemon juice and garlic We eat it with bread or make sandwiches with it Falafel Enjoy the taste of the pear shaped fried patties made from mashed chickpeas or fava beans called falafel A scoop of tahini and freshly cut raw vegetables make a great addition to this fast food packed inside the pita pocket Lentil Soup Lentil soup includes red lentils onions and spices The Chinese are so right there s nothing quite as fulfilling and satisfying as soup as it fills and warms you up Baba Ganoush Baba ganoush is a thin purplish black dip made from grilled aubergines mashed with tahini chopped garlic and lemon juice You know what It is good for eating and you can take over bread or vegetables Mujaddara Try mujaddara a rice and lentil dish garnished with crispy onions It is a complete meal plate because it is fully satisfying Enjoy Rice Based Dishes Saudi foods commonly use rice a key ingredient in many dishes It is usually best to cook rice dishes as vegan or without non vegan ingredients Mandi Without Meat Order the mandi without meat It includes spiced and still has some juice and taste the spiced rice can be served with salad or any vegetable Kabsa Without Meat Ask for kabsa without meat This particular rice meal can satisfy people s desire for a meal produced from spices in preparation Harees Vegan Version So when you order harees ensure that all ingredients are grains and spices They can be vegan when changed because many cook this meal at home Try Saudi Bread Bread is also among the Saudi food most bread is appropriate for a vegan diet With a Hajj Umrah visa you can easily explore vegan friendly options during your trip Tamees You can bake Tamees as flatbread in a tandoor or oven They make an excellent vegetable dip and are ideal to accompany hummus lentil soup or baba ganoush Pita Bread It can be used to make sandwiches or complement some dishes Put falafel several vegetables and even tahini sauce in it and you have a complete meal Za atar Bread This food could be ordered as za atar bread with olive oil sesame seeds and thyme sprinkled on top It is more flavourful when consumed as a snack or familiar with other foods Indulge in Date Based Treats Dates are a part of Saudi Arabian tradition and a food ingredient They can be purchased almost anywhere and come in many forms Fresh Dates Eat some fresh dates It will make you sweet and refreshed if you ever have low energy Some famous dates are Ajwa Sukkary and Khidri Stuffed Dates Stuffed dates filled with almonds or coconut are a nutritious food for dessert Discover Vegan Snacks You can find several vegan snacks in Saudi Arabia made from essential ingredients including Foul Medames Order foul medames This meal is prepared from fava beans garlic and lemon juice It is a perfect snack when eaten with flatbread Vegetable Sambousek You can choose sambousek from eggplants bell peppers zucchini potatoes cauliflower squash or spinach These pastries are good for breakfast Roasted Chickpeas Spiced roasted chickpeas make a great snack because they are light and easily digested They are delicious natural crisp and perfect especially as a vegan Sip on Vegan Friendly Drinks Saudi Arabia brings refreshing vegan drinks suitable for taking with meals Mint Tea It is important to note that mint tea does not interfere with most conventional menus in any way You can order it for a light meal and still feel like you ve just taken a breath Jallab The tasty Jallab is made from grape molasses dates and rose water It is warm on hot days How to Eat Vegan in Saudi Arabia Follow these tips to make your vegan journey with Umrah packages in Saudi Arabia smooth and enjoyable Ask for customisation Specify your order with servers and request food free from meat and dairy products Restaurants respect people s dietary choices Visit Middle Eastern restaurants Eating in restaurants serving food from your chosen country is good This includes more vegan meal options Shop at local markets You should buy your groceries such as fruits vegetables and grains to prepare your meals as these are considered fresh I must admit that vegetarian meals are not challenging because many restaurants have vegetarian meals Final Thoughts In conclusion being vegan in Saudi Arabia is quite simple if you go to the correct destinations we have already written about being in vegan in Hail The country s cuisine offers many excellent meals for those who believe in plant based food The Saudi people in particular say it is the best for food They are not limited in their choices when on a diet they can have lentil soup and falafel for example Let yourself face a vegan part of Saudi Arabian food and enjoy every traditional dish Therefore if you have a Hajj Umrah visa you can taste vegan friendly meals during your trip Second photo by Christopher Alvarenga on Unsplash

As the planet faces increasing environmental challenges one of the most effective yet often overlooked solutions is the adoption of a vegan lifestyle While many people focus on the health benefits of plant based eating the environmental impact especially in terms of pollution and soil degradation is profound In this article we ll explore how choosing a vegan lifestyle can help reduce pollution and soil degradation two critical issues that threaten the planet s ecosystems and biodiversity Understanding Pollution and Soil Degradation Before we dive into the specifics it s important to understand what we mean by pollution and soil degradation Pollution refers to the presence of harmful substances or contaminants in the air water and soil typically as a result of human activity This includes chemicals waste products and greenhouse gases that harm ecosystems and contribute to global warming Soil degradation occurs when the soil s health and fertility are compromised due to factors like erosion loss of nutrients and contamination Agricultural practices especially industrial farming are a primary driver of soil degradation leading to reduced agricultural productivity and long term environmental harm Both of these issues are strongly linked to agricultural practices particularly those associated with animal farming The good news Adopting a vegan lifestyle can help alleviate both pollution and soil degradation in significant ways How Animal Agriculture Contributes to Pollution and Soil Degradation To fully appreciate the impact of veganism on pollution and soil health it s crucial to understand how animal agriculture contributes to these problems Water Pollution and Runoff Animal farming produces massive amounts of waste feces urine and leftover feed that often ends up in rivers streams and lakes This waste contains harmful chemicals like nitrogen and phosphorus which can cause nutrient pollution in water bodies leading to algal blooms and dead zones where aquatic life cannot survive Moreover the chemicals used in growing animal feed such as pesticides herbicides and fertilizers often wash into waterways further polluting the environment Soil Erosion and Overgrazing Intensive farming particularly livestock grazing leads to soil erosion Overgrazing by animals like cattle sheep and goats prevents vegetation from growing back which exposes the soil to wind and water erosion This process not only depletes the soil of essential nutrients but also reduces its ability to retain water making it less productive over time In addition the large scale production of feed crops corn soy and alfalfa for livestock also leads to soil degradation Monoculture farming in which the same crop is planted repeatedly in the same soil depletes the soil s nutrient content and increases the need for chemical fertilizers and pesticides Air Pollution The livestock sector is a major source of air pollution releasing harmful gases like methane ammonia and particulate matter into the atmosphere Methane in particular is a potent greenhouse gas that has a far greater warming potential than carbon dioxide Animal waste and manure also release ammonia into the air which can contribute to acid rain and harm local ecosystems How Veganism Helps Reduce Pollution and Soil Degradation Switching to a vegan lifestyle can have a profound and positive effect on both pollution and soil degradation Here s how Reducing Water Pollution By choosing plant based foods over animal products we reduce the demand for factory farming which is a leading cause of water pollution Without the need for large scale livestock operations less animal waste will end up contaminating our water sources Additionally growing crops for human consumption requires far fewer chemicals and fertilizers than feed crops for livestock leading to less runoff and reduced water contamination Moreover plant based farming generally uses less water than animal farming especially when it comes to water intensive livestock like cattle This means that less water is used for both irrigation and livestock maintenance ultimately lowering the risk of water pollution caused by overuse Preventing Soil Erosion and Promoting Healthier Soil By reducing the need for grazing and intensive animal agriculture a vegan lifestyle helps preserve the integrity of the soil Vegan diets emphasize plant based crops like vegetables fruits grains and legumes many of which can be grown in more sustainable farming systems that emphasize crop rotation organic farming and reduced use of harmful chemicals Furthermore plant based agriculture tends to be less disruptive to the soil than animal agriculture For example crops like legumes can actually improve soil health by fixing nitrogen in the soil enriching it with the nutrients it needs to remain productive These farming practices help to reduce soil erosion and degradation ensuring that the land remains fertile for future generations Lowering Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Air Pollution Livestock farming is one of the largest sources of methane emissions which significantly contribute to global warming and air pollution By adopting a vegan diet you directly decrease the demand for animal products leading to lower methane emissions The plant based foods that replace animal products grains legumes fruits and vegetables generate far fewer emissions Additionally reducing animal farming lowers the need for massive manure storage and management which are major sources of ammonia emissions With fewer factory farms we reduce both air and water pollution which benefits not only the environment but also public health Encouraging More Sustainable Agricultural Practices Veganism also supports more sustainable agricultural practices by reducing the demand for monoculture farming and large scale animal feed production As plant based diets become more popular there is a shift toward diverse sustainable farming systems that prioritize soil health crop biodiversity and regenerative agriculture techniques Farmers who grow plants for direct human consumption are increasingly adopting methods like no till farming agroforestry and permaculture These techniques help to preserve soil structure reduce erosion and improve water retention By choosing vegan options we encourage these sustainable farming practices and reduce the environmental harm caused by industrial agriculture Conclusion A Vegan Lifestyle for Cleaner Healthier Soil and Air Adopting a vegan lifestyle is a powerful tool for reducing pollution and soil degradation By decreasing the demand for harmful practices like intensive animal farming we can significantly lower water pollution prevent soil erosion and reduce the emission of greenhouse gases and other pollutants Not only does veganism offer a direct way to lower your environmental impact but it also promotes a more sustainable and resilient food system that can better withstand the challenges of climate change The shift toward plant based eating is not just good for your health it s essential for the health of the planet At SAF Restaurant we re proud to offer a variety of delicious sustainable plant based options that help our guests contribute to a cleaner greener future Together we can make a difference one meal at a time

As the world grapples with the challenges of climate change one powerful and increasingly popular way individuals can reduce their carbon footprint is through adopting a vegan lifestyle The environmental benefits of a plant based diet go far beyond simply choosing greener foods they play a crucial role in tackling one of the most pressing environmental issues we face today global warming In this article we ll explore how shifting to a vegan lifestyle can significantly reduce your carbon footprint and contribute to a more sustainable future for our planet What is a Carbon Footprint Before diving into the specifics let s clarify what a carbon footprint is It refers to the total amount of greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide CO and methane CH emitted into the atmosphere as a result of human activity These gases trap heat in the Earth s atmosphere contributing to the greenhouse effect and accelerating global warming In everyday terms your carbon footprint includes everything from your energy consumption electricity heating etc to the food you eat the products you buy and even how you travel The food industry particularly animal agriculture is a significant contributor to global carbon emissions View Post The Environmental Toll of Animal Agriculture Animal agriculture especially beef and dairy production is responsible for a large portion of global greenhouse gas emissions Here s why Methane Emissions Livestock like cows sheep and goats produce methane during digestion a potent greenhouse gas that is times more effective at trapping heat in the atmosphere than carbon dioxide Land Use and Deforestation To raise animals for food vast areas of land are cleared often through deforestation particularly in tropical regions like the Amazon rainforest Deforestation releases carbon that was previously stored in trees adding to the overall greenhouse gas emissions Feed Production Growing crops to feed livestock especially corn and soy also generates emissions not to mention the heavy use of fertilizers and pesticides that further contribute to the carbon footprint Energy Consumption The industrial scale operation of factory farms requires significant amounts of energy for maintaining animal housing processing meat and transporting products How Veganism Reduces Carbon Emissions Adopting a vegan lifestyle helps reduce your carbon footprint in several important ways Lowering Greenhouse Gas Emissions Livestock farming is responsible for a substantial portion of global methane emissions By eliminating meat and dairy from your diet you directly reduce the demand for these high emission industries Studies have shown that switching to a plant based diet can reduce an individual s food related carbon emissions by up to For example producing a single pound of beef generates more than pounds of CO equivalent emissions In contrast a plant based food like lentils or beans has a significantly lower environmental cost contributing far fewer greenhouse gases to the atmosphere Reducing Land Use and Deforestation As demand for meat and dairy products decreases so does the need for massive amounts of land to raise animals and grow their feed By choosing plant based foods we help reduce deforestation and habitat destruction which are critical for slowing climate change Forests act as carbon sinks absorbing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere Protecting forests and allowing them to thrive helps mitigate global warming Energy Efficiency in Food Production Growing crops for human consumption generally requires far less energy than raising animals for food While animal agriculture relies on energy intensive processes such as raising feeding and processing animals plant based agriculture has a much lower energy demand Additionally plant based foods typically require fewer resources for transportation as they can be grown locally and do not require refrigeration or extensive processing Encouraging Sustainable Agricultural Practices As the demand for plant based foods rises farmers are incentivized to shift toward more sustainable farming practices Crop rotation organic farming and regenerative agriculture are becoming more common as part of this movement These methods help preserve the soil reduce pesticide and fertilizer use and minimize the carbon footprint associated with food production Promoting Sustainable Diets A global shift toward plant based eating could have far reaching effects If more people adopted vegan diets there would be a significant reduction in the resources required to feed the planet making food systems more efficient and environmentally friendly This transition would help address the inefficiencies in global food production which is especially crucial as the world faces an increasing population and the threat of food insecurity Veganism in Numbers The Climate Impact To better understand the impact consider these statistics A study by Oxford University found that switching to a vegan diet could reduce your personal carbon footprint from food by up to The United Nations has highlighted the fact that reducing meat consumption is one of the most effective ways individuals can help fight climate change According to research from the Environmental Working Group beef production is the most carbon intensive food producing more than times the greenhouse gas emissions per calorie than plant based foods like grains vegetables or legumes Conclusion Veganism as a Tool for Climate Action The decision to adopt a vegan lifestyle can be a powerful and effective way to reduce your carbon footprint and take meaningful action against climate change By reducing greenhouse gas emissions lowering the demand for land and supporting more sustainable agricultural practices veganism directly contributes to a healthier planet Every plant based meal you consume adds to the collective effort to mitigate global warming and protect the environment So whether you re looking to cut back on meat for health reasons ethical considerations or environmental impact know that your choices matter By making small changes in our diets we can all play a part in reducing the carbon emissions that are fueling the climate crisis Every bite counts in the fight for a sustainable healthy future for generations to come
