Vegan documentaries are a powerful way to learn about the world from your couch In just a few hours they can open your eyes to important topics like animal rights the environment and health These films use storytelling and facts to inspire change and compassion There are documentaries that explore the impact of food choices on the planet and our bodies Some focus on reversing disease through diet while others reveal the hidden cruelty of animal farming You ll also find films that dive deep into oceans showcasing the beauty and struggles of underwater life Each documentary highlights issues that often go unseen encouraging viewers to think differently Thankfully many of these documentaries are easy to find on platforms like Netflix They are accessible thought provoking and sometimes life changing Watching them is a great way to gain knowledge and become a more informed advocate for a kinder world If you re ready to expand your understanding and discover how small changes can make a big difference these films are a great place to start Grab a cozy seat and explore the many stories waiting to be told Whether you re new to veganism or just curious there s something here for everyone So are you ready to learn reflect and be inspired Let s dive in and explore some of the most enlightening vegan documentaries available Don t forget popcorn is optional but always welcome The Game Changers Documentary Netflix Think you need meat to bulk up and become a top performing athlete Think again Even if you re not interested in building muscle or trying out a triathlon this documentary will leave you with a massive dose of knowledge and inspiration Produced by James Cameron Arnold Schwarzenegger and Jackie Chan it s a must see You ll learn the science behind the protein myth and be blown away by the plant based success of these world renowned athletes in action You Are What You Eat A Twin Experiment Netflix This newly released groundbreaking Netflix documentary focuses on the health benefits of switching to a plant based diet It follows identical twins in a well conducted study having them adopt different lifestyles for weeks to see how their diets impact health markers like visceral fat cholesterol risk of heart disease and more What The Health Documentary Netflix One of the best vegan documentaries for anyone interested in health and wellness This movie will open your eyes to the collusion and corruption of government establishments concerning food health and nutrition Although at times amusing and entertaining it s still a serious and solid look at what is happening with our nation s health Forks Over Knives An inspiring inside look at how diseases of affluence can be easily controlled and even reversed through diet alone If you know anyone with Type II diabetes heart disease or hypertension this film is for them It may even save their life Incredibly down to earth and practical this movie will empower you to reclaim your health and will greatly influence your next grocery list You ll be rooting for Forks for eating fresh whole foods over Knives for performing open heart surgery for sure Cowspiracy Netflix Environmentalist Kip Anderson embarks on a mission to find answers and solutions to our world s greatest environmental problems He does an incredible job documenting the factory farming industry and how it is so destructive to our environment You ll see interviews with the leaders of major environmental groups that largely ignore these issues and the well hidden reasons why It s one of the best movies revealing how detrimental factory farms are to the health of our world and to all those who live in it Seaspiracy Netflix This groundbreaking documentary produced by the same team from Cowspiracy exposes the fishing industry and its damaging impact on our oceans What starts with documenting the harm that humans do to marine species quickly evolves to uncovering the alarming global corruption sustainability issues and a scary path to environmental destruction This eyeopening documentary exposes how the global industrial fishing industries are killing our oceans out of sight Blackfish Netflix A movie that delves into the complex and complicated issue concerning the behavior of killer whales both in and out of captivity Although killer whales are sometimes known to be gentle giants in the wild they also have the capability to be quite vicious This documentary takes a deeper look into the performing whale Tilikum and the lives he has taken while captive You ll leave with a newfound respect for animal sanctuaries and disdain for theme parks like SeaWorld that use these majestic animals for entertainment and profit If creatures of the sea are as important to you as they are to us make sure to learn more about the practices of shark finning and its impact on our oceans The Cove Netflix A dolphin lover s worst nightmare captured in real life this important film is not for the faint of heart This documentary expands its story to include a passionate plea for all people to help our oceans and sea creatures An electrifying movie that will leave you breathless and also committed to making a difference for our precious ocean life Dominion A dark undercover Australian documentary that presents modern agricultural practices through the lens of drones hidden and handheld cameras Often considered the new Earthlings the movie explores the horrible conditions that animals have to suffer through and questions the validity and morality concerning the dominion of humans over animals This film is a must watch but bring a friend to hold and a box of tissues Earthlings A heartbreaking and highly sensitive documentary for anyone who wants the honest truth about society s treatment of animals Although extremely painful to experience it s almost a necessary undertaking to absorb the fullest extent of an animal s experience in the world at the present If you are on the fence about becoming vegan this movie narrated by Joaquin Phoenix will change your mind in minutes Vegucated A simple but satisfying movie that attempts to alter the appetites of three meat and cheese loving native New Yorkers This documentary follows these vegan hopefuls over a six week period and shares their progress as well as their pitfalls Entertaining and slightly educational it s well worth watching Sharkwater The Winner of International Awards this electrifying movie narrated by Rob Stewart takes a deep dive into the shark filled waters of our oceans This documentary explores the lives of sharks first hand while also exposing the shark finning industry and the ruthless exploitation and corruption of the shark population A must see for all sea creature loving humans Fat Sick Nearly Dead Joe Cross takes us on his day juice only journey to optimal health This documentary is not only enormously inspiring but also addicting to watch with its positive vibe and down to earth approach You ll find yourself yearning for your own fresh fruit juices and glowing health by the end of it The Ghosts In Our Machine An illuminating photojournalistic journey into the lives of animals in all sectors of industry throughout the world This compassionate vegan documentary follows JoAnn McArthur s entire year of capturing the behind the scenes stories of several animals in all parts of the world Through food fashion research and entertainment you will experience what it might be like for an animal stuck in the machine of our modern world The Witness A gripping and painful story of Eddie Lama whose violent and difficult life growing up in Brooklyn NY caused an epiphany concerning the plight of animals Because of his own experiences with exploitation and trauma he could much easily sympathize with the suffering of animals who also have no one advocating on their behalf An inspiring story of creative animal advocacy that will leave you motivated to take action Peaceable Kingdom The Journey Home This emotional and intense documentary offers a groundbreaking look at farmers and their lives It takes you behind the scenes of small farms showing the challenges they face each day With thoughtful transitions it explores how social economic and psychological pressures shape their world The film dives deep into the complex bond between farmers and their animals It reveals how these animals are seen as commodities while also being loved deeply by their caretakers Through honest and candid storytelling it sheds light on a way of life full of contradictions The Smell Of Money This documentary follows Elsie Herring and her community in eastern North Carolina where they battle a powerful hog industry s pollution and encroachment on their land Through a nine year legal fight they strive for clean air pure water and freedom from the stench of pig waste This powerful film underscores the strength of love for family and community against overwhelming odds urging viewers to consider their food choices and join the fight for a better future Food Inc Explore the hidden truths of the food industry and its impact on our health the environment and animal welfare in this documentary Eating Animals Based on Jonathan Safran Foer s bestselling book this documentary investigates the ethical and environmental consequences of factory farming The True Cost While not strictly vegan this documentary explores the fashion industry s impact on the environment and highlights the importance of sustainable cruelty free fashion choices Rotten A docu series that dives deep into the global food industry examining issues like honey fraud the avocado trade and the challenges faced by small scale farmers Eating You Alive Renowned doctors and nutritionists discuss the profound health benefits of a plant based diet in preventing and reversing chronic diseases The Last Pig Follow the poignant journey of a pig farmer who confronts the emotional and ethical complexities of his profession as he transitions to a more compassionate way of life Eating Our Way to Extinction Explore the interconnectedness of our food choices climate change and the future of our planet in this thought provoking documentary I Could Never Go Vegan I could never go vegan is a phrase heard worldwide Filmmaker Tom Pickering takes a closer look at the arguments behind it questioning their validity and uncovering the truths that shape opinions about veganism Milked Milked is a powerful documentary that uncovers the secrets of the dairy industry It reveals the impact on animals the planet and human health With heartfelt stories and clear facts it inspires change for a better future Poisoned This gripping documentary is about food safety in America It uncovers the hidden dangers in the food system and their impact on lives Through real stories and expert insights it pushes for change to protect everyone The End of Meat This documentary explores a future without meat It shares stories of innovation animal welfare and environmental care With hopeful ideas and real examples it inspires a kinder healthier world Cows This documentary tells the story of a farmer s brave decision to stop raising cows for meat It explores his journey to transition to a more compassionate and sustainable way of farming Through thoughtful interviews and stunning visuals it highlights the challenges and hope of choosing a kinder path Days Mini Documentary Finally don t miss our own mini documentary about what days of plant based eating did for this man s health We guarantee you ll be amazed You can watch right now in just minutes This short and satisfying mini documentary follows one man s journey from fast food to plant based eating in just seven days It shows how one week of vegan meals transformed Raul s health and lifestyle With simple swaps affordable ingredients and friendly support his experience is both relatable and inspiring His blood pressure dropped his fear of diabetes faded and he felt better than he had in years The film highlights how small changes can lead to big results It s a must see for anyone curious about taking the first steps toward a plant based diet It s not the strongest of species that survive nor the most intelligent but the one most responsive to change Charles Darwin Vegan Movie Night Tips From delicious plant based snacks to cozy drink ideas you ll have everything you need to set the perfect vibe Grab your favorite blanket pick a great film and get ready for an evening full of tasty treats Make sure to have a box of recycled tissues or an eco friendly handkerchief just in case Create a Snack Spread Prepare a variety of vegan snacks to keep everyone happy Think vegan popcorn with nutritional yeast veggie platters with hummus or plant based chocolate bars A snack buffet adds a fun interactive element to the night Don t forget the vegan candy Try a Themed Dinner Take inspiration from the film and create a meal to match Watching a documentary about plant based eating Whip up a delicious vegan pizza or veggie packed tacos for the full experience Set the Scene Make your space cozy and inviting with blankets pillows and dim lighting A relaxing atmosphere helps everyone enjoy the movie and feel more connected to the experience Have a Post Movie Discussion After the film gather your thoughts and share them with friends or family Talk about what you learned your favorite moments or even new ideas to try It s a great way to bond and reflect on the message of the documentary Incorporate Fun Drinks Serve up tasty vegan drinks like herb infused water fruity mocktails or dairy free hot chocolate Pairing the snacks with refreshing beverages keeps everyone energized and excited More Vegan In recent years there has been a significant rise in the popularity of plant based diets including vegetarianism and veganism People are increasingly opting for these dietary choices due to various reasons such as ethical concerns environmental sustainability and health benefits What is vegetarianism Vegetarianism is a dietary practice that involves abstaining from the consumption of meat poultry and seafood However there are variations within the vegetarian spectrum such as lacto vegetarianism including dairy products ovo vegetarianism including eggs and lacto ovo vegetarianism including both dairy and eggs The fundamental principle of vegetarianism is to adopt a diet primarily based on plant foods Several factors have contributed to the increasing popularity of vegetarianism in recent years These include Health concerns Many individuals are becoming more health conscious and recognize the potential health benefits associated with a plant based diet Research suggests that vegetarian diets when well balanced can reduce the risk of chronic diseases such as heart disease high blood pressure and certain types of cancer Ethical considerations The ethical treatment of animals is a significant driver of vegetarianism People are increasingly concerned about animal welfare and choose to avoid consuming meat due to the ethical implications of animal farming practices vegetarian diets when properly planned can offer various health benefits including Increased antioxidants Many plant based foods are rich in antioxidants which can help protect cells from oxidative damage and support overall immune function Reduced risk of chronic diseases Vegetarian diets are often rich in fruits vegetables whole grains and legumes which can help reduce the risk of heart disease high blood pressure type diabetes and certain cancers Weight management Many vegetarian foods are lower in calories and fat which can contribute to healthier weight management and reduce the risk of obesity Vegetarian diets typically provide high amounts of dietary fiber which is essential for healthy digestion and can help prevent constipation Better heart health A vegetarian diet is often lower in saturated fats and cholesterol which are linked to better cardiovascular health and lower blood cholesterol levels Enhanced kidney function Studies have shown that plant based diets may reduce the risk of kidney disease and may be beneficial for people with existing kidney conditions Improved blood sugar control The emphasis on whole plant foods can help stabilize blood sugar levels which is especially beneficial for individuals with or at risk of diabetes Start with small changes Transitioning to a plant based diet doesn t have to be overwhelming Start by making small gradual changes to your meals and gradually reduce your reliance on animal products To ensure you re getting a well rounded and balanced plant based diet focus on incorporating nutrient dense foods into your meals Here are the key considerations Developing a weekly meal plan Set aside some time each week to plan your meals Create a menu that includes a mix of breakfast lunch dinner and snacks Make a shopping list based on your meal plan to ensure you have all the necessary ingredients on hand Batch cooking and meal prepping for convenience Dedicate a few hours on the weekend to batch cooking staple ingredients like grains beans and roasted vegetables Making plant based swaps in traditional recipes Adapt your favourite recipes by swapping out animal products with plant based alternatives Cheers to a plant powered joyful life

nutrients which can easily be avoided by eating the right foods and the occasional supplement Research has found that the benefits of participating in Veganuary lasted far beyond the days According to a survey by Veganuary over of participants reduced their meat intake by half or more even after six months Many participants started liking meat less Avoiding meat also affected their sense of selves and their outlook on meat Researchers at the University of Exeter found that many participants started liking meat less even finding it disgusting as published on The Conversation Participants in veganism for days it equates to the emissions of million flights from London to Paris Long term if someone were to replace half of their meat and milk consumption with vegan alternatives it would be teaspoon garlic powder teaspoon onion powder teaspoon salt teaspoon black pepper INSTRUCTIONS In a large bowl mix together the soy protein isolate textured vegetable protein liquid smoke garlic powder Women In Wellness Dr Erica Belton Of Nature s Nectress On The Five Lifestyle Tweaks That Will Help Support People s Journey Towards Better WellbeingAn Interview With Wanda MalhotraWhen you begin a new role make it a point to emphasize the importance of work life balance right from the start Establish boundaries early in your career to maintain that balance It is crucial for your well being helping you stay productive avoid burnout and find fulfillment in your job Plus it ensures you have time to enjoy meaningful moments with family and friends Today more than ever wellness is at the forefront of societal discussions From mental health to physical well being women are making significant strides in bringing about change introducing innovative solutions and setting new standards Despite facing unique challenges they break barriers inspire communities and are reshaping the very definition of health and wellness In this series called Women in Wellness we are talking to women doctors nurses nutritionists therapists fitness trainers researchers health experts coaches and other wellness professionals to share their stories and insights As a part of this series we had the pleasure of interviewing Dr Erica Belton M D Dr Erica Belton M D is a highly accomplished board certified physician and certified aromatherapist She has a solid clinical background and over thirty years of experience in advanced medical care Dr Belton s career is marked by her extensive knowledge of internal medicine and expertise in clinical policy development Beyond her medical achievements Dr Belton is the innovative founder of Nature s Nectress a brand dedicated to organic skincare and haircare solutions Her passion for natural eco friendly alternatives underscores her holistic approach to health and wellness seamlessly blending science with nature to promote well being inside and out Thank you so much for joining us in this interview series Our readers would love to get to know you better Can you share your backstory with us I am honored to be part of this interview series I was born and raised in Philadelphia and completed my undergraduate studies at Boston University After graduation I returned to Philadelphia to attend Temple University School of Medicine where I earned my medical degree I am board certified in Internal Medicine In my free time I enjoy gardening planting flowers growing tropical fruits cultivating orchids and practicing yoga I also love taking walks with my furry friend Beauregard I enjoy visiting botanical gardens on my travels which has always been a personal passion of mine It helps me better understand the plants and trees that are the basis for today s medicines During my travels I look for specific plants whose flowers leaves seeds and roots are used to make essential oils used in aromatherapy Can you share the most interesting story that happened to you since you started your career What were the main lessons or takeaways from that story Absolutely One of the most rewarding moments in my career occurred when I transitioned from clinical medicine to eventually venturing into the beauty industry with the launch of Nature s Nectress I suffer from histamine intolerance and multiple chemical sensitivity Oftentimes people may suffer from many different symptoms yet they are unaware they have these conditions Starting Nature s Nectress was not merely a business endeavor it grew from a personal need for holistic skincare Despite having over years of experience in the medical field I grew increasingly frustrated by the limited availability of effective solutions that met my skincare and haircare needs given my multiple chemical sensitivity This ultimately motivated me to take a new direction and create a brand to address these challenges As the founder of Nature s Nectress I combined my medical education and aromatherapy knowledge with my dedication to offering clean beauty solutions There were many valuable lessons but one key takeaway is that the journey in life can lead you down unexpected paths with personal struggles opening doors to new and exciting opportunities These challenges can ultimately allow you to positively impact others in ways you never imagined From a young age I aspired to be a physician and never anticipated entering the beauty industry However my own health struggles with histamine intolerance and multiple chemical sensitive and personal journey in that space have allowed me to touch lives in ways I never expected by starting Nature s Nectress It has been said that our mistakes can be our greatest teachers Can you share a story about a mistake you made when you were first starting Can you tell us what lesson you learned from that It is crucial to recognize the significance of maintaining a healthy work life balance and prioritizing self care Early in my career I was not aware that I had histamine intolerance a condition that worsens with long working hours poor sleep and inadequate nutrition The key takeaway is that when beginning a career you must integrate activities you enjoy such as daily exercise maintain a nutrient rich diet and allocate time for relaxation Let s jump to our main focus When it comes to health and wellness how is the work you are doing helping to make a bigger impact in the world I have histamine intolerance a condition that affects about of people worldwide mostly middle aged women Some symptoms are digestive issues skin irritation and headaches which can be challenging to treat if the underlying cause is not know While might sound like a small number dealing with chronic issues like these can have a significant impact on daily life and overall health Many people with histamine intolerance and multiple chemical sensitivites struggle to find skincare and haircare products that work for them Since the skin is the largest organ avoiding products with harmful ingredients is essential Unfortunately many beauty products contain hormone disruptors or ingredients that can cause irritation or allergic reactions I created Nature s Nectress whose products are free from QUATS parabens paraffins phthalates phenoxyethanol petrochemicals synthetic fragrances and sulfates These are safe gentle options for anyone looking for cleaner beauty products especially those dealing with sensitivities or allergic reactions Can you share your top five lifestyle tweaks that you believe will help support people s journey towards better well being Reducing Toxin Exposure Our everyday environment is full of toxins from the products we use in our homes to personal care products and the air we breathe Many skincare and haircare items contain chemicals that can disrupt hormones You can gradually detox your home by substituting harsh cleaning products for natural alternatives like vinegar baking soda essential oils lemon and castile soap It is also important to detoxify your body as well The primary way to detoxify the body is through the skin lungs kidneys colon and liver You can detoxify the skin by exercising using saunas or doing activities that induce sweating Detoxification promotes overall better health and wellbeing Exercise Exercising both indoors and outdoors with proper sun protection has its advantages Sunlight boosts vitamin D levels enhances mood and strengthens the immune system while exercise promotes physical strength flexibility and heart health and releases mood boosting endorphins It is important to choose activities you enjoy so it does not feel like a daily chore Personally I enjoy using my Peleton and Powerplate vibration machine while listening to my favorite music Social Interaction Being actively involved in your community fosters a sense of belonging and enhances happiness Social engagement helps reduce feelings of isolation and creates connections with others with similar interests Your community offers a supportive network of friends and peers There are numerous opportunities for social interaction such as volunteering at hospitals and churches coaching sports teams assisting at homeless shelters or serving on local organization boards Since I enjoy gardening I enjoy volunteering my time to beautify neighborhoods with plants Good Nutrition with Adequate Hydration Your body is about water Drinking enough clean water every day is key to staying healthy and keeping your skin in great shape Hydration helps your skin retain moisture keeping it soft smooth and less prone to dryness or irritation It also supports your skin s elasticity helping it stay firm and bounce back reducing the look of fine lines and wrinkles Drinking water also helps your body flush toxins giving you clearer healthier skin Along with drinking plenty of water hydrating skincare products are a great way to keep your skin looking and feeling its best Prioritizing Mental Wellness It is important to put mental wellness first so we can handle stress stay balanced and feel our best You can prioritize mental wellness by setting aside time in the morning before you start your day Also having my own little quiet retreat really does wonders for your mental health The special area can be a small area of your home with some of your favorite pictures and items that bring you joy to look at It is important to take a few minutes throughout the day to reset and have stillness If you could start a movement that would bring the most amount of wellness to the most amount of people what would that be My movement would be to start a holistic health movement focusing on the benefit of being present in the moment and aware of how you are feeling mentally and physically Once you acknowledge how you are feeling in the moment you can focus on wellness practices such as exercise healthy nutrition and stillness I aim to make many people aware that mental and physical health are connected Focusing on mindfulness and holistic well being could help reduce stress and anxiety while improving mental health globally Everyone faces daily challenges and this kind of movement could build resilience assisting people to approach life with a more positive mindset People can pay more attention to their physical health and be more resilient By encouraging healthy habits and community involvement the movement could lower rates of lifestyle related diseases and boost overall well being What are your Things I Wish Someone Told Me Before I Started and why When you begin a new role make it a point to emphasize the importance of work life balance right from the start Establish boundaries early in your career to maintain that balance It is crucial for your well being helping you stay productive avoid burnout and find fulfillment in your job Plus it ensures you have time to enjoy meaningful moments with family and friends Prioritizing exercise and good nutrition as part of your daily routine offers numerous benefits for both physical and mental health The benefits are increased energy ability to handle stress and overall sense of well being Asking for help when you start a new job helps you learn faster avoid mistakes and get to know your coworkers It shows that you value the importance of being part of a team Request regular feedback on your performance throughout the process This will allow you to recognize areas for improvement while identifying your strengths boosting your confidence Take time to envision where you see yourself in the future It arrives quicker than anticipated By considering your long term goals you can thoughtfully assess opportunities as they come making you a more discerning decision maker when evaluating career paths Sustainability veganism mental health and environmental changes are big topics at the moment Which one of these causes is dearest to you and why Prioritizing your mental health and well being is crucial Focusing on your well being makes you better equipped to handle life s challenges This clarity helps you steer every part of your life in the direction you want to go Ultimately this should lead to happiness wellness and longevity What is the best way for our readers to further follow your work online Readers can visit the official website of Nature s Nectress at naturesnectress com And check for Nature s Nectress on popular social media platforms such as Instagram Facebook and YouTube Thank you for these fantastic insights We wish you continued success and good health Women In Wellness Dr Erica Belton Of Nature s Nectress On The Five Lifestyle Tweaks That Will Help was originally published in Authority Magazine on Medium where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story

The vegan diet is made up entirely of plant based foods no meat no fish no eggs no dairy and no other animal derived products But is it a healthy way to live or are there risks of missing out on vital nutrients In this article we ll take a deep dive into the vegan diet exploring its health benefits potential pitfalls and tips on how to maintain a balanced sustainable plant based lifestyle Over the last decade veganism has skyrocketed in popularity driven by growing concerns about the environment animal welfare and the increasing body of evidence showing the health benefits of a plant based diet Whether you re considering going vegan or simply curious about how it works this guide will walk you through everything you need to know What is Veganism The term vegan was coined by the British Vegan Society in but the concept of plant based eating has existed for centuries Originally members of the society were known as Non Dairy Vegetarians but they soon adopted the term vegan which they felt better reflected the philosophy of excluding all animal products Veganism is a lifestyle and ethical choice that goes beyond just food For many it s not just about eating plant based meals but also avoiding animal products in clothing like leather personal care such as cruelty free cosmetics and other aspects of daily life But why do people choose to go vegan There are three main reasons people adopt a vegan diet Ethical reasons Many people choose veganism to prevent animal cruelty and exploitation This includes avoiding animal based products such as leather and honey and opting for cruelty free skincare and household products Health reasons Research has shown that a plant based diet can have various health benefits from reducing the risk of heart disease to aiding weight loss Many people choose to go vegan for these potential health improvements Environmental concerns Veganism is seen by many as an eco friendly way of living as the production of plant based foods generally has a smaller carbon footprint than animal farming What Can You Eat on a Vegan Diet One of the common misconceptions about veganism is that it s restrictive In reality there s a huge variety of plant based foods to choose from many of which are both delicious and nutritious Here are some examples of foods you can enjoy on a vegan diet Fruits and Vegetables All fruits and vegetables are vegan friendly from apples and oranges to leafy greens like kale and spinach You can also enjoy root vegetables like carrots and sweet potatoes as well as non starchy vegetables like peppers mushrooms and aubergines Nuts and Seeds Almonds cashews peanuts and sunflower seeds are all great sources of healthy fats and protein They also provide essential vitamins and minerals like vitamin E and magnesium Grains and Legumes Whole grains such as rice barley quinoa and oats are staples in a vegan diet Beans and legumes such as lentils chickpeas and kidney beans are excellent sources of protein iron and fibre Dairy Alternatives There are plenty of non dairy alternatives available today such as plant based milks oat almond soy coconut and dairy free cheeses made from nuts or soy These can be used in place of traditional dairy products in most recipes Processed and Convenience Foods Vegan junk food You bet Oreos Jammie Dodgers Pringles and other processed snacks are all technically vegan although not always the healthiest options While it s best to focus on whole unprocessed plant foods these snacks can help make the transition to a vegan diet easier Surprising Vegan Foods Did you know that even some sweets and snacks are vegan friendly Popular brands like Skittles Jelly Tots and many supermarket doughnuts don t contain any animal derived ingredients making them a surprising but tasty part of the plant based diet Health Benefits of the Vegan Diet Veganism is widely recognised for its health benefits especially when it comes to heart health weight management and reducing the risk of chronic diseases Heart Health One of the biggest benefits of a vegan diet is its potential to lower the risk of heart disease Since plant based diets are naturally low in saturated fats and cholesterol they can help reduce blood pressure and lower the levels of bad cholesterol LDL in your body The vegan diet is also rich in antioxidants and anti inflammatory compounds found in fruits vegetables and whole grains which can reduce the risk of developing cardiovascular diseases Research has shown that vegans tend to have lower blood pressure healthier cholesterol levels and a reduced risk of stroke Lower Risk of Obesity A vegan diet can also help with weight management as plant based foods are generally lower in calories compared to animal products Furthermore the high fibre content in fruits vegetables legumes and whole grains helps to keep you full for longer making it easier to control your weight However it s important to note that a vegan diet can still be unhealthy if you rely heavily on processed vegan junk food like vegan cheeses fried foods or refined sugars The key is balance ensure that your diet is nutrient dense with plenty of whole plant foods Cancer Prevention Eating a wide variety of fruits vegetables and legumes is associated with a reduced risk of developing certain types of cancer For example cruciferous vegetables like broccoli contain sulforaphane a compound that may help to protect against cancer Tomatoes are rich in lycopene an antioxidant that has been shown to reduce the risk of prostate cancer Additionally the vegan diet excludes processed meats like bacon sausages and deli meats which are known carcinogens Many plant based foods including soy products like tofu and tempeh contain isoflavones natural compounds that may help reduce the risk of breast cancer Gut Health The high fibre content of a vegan diet is incredibly beneficial for gut health Fibre is essential for feeding the healthy bacteria in your gut keeping your digestive system running smoothly A healthy gut microbiome is linked to better digestion immune function and even improved mental health Can the Vegan Diet Be Unhealthy As with any diet it s possible for a vegan diet to be unhealthy if not carefully planned Just because something is vegan doesn t automatically mean it s healthy Highly processed vegan foods such as white bread crisps and sugary snacks can be high in fats and sugars while lacking in essential nutrients To ensure that your vegan diet is healthy it s important to focus on whole plant foods such as fruits vegetables whole grains legumes nuts and seeds Be mindful of processed foods and limit your intake of refined carbohydrates and sugars Key Nutrients to Watch on a Vegan Diet When transitioning to a vegan diet there are certain nutrients that need extra attention as they are found in lower quantities in plant based foods Here s a rundown of the key nutrients to be mindful of Vitamin B Vitamin B is crucial for producing red blood cells and maintaining a healthy nervous system As it s primarily found in animal products vegans need to find alternative sources Vegan friendly options include fortified foods like nutritional yeast plant milks and breakfast cereals It s also a good idea to take a B supplement as deficiency can lead to serious health issues like anaemia and nerve damage Vitamin D Vitamin D is vital for maintaining strong bones and a healthy immune system While our bodies produce vitamin D from sunlight it can be harder to get enough during the winter months especially in countries with limited sunlight Vegans can look for fortified foods or take a vegan friendly vitamin D supplement to meet their needs Iron Iron is essential for transporting oxygen around the body While plant foods contain non heme iron which is not as easily absorbed as the heme iron found in meat you can still get plenty of iron from plant sources such as lentils chickpeas tofu and dark leafy greens To improve iron absorption pair iron rich foods with vitamin C rich foods like oranges or bell peppers Omega Fatty Acids Omega fatty acids are important for brain health and reducing inflammation While omega s are primarily found in fatty fish vegans can get them from flaxseeds chia seeds walnuts and algae based supplements Protein Despite the myth that vegans don t get enough protein plant based diets can easily meet protein needs Sources of vegan protein include lentils chickpeas tofu tempeh edamame quinoa and a variety of seeds and nuts Just be sure to eat a diverse range of protein sources to ensure you re getting all the essential amino acids your body needs Is the Vegan Diet Worth Trying With proper planning a vegan diet can be a highly nutritious and sustainable way of eating The health benefits are undeniable including a reduced risk of heart disease obesity cancer and other chronic conditions Plus a plant based diet is better for the environment and kinder to animals If you re interested in making the switch it s easier than ever with the growing availability of vegan products recipes and even delivered vegan meals straight to your door Ultimately the vegan diet isn t as restrictive as many people think and with the right balance of nutrients it can be an incredibly healthy and fulfilling way to eat If you want to explore prepared vegan meals or vegan frozen meals look no further than Root Kitchen Are you thinking of going vegan Or do you have any questions about veganism Let us know in the comments below

From news com As the world continues to recognise the benefits of plant based living the industry is paving the way with innovative culinary creations and convenient snacking solutionsWith the increasing awareness of the environmental and health benefits of plant based diets more people are making conscious efforts to incorporate vegan choices into their lifestyles January often marked by resolutions and fresh starts is an ideal time to explore the diverse and delicious world of plant based eating Whether it s trying out a new plant based dish at home or opting for guilt free snacks there has never been a better time to embrace a sustainable and health conscious lifestyle The Growing Appeal of Veganism Dheeraj Mathur Cluster Executive Chef Radisson Blu Kaushambi Delhi NCR highlights the ethical and environmental motivations behind veganism stating Veganism is becoming increasingly common as more people learn that they can help prevent animal suffering and deaths by replacing foods and other products of animal origin with options that don t involve the exploitation of animals A plant based diet offers numerous health benefits and contributes significantly to reducing carbon footprints Mathur points out Studies demonstrate that a shift to plant based diets rich in pulses nuts fruits and vegetables could lead to substantial reduction of greenhouse gas emissions as compared to current dietary patterns in most industrialized countries This transition not only helps mitigate climate change but also improves overall health by reducing the risk of cardiovascular disease type diabetes and other diet related noncommunicable diseases The World Health Organisation also supports plant based diets emphasising that reducing livestock herds can lower methane emissions a major contributor to global warming Mathur further explains Cattle produce methane as part of their normal digestive process and when cows burp the methane is released into the atmosphere Methane is also produced when animal manure is stored or managed in lagoons or holding tanks Exploring New Culinary Horizons For those looking to explore plant based options Mathur recommends taking advantage of the fresh produce available in January The Indian market offers a variety of fresh vegetables such as carrots spinach sarson ka saag hara choliya turnips beetroots brinjals methi broad beans radishes green peas mushrooms cabbages and cauliflowers Some popular vegan dishes to enjoy during winter include poha dosa besan chila and choley bhaturey Mathur shares his personal favourites My favourite dishes in January are aloo cholia baingan ka bharta saag and beetroot ka halwa I have also modified some dishes like tofu palak replacing paneer mushroom chettinad and vegetable korma to align with plant based choices Healthy Snacking for a Plant Based Lifestyle As plant based diets become more mainstream snacking has taken on a new significance Salloni Ghodawat Director COO Ghodawat Consumer Ltd emphasizes the importance of innovative vegan snacking options With the increasing adoption of plant based diets during Veganuary snacking has taken on a new significance in this journey To Be Honest TBH offers an innovative range of vacuum cooked plant based vegetable chips from bold flavours like Tangy Chickpeas with Chili and Lime to Purple Sweet Potato with Pani Puri Masala Ghodawat underscores TBH s commitment to sustainability and health conscious choices Our low oil nutrition retaining cooking process reflects our commitment to sustainable practices and healthier choices Veganuary inspires us all this January to make small but meaningful changes for our well being and the planet TBH is committed to supporting and participating in this collective effort by providing tasty plant based snacking options that align with these values As the world continues to recognise the benefits of plant based living the industry is paving the way with innovative culinary creations and convenient snacking solutions Whether it s trying out a new plant based dish at home or opting for guilt free snacks there has never been a better time to embrace a sustainable and health conscious lifestyle https www news com lifestyle food embracing a plant based lifestyle environmental and health benefits html

Switching to a vegan diet was one of the most rewarding decisions I ve ever made but like many I initially worried about getting enough protein If you re reading this you might be feeling the same Rest assured hitting your protein goals on a vegan diet isn t as hard as it seems once you know where to look and how to plan it becomes second nature Let s dive into how you can fuel your body with plant based protein while still enjoying delicious satisfying meals Why is Protein So Important Protein is the building block of our muscles skin and hair and it even supports your immune system Whether you re working out chasing kids around or simply trying to stay healthy protein gives you the strength and energy you need When I first went vegan I realized that plant based protein wasn t just good enough it could easily match or surpass my previous diet in quality and variety My Go To Plant Based Protein Sources Here are some of my personal favorites that help me hit my protein goals every day Legumes I love making big batches of lentils chickpeas or black beans at the start of the week They re perfect for soups salads or even tossing into pasta Lentils g protein per cup cooked Chickpeas g protein per cup cooked Tofu Tempeh and Edamame These are lifesavers I usually marinate tofu or tempeh overnight and air fry or stir fry them for a quick protein packed meal Tofu g protein per cup Tempeh g protein per cup Edamame g protein per cup cooked Quinoa and Other Grains Did you know quinoa is a complete protein I like to mix it with roasted veggies and a tahini dressing for a quick satisfying dinner Quinoa g protein per cup cooked Nuts and Seeds I always keep a jar of almond butter and a bag of chia seeds in my pantry They re great for smoothies oatmeal or even snacking Almonds g protein per ounce Chia seeds g protein per tablespoons Plant Based Protein Powders I m not going to lie there are days when I m rushing out the door and a protein shake saves me My go to is a pea protein blend with frozen bananas and almond milk How I Plan My Meals to Hit Protein Goals If you re like me and love a bit of structure here s a typical day of meals Breakfast A big bowl of oatmeal topped with chia seeds almond butter and fresh fruit Sometimes I make a tofu scramble with veggies if I m craving something savory Lunch A quinoa salad loaded with chickpeas kale avocado and a zesty lemon tahini dressing Snacks Roasted chickpeas or a handful of mixed nuts always keep me satisfied between meals Dinner Stir fried tempeh with broccoli carrots and edamame served over brown rice Post Workout My favorite recovery smoothie pea protein powder spinach frozen mango and almond milk Lessons I ve Learned About Vegan Protein Don t Stress About Perfection When I first started I worried about getting complete proteins in every meal But guess what Your body is smart it combines amino acids from everything you eat throughout the day Meal Prep Makes Life Easier I m a big fan of batch cooking Having prepped lentils grains and veggies in the fridge saves so much time during the week It s Okay to Lean on Convenience Foods While I love cooking life gets busy I ve learned to keep a stash of protein bars frozen edamame and even store bought vegan burgers on hand for those hectic days You ll Discover Amazing New Foods Going vegan introduced me to foods I d never tried before like hemp seeds nutritional yeast and tempeh They re now staples in my kitchen Busting the Myths About Vegan Protein Myth You Can t Build Muscle on a Vegan Diet Truth There are countless vegan athletes proving this wrong every day Personally I ve felt stronger and more energized since going plant based Myth You ll Always Feel Hungry Truth Plant based proteins are incredibly filling especially when paired with fiber rich foods like veggies and whole grains You ve Got This Reaching your protein goals on a vegan diet isn t just doable it s empowering Once you get into the groove you ll feel amazing knowing your meals are nourishing your body and aligning with your values Whether you re new to veganism or just looking to fine tune your diet remember that it s all about progress not perfection Experiment with different recipes enjoy the process and trust that you re fueling your body the right way Let s inspire each other to stay strong and healthy

The Battle of the Eras reunion had a random segment that looked at spicy comments Amanda made One of these was a tweet where she expressed her disdain for the vegan options on the show Clearly this was targeted at Tori who is a vegan and has allegedly had veganism written into her contract So Tori defended vegan options during eating challenges because there are equally gross foods that don t hurt animals Specifically she pointed to the gross smoothie that they were forced to eat during Flying Around on the World Championship The cast was split on this topic Jordan said that being vegan is a choice while Nehemiah a devout vegan thinks making the Challenge more inclusive of dietary needs is a good thing If you re a longtime Challenge fan you ll know that eating challenges have historically involved meat or other non vegan foods in some capacity People have broken their vegan diets to compete over the years like Diem during the Battle of the Exes final Kellyanne during the Family Dinner challenge on Bloodlines or Nehemiah on the All Stars final Usually these meaty meals appear to be gross but they re delicacies in other countries Challenge seasons are set all over the world but the locations often get ignored on more recent seasons Sometimes including these delicacies is the only real connection to the season s setting and relying on vegan friendly foods can remove that connection This can be seen on the Ride or Dies final when the cast was eating spaghetti and ice cream in Argentina For many people this is the turning point when veganism replaced meaty cultural dishes in the final Likely because this is the season when Tori mentioned her vegan diet and it started to get discussed online This forced Tori to be the face of Challenge vegans even though there have been many others before her In actuality Tori likely isn t the first person to demand a vegan option on the show On The Challenge USA the season filmed directly before Ride or Dies the final included an eating portion This season was also filmed in Argentina and the cast had to eat onions garlic and lemon juice Most people found this disgusting but vegan chef Angela had a delicious snack as she gleefully poured lemon juice on the onion Likely Angela is the vegan trailblazer Veganism is part of her online brand so it s awfully suspicious that she was in the first final to skip the meat This season set the precedent and most of the eating challenges since then have been much less disgusting Rather they rely on massive quantities super spicy foods and smelly dishes It should be noted that meat isn t entirely off the menu we saw tuna smoothies on Battle for a New Champion It s only omitted if one of the competitors doesn t eat meat I don t think meat is necessary to make the challenge difficult but the eating portion is supposed to be an equalizer Allowing a small group of people to have influence on the menu kind of defeats the purpose Usually this also removes any cultural significance of the food and replaces it with dishes that are merely uncomfortable At this point on The Challenge the entertainment value of eating competitions is almost gone It might just be better to exclude eating challenges altogether if the regional dishes aren t vegan Luckily Vietnam had soy based foods and durian to gross out people on season but the vegan dilemma is probably the reason we didn t see a real eating portion on the Battle of the Eras final in the Philippines

The average global temperature has reached C above preindustrial levels highlighting the urgent impact of climate change Significant greenhouse gas emissions stem from animal agriculture A shift to plant based diets supported by policy changes and consumer education is essential for addressing this issue and promoting sustainable food systems

Ah veganism That magical land where people assume you live off lettuce and sad tofu while wistfully staring at other people s cheeseburgers If you ve ever considered eating more plant based meals but gave up because you thought it required monk like discipline and an affinity for plain quinoa I have excellent news You re doing it wrong The easiest way to eat vegan isn t by chaining yourself to the health aisle at your local grocery store or committing to a lifetime of kale smoothies though if that s your jam no judgment The secret Go global That s right The simplest most delicious and least soul crushing way to enjoy a vegan diet is to embrace international cuisine Because guess what The world s best plant based meals were never designed to be sad replacements for meat they were just naturally perfect without it So let s ditch the expensive ultra processed faux meats and dive headfirst into a pantry that can actually make your taste buds happy Step Away from the Bland and Step Into the Spice MarketFirst things first let s talk about what most people get wrong about vegan food the lack of flavor If you ve been suffering through unseasoned chickpeas and boiled vegetables I have two words for you spice rack The reason people think vegan food is boring is because they refuse to season it properly But global cuisines Oh they don t play that game From Indian curries bursting with cumin turmeric and garam masala to Ethiopian stews simmered in fiery berbere spice blends the world has already figured out how to make plants taste amazing So if you re serious about this stock your pantry with cumin coriander smoked paprika cardamom turmeric ginger fennel seeds sumac and for the love of all things flavorful chili flakes Your food should slap not whisper Legumes The OG Protein SourceIf one more person asks where vegans get their protein I might stage an intervention Before the world became obsessed with protein powders entire civilizations were thriving off lentils beans and chickpeas without feeling the need to blend them into a sad vanilla flavored shake Middle Eastern cuisine has hummus and ful medames Ethiopian food has misir wat Indian cuisine has dal in more variations than you have excuses for not cooking it Mexican dishes revolve around beans that taste like actual joy You re not suffering You re just not using your pantry correctly Keep your shelves stocked with red lentils green lentils black beans kidney beans chickpeas and split peas and learn how to actually cook them with spices instead of just boiling them into oblivion Rice Noodles and Flatbreads Because You re Not a RabbitLet s kill this myth that vegan eating is all about munching raw vegetables like a sad domesticated rabbit The truth Some of the most satisfying carby and downright indulgent meals on the planet are already vegan or just a tweak away Think Thai curries over jasmine rice Vietnamese pho easily made with vegetable broth and tofu Ethiopian injera with rich spicy lentil stews Middle Eastern mujadara lentils and rice with caramelized onions Japanese miso ramen and Indian dosas filled with spiced potatoes None of these dishes make you feel like you re sacrificing a thing Why Because they were already designed to be delicious Fermented Foods Because Flavor is a LifestyleIf you re going global with your pantry you need to get into fermented foods These umami packed flavor bombs take plant based meals from meh to holy crap this is amazing A few must haves Miso paste Japanese Stir it into soups marinades and dressings Kimchi Korean Fermented spicy cabbage that makes every rice dish sing Soy sauce tamari Chinese Japanese Because bland food is a crime Sambal oelek Indonesian A chili paste that s not playing around Preserved lemons North African Middle Eastern Add them to tagines stews and salads for an instant upgrade Fermented black beans Chinese A deeply funky salty ingredient that makes stir fries and braised dishes unforgettable Coconut Milk Nut Butters Because Creaminess MattersOne of the biggest misconceptions about vegan food is that it s always light and boring Nope Global cuisine already knows how to make plant based meals rich creamy and decadent without relying on dairy Enter coconut milk Whether it s simmering in a Thai curry enriching a Caribbean rice dish or forming the base of a creamy Indian korma this is an MVP in any plant based kitchen Then there s nut butters If you ve never added peanut butter to a West African groundnut stew or tahini to a Middle Eastern dressing you re seriously missing out Almond butter cashew cream and sesame paste are here to ensure you never have to endure a sad watery soup ever again Fresh Herbs Citrus The Ultimate Game ChangersHere s a hard truth If your food feels meh it probably just needs fresh herbs and a squeeze of citrus Thai food isn t complete without fresh basil and lime Mediterranean dishes sing with mint and parsley Mexican food without fresh cilantro and lime juice is an actual crime Indian chutneys made from fresh coriander and mint elevate any meal instantly The point Keep your fridge stocked with cilantro mint parsley basil and green onions Then make sure you have lemons limes and vinegars like rice vinegar balsamic and apple cider on hand at all times They ll save any dish from being basic Sauces Condiments Because You Deserve More Than KetchupLet s be real No one wants to eat plain rice and beans every day The real secret to making vegan food addictive Sauces Some absolute essentials Harissa North African A fiery chili paste that makes everything better Gochujang Korean Sweet spicy and fermented magic Tahini Middle Eastern A nutty creamy dream for sauces and dressings Chili crisp Chinese Crunchy spicy umami packed goodness Hoisin sauce Chinese Think of it as a sweet thick Asian BBQ sauce Tamarind paste South Asian Southeast Asian Adds a tart sweet depth to curries and sauces Final Thoughts Veganism Doesn t Have to Be a PunishmentAt the end of the day going plant based doesn t mean you have to suffer through bland uninspired meals The real trick is to stop thinking like a vegan and start thinking like a global foodie So stock your pantry with flavors from around the world learn how to actually season your food and stop pretending tofu is supposed to taste like chicken Because once you realize that the best plant based dishes were never trying to be a sad imitation of something else you ll never feel like you re missing out again Now go forth and season your food properly Your taste buds deserve it

Some may hate this post and try to convince me otherwise Others may rejoice and agree This post is not a cry for support because I m such a strong person I don t need anyone to validate me Nor do I care if people try to hurt me or insult me This is the result of years of meditation you just don t care what people think of you it s all irrelevant I share because this is my journey and perhaps my journey will inspire someone else Or not Only sociopaths think they are right all the time I was wrong Dead wrong During my four years of being vegan I tried to remain neutral and of the mindset we can all get along I only had one vegan necklace and one f ck eating animals t shirt I didn t go on any protests or vandalize anything But I m upset about two things I had my photo taken by PETA holding a Meat is Murder sign at a Morrissey concert Telling countless people how great I felt being vegan I also look much younger than my age and have great skin which I inherited it wasn t because I was vegan People were listening to me for that reason Now I feel so guilty I feel like an imposter I gave out wrong information about how great it was being vegan For the first few years it actually was great Then out of nowhere I was depressed for no reason at all You read my blogs I have it all the great life the amazing husband career To get up in the morning and not want to do the things you love and it s all an effort That is no way for anyone to live And then my skin started drying out something I never had a problem with and I had lower backaches and joint pain I said to my husband I think I m going to add back fish I m here now just two weeks of adding back fish eggs chicken grass fed beef and raw goat s milk yogurt and butter which I order from a farm Mentally I m feeling amazing I have my lust for life back I m happy go lucky me again No more back pain and my skin is getting soft again I watched many YouTube videos Why I m no longer vegan That helped me so much as well as the testimonials on Reddit Every day another person questions veganism it seems These people don t know me but I want them to know how much I appreciate their honesty and bravery for coming forward They are all godsends I was told I was brave too Years ago when I was vegetarian and then added meat back for the first time in years I lost friends and was verbally abused with comments like peace begins on your plate and a woman shoving an anti butter article in my face the same woman who came to one of my paleo lectures and challenged me from the audience These people were not my friends At the time I felt so good adding the meat back I should have stuck to that protocol Then I got brainwashed into veganism again I frequent a lot of health food stores and go to health expos and there are vegans everywhere I saw vegan athletes and told myself if they are athletes and thriving I can do this too because I love animals so I went vegan again with help from a vegan health coach Now I know different that animals die no matter what diet you re on and I felt like garbage anyway It s a lose lose Do I continue to be a martyr for the animals while my own cats pick up on my stress But wait the truth is VEGANISM KILLS ANIMALS Yes you heard that right Veganism kills animals More animals than the meat and dairy industry does Also researching and learning how the agriculture industry kills so many rabbits mice etc I accepted the hard truth that animals die for our food Those fields are just as disturbing as the slaughter house I ve seen the video footage and photos And you can too by doing a search on YouTube In a Utopian world we d all live happily among each other and wouldn t need animals to survive but it s not that way We have to disassociate from the animals at large and just worry about our own pets My mom was a heart patient and an animal valve helped her live longer And she loved animals feeding the squirrels outside in her wheelchair in her later years before she passed Other hard facts Organic vegetables What is in the soil Chicken bones manure compost So much for vegan In order for anyone to eat human or animal another animal dies It s a sad hard truth and the sooner you disassociate from the source of your food the better off you ll be mentally And before my vegan friends get mad at me please read my words MOST not ALL Sadly MOST vegans do not think out of the box it s their way or the highway They live by a script they refuse to deviate from They are like heartless robots with no compassion I can share my negative views about visiting the PETA house but I ll save that for another time Vegans who are not heartless and judgmental I feel are the exception to the rule as I was when vegan Honestly I never fit in with vegan culture and argued with many vegans because of their strict views During my time as a vegan I remained friends with meat eaters never pushed my vegan views on my family never went on an illegal protest I am proud of myself for that Personally because again I am not seeking acceptance with this blog post It is not important Worse of all I do not like that vegans who force their cats to eat a vegan diet which is not right Cats can not be vegan I never fed my cats vegan during my time as a vegan Though one of them loves pumpkin that s a treat not a meal And let me tell you another thing about vegans and cats Vegans hate cats Extreme vegans They do not like animals who eat other animals I tried so hard to get PETA to take down an influencer who was abusing her cat by teasing it and then sharing the videos of the cat hissing on Instagram and YouTube thinking it was funny All the evidence was there She was easy to track down PETA lied and said they were on it They weren t They did NOTHING Even if their petitions seem legit don t sign them PETA is useless And I hate myself for posing with a Meat is Murder sign at a Morrissey concert and they took photos of me That s one of my biggest vegan regrets Even more regretful than getting sick on veganism There s a story about a vegan woman you can Google and find it yourself I m not making this up who fed her cat a vegan diet Again cats can not be vegan She went out and the cat ate the hamster Of course the cat ate the hamster The poor sweet thing was starved for nutrition You do not feed cats lettuce and expect a good result So what did this nut case do She took the cat to be euthanized She said I can t have a cat They eat other animals And she took the poor thing to be put down Unbelievable How is that vegan How is that not animal cruelty The vegan hypocrisy goes on and on and on and on and on Vegans do not love animals They only love farm animals Or so they think Duped by veganism In the past two weeks of being non vegan the more I research and learn I am disappointed at the vegan community for all the lies they spread whether intentional or in my case as a vegan ignorance I wish I did all the research before going vegan again back in My husband used to joke She s a vegan but she hates vegans I thought that was hilarious We had so many laughs over that with non vegans Why I was a vegan who disliked other vegans How they won t listen to reasoning How they judge everyone How they argue so harshly and say the most vile things to people who aren t vegan They make stuff up just to win arguments and attack you personally making stuff up But more scary AI and Google are not ideal for information You have to talk to people and dig If you re considering being an ex vegan If you re considering being an ex vegan I highly recommend the book The Vegetarian Myth by Lierre Keith It s an eye opener The back of the book has an extensive bibliography backing up everything she wrote I can t turn back time but I m sorry I was ever vegan Though I m proud that I didn t judge people and never let veganism taint my friendships with non vegans and that I still dined with non vegans and never judged what was on their plates I ll continue using cruelty free vegan make up products because that s what I was doing since the s Unless I learn otherwise because I m on a constant quest to up my game in all areas of my life At first I thought I d always be a vegan at heart But I have to disagree with that mindset because it s just not a good movement There s a vegan script you have to go by and any deviation or questioning even if you re vegan you ll get nailed to the cross What does that say Cult This is all a learning experience I m now buying all my food from farms and mom and pop health food stores I no longer go to Whole Foods or other supermarkets Instead of supporting vegan restaurants I m now supporting farm to table restaurants I m looking forward to the day when I can ditch all the vegan supplements save money and just live my life without worrying about what nutrient I m missing because I m not eating right Two weeks of being non vegan may be too soon to give up on supplements but I ll know when the time is right Veganism is dropping by the masses I m in a few anti vegan groups now on social media Every single day there s at least one person saying they are no longer vegan It s a dying culture Celebrities who were long time vegans are dropping out Athletes admit they can t be vegan anymore I know someone personally who said they couldn t be vegan because it gave them brain fog Even supermarkets like Trader Joe s and Whole Foods are ditching their vegan products because people aren t buying them like they used to Anthony William aka The Medical Medium a diet heavy on fruits and protein in the evening only had a video saying that veganism is going to be out by Which of course is this year Ex vegans in the limelight include Steve O Miley Cyrus Russell Brand and Lizzo Natalie Portman became an ex vegan while pregnant You can truly go down an ex vegan rabbit hole I m finding more ex vegan stuff everywhere than I see vegan stuff I can go on and on but choose to stop here Again if someone wants to send me hate mail don t waste your time because again I m not affected by it and you won t change my mind nor make me upset Save your energy Last but not least do not call me a murderer because technically you are too Unless you re living on air an animal had to die for your food including your vegan food And if you want to tell me I was never really vegan I won t argue with you Maybe deep down I never really was Contact Maryanne Christiano Mistretta at maryannechristiano gmail com

Decided it s time for a lifestyle change Here s why you should consider going vegan There s plenty of good to be said about reducing our meat consumption Not only is it beneficial for the planet but it s also great for your health and even your pocket As with most things in life you can either dive straight in and go cold turkey pardon the pun or ease into it with something like embracing Meat Free Mondays We spoke to well known vegan chef Chef Sue about her journey and the advice she has for those just starting their vegetarian adventure and why she thinks you should consider going vegan Chef Sue explains I started my vegan journey nine years ago After a festive season of overindulgence I decided to sign up for Veganuary and try a plant based diet It turned out to be one of the best decisions I ve ever made I felt so energetic and good As a South African entrepreneur and vegan chef I m thrilled to share my passion and explain the transformative benefits of this lifestyle It s good for your health your pocket the planet and animal welfare Budget Friendly Tips Veganism is one of the most affordable diets to follow To keep it budget friendly stock up on staples like lentils beans rice and grains in bulk to reduce costs significantly Shop for seasonal fruits and vegetables and consider starting your own veggie garden it s rewarding and economical Additionally meal planning and cooking in batches can help stretch your food budget further A Flavourful Adventure Awaits One of the most common misconceptions about veganism is that it lacks flavour and variety As a chef I can assure you that the world of plant based cuisine is bursting with creativity and inspiration exclaims Chef Sue Imagine vibrant dishes celebrating the rich tapestry of global flavours from spicy Indian curries to hearty Italian pastas and everything in between Embracing a new diet is an opportunity to explore unique ingredients and cooking techniques Chef Sue encourages Experiment with spices fresh herbs and seasonal vegetables that may never have crossed your plate before You might find yourself whipping up a mouthwatering chickpea and lentil curry or indulging in a decadent vegan chocolate brownie made from sweet potato The possibilities are endless and I guarantee every meal will be a delightful discovery Health Benefits You Can Feel Transitioning to a vegan diet can have profound health benefits Research shows that a well planned vegan diet can reduce the risk of chronic diseases including heart disease diabetes and certain cancers By incorporating more fruits vegetables whole grains legumes and nuts into your meals you ll be fuelling your body with essential nutrients and antioxidants that promote overall well being For those who feel overwhelmed by the idea of going vegan remember it s a journey Start simple Try one or two plant based meals a week then gradually expand your repertoire You ll be amazed at how quickly your taste buds adapt and how much energy you ll gain from this wholesome way of eating A Sustainable Choice for the Planet In a world increasingly affected by climate change every small action counts Adopting a vegan diet is one of the most impactful choices you can make for the environment Chef Sue explains As a South African entrepreneur I am passionate about advocating for local and sustainable farming practices By embracing veganism you also support local farmers and businesses that prioritise ethical and sustainable food production Where to Start If you re unsure where to begin visit Chef Sue s website or her vegan restaurant where the joy of plant based cooking is celebrated They offer a variety of dishes highlighting the vibrant flavours of South African cuisine all made with love and creativity As we embark on this new year I invite you to embrace veganism with an open heart and mind Explore the deliciousness of plant based cuisine prioritise your health support the planet and practice compassion Chef Sue says Whether you go fully vegan or try a few plant based meals every step counts Let s make this year a celebration of flavours health and kindness paving the way for a more sustainable and compassionate future Together we can make a difference one meal at a time The Vegan Chef Chef Sue Catch Chef Sue at the Homemakers Fair Chef Sue will share her vegan wisdom tips and hacks at this year s Homemakers Fair Visit her in the Food Theatre in Hall A from Friday February to Sunday March Read more about the expo here FREE Delicious Vegan Recipe Chef Sue from The Vegan Chef has shared one of her most mouthwatering vegan recipes with us Discover the most delectable recipe for Roasted Spicy Cabbage Wedges with Creamy Bean Pur e that s sure to tantalise your tase buds Find the full recipe here Connect With Chef Sue Website theveganchef co za Facebook facebook com theveganchef Instagram instagram com theveganchef TikTok tiktok com theveganchef X x com theveganchef YouTube youtube com theveganchef Contact Email info theveganchef co za The post Why You Should Consider Going Vegan appeared first on Homemakers Online

In stark contrast to much of the Western world people who live on the Greek island of Ikaria have a good chance of making it into their s in good health Experts speculate there are a few reasons for this One is regular exercise Ikaria is mountainous so just visiting a shop is physically demanding Another is a strong sense of community which keeps rates of depression low And another is diet Jump to the foods Ikaria is one of the world s five official Blue Zones Like Okinawa in Japan and Nicoya in Costa Rica its population follows a to percent plant based diet And we re not talking vegan meats and processed foods but rather fresh fruits leafy greens grains beans and legumes So is a plant based whole food diet the best for senior health If Blue Zones are anything to go by it certainly appears that way Here we take a closer look at why Diet and aging Research confirms that as we age the type of food we eat becomes more important than ever That s because bodies start to change as they get older muscles bones and organs need more support from vital nutrients Thinning skin for example is a common symptom of aging But this makes it harder to absorb vitamin D from the sun Vitamin D is important for calcium absorption so this in turn can lead to a calcium deficiency Both of these nutrients can be topped up through diet Wellness Gallery Catalyst Foundation Pexels Protein is also key as it helps to preserve muscle mass Without it elderly people are at a greater risk of muscle deterioration which can lead to mobility issues and slower recovery from illness One study published in The Journals of Gerontology found that out of senior people those who ate the most protein were percent less likely to become functionally impaired Potassium omega magnesium and iron are also common deficiencies in older people According to the British Geriatrics Society percent of people aged over in the UK have anemia A plant based diet supports senior health Diet can help to play a role in maintaining optimal senior health which may in turn reduce the risk of certain diseases The World Health Organization notes that the risk of dementia for example is lowered when people follow a nutritious diet and limit their alcohol intake among other healthy behaviors And the Alzheimer s Society acknowledges evidence that a diet rich in fruits vegetables and cereals and low in red meat and sugar may help to reduce the risk of developing the disease Adobe Research also suggests that a diet high in plant foods can reduce the risk of heart disease type diabetes and some types of cancer all of which are common causes of death among elderly people While some people may be tempted to believe that veganism is a diet for young people the fact is that there are many benefits to eating vegan foods for seniors says registered dietitian Amber Dixon MPH who is also a geriatric nurse and founder of Elderly Guides a platform that provides health resources for seniors and their families She reiterated that it may reduce the risk of dementia as well as help people to maintain their weight Eating vegan means you will be getting plenty of fiber and complex carbohydrates she notes Which helps you feel fuller longer and also helps regulate blood sugar levels Are more seniors in the West looking to plant based foods In general the stereotypical boomer approach to food is healthier than modern diets It makes sense they grew up at a time when ultra processed foods were scarce and most meals were cooked from scratch Diets were generally healthier than today with people eating more vegetables and milk and far less fat and sugar Katherine Howells PhD of The National Archives in the UK told Metro People were more aware of the importance of seasonal produce having been involved in growing vegetables during the war Back then people did eat meat but it was nowhere near as much as we eat today Research suggests for example that a serving of meat would have been around grams and this would have been shared with all of the family members But as boomers age their diets are changing Some are eating more processed foods but others are leaning towards vegetarian and vegan diets Canva According to Vegetarian for Life a UK nonprofit dedicated to supporting senior citizens who follow vegan or vegetarian diets more than percent of care homes in the UK currently have at least one vegetarian resident This is a significant rise since when more than percent of care homes had a vegetarian in residence According to Vegetarian for Life the numbers are set to grow even more By the nonprofit notes the number of vegetarian residents could double Vegan diets are less common in UK care homes but they are still present the research noted that percent of care homes have at least one vegan resident and this is also set to grow in the coming years By Vegetarian for Life notes that there could be people in British care homes who follow a vegan diet This is why the nonprofit is
